loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
Natividad es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 5 hijos de 3, 6, 9, 10 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta ambulante de refrigerio.
Ella es buena madre, constante y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘el torno’ área rural que se encarga de acopiar la producción agrícola de la zona.
Natividad es morena de baja estatura y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (sentada la primera de la derecha con su niño en brazos), su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, bien en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los socios tiene negocios como; venta de refrescos, venta de comida, elaboración de sombreros de sao, artesanía en cuero, venta de cerámica, venta de ropa de segunda mano y tienda de barrio. Su negocio es la venta de refrigerio, los refrigerios sándwiches de pan de miga con jamón y queso, puede ser con pollo y tomate las variedades son según los ingredientes  de temporada, “vendo ambulantemente y recorro las mismas calles donde tengo clientes fijos y otros casuales…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con rutas establecidas y clientes fijos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar insumos de cocina por mayor como; jamón, queso, pan y otros. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina para preparar refrigerios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Natividad solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina para preparar refrigerios.
texts.en:
Natividad is 36 years old. She lives with her partner and has 5 children, of 3, 6, 9, 10, and 12 years of age. Her business is selling snacks as a street vendor. She is a good mother, constant, and very hard-working. She carries out her job in the locality of "El Torno," a rural area that is in charge of collecting the agricultural production of the area.

Natividad (sitting all the way to the right with her son in her arms) is dark-haired, short in height, and physically robust. Her native tongue is Guarani and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner, who works in agriculture, and with her sons, who attend school. They live in their own home, constructed of wood, that has electricity and well water.

The necessity to better her business led her to lead the communal bank. The members have business like: selling soft-drinks, selling food, making straw hats, making leather crafts, selling pottery, selling second-hand clothes, and running a corner shop. Her business is selling snacks, including sandwiches made with a specific type of loaf bread, ham, and cheese, and which can have chicken and tomato. The varieties depend on the ingredients of the season. "I sell while traveling, and I go over the same streets where I have regular clients and other casual clients," she comments. The advantage of her business is that she counts on established routes with regular clients. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy cooking supplies like: ham, cheese, bread, etc.

Her dream is to have a stable business. She wants to buy cooking supplies to prepare snacks. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 2 years that this activity has been carried out. For these reasons, Natividad asks for a loan to buy cooking supplies to make snacks.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies to prepare snacks.

loans.name: Globe1 Group

texts.en:
Imelda is the featured borrower in Globe1 group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been best friends since they arrived to Lebanon to work as housekeepers to support their beloved families.
Imelda is the first lady at the far right side of the picture, she is a 46-year-old married mother of eight children, who is working hard as a house keeper to support her children back in the Philippines.

Her loan will be sent to the Philippines, to pay for her children increasing school tuition fees.
Judith is a married mother of one child; at the center of the picture; while Cristy is 41-year-old married mother of three, at the far left side of the picture. Their acquired loans will also be sent to cover their children school tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees in the Philippines

loans.name: Maya

texts.en: Maya is a 32 year old Lebanese married woman of three school aged children. Her husband represents the main income provider in his family, he works as a soldier in the Lebanese army for many years. His income is barely sufficient. That’s why currently, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children's stationery and books for the school with the aim to insure them a good education.

loans.use: to pay her children's stationery and books.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 21-year-old woman living with her husband and child. Her husband, who works for a company, is the main income source in the family, while she is a housewife taking care of her family.

Due to hard financial circumstances and the aim of helping her child with his education, Zeinab is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay his school fees. Her only dream is to ensure that he has a good life.

loans.use: to pay her child's educational fees.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 24 year old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and three children who are still studying. She is a housewife taking care of her children all the time, as per her husband, he is the main income provider in the family and working so hard to help his beloved family to live in good conditions. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them at school. The parents’ only target is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them at school

loans.name: Zedong

texts.en:
Zedong is a 59 year’s old divorced man who is living alone. Five years ago, he was forced to divorce with his wife for his family met some bad situation. And his child who is working outside all the year round. Also he needs to support his mother, who is almost 80 years old.

He rented a room and decorated it as a tea house. Without many acquaintances and friends, his business is stagnant. He requested ￥5,000 from MicroCred, he will use part of the money to buy new equipment to expand his business, and he will use the rests to stock daily necessities. Zedong describes himself as very diligent and honest. His dream is to provide a better life for his mother.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for his tea house

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shenaz, 32, is a married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children. Her whole family fully dependent upon her husband.

Her husband owns a workshop in which he provides the services to fix, paint and assemble the bodies of auto rickshaws. He removes the dents on rickshaw bodies and paints them for renewal. He wants to buy damaged rickshaw for renewal, then to sell them, but does not have enough cash in hand .
Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband so he can be able to buy damaged rickshaw bodies for renewal then reselling in the market. In this way he can easily generate maximum profit after renewal and selling rickshaw's body.
Shenaz is very thankful to Kiva and field partner brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a damaged rickshaw body for her husband's workshop, so he can renew it and resell.

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en: Sophat’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sophat makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 51-year-old married Palestinian father of six children. He started twenty five years ago working in the construction field specialized in concrete pasting to cover the needs and expenses of his family. Also he opened a plant nursery, as a second source of income, to increase his income.
Although he has two businesses, his income is still not enough, thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his son's university tuition fees. he hopes to expand his businesses more in the future to stay capable of providing his family with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his son's university tuition fees

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 57-year-old, Lebanese divorced woman and mother of three children. Her oldest child is the main source income. She is very tender and cares a lot about all of her family members. Today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her children’s educational fees. She tends to help them and to provide them with a good education. This is her second loan and she wants to express her thanks for it.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en: Mirvat is a 34 year old married woman. She is living with her husband and six children, all of them are still attending school. She is a housewife where she is dedicated to her home and family. Her husband is the main income provider but his income is barely sufficient. That’s why, today, she is asking to take a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l;   She will be utilizing the loan to pay her children’s educational fees.  She said that this loan will surely helped her to insure the school year for them what makes her very happy

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: May

texts.en: May is a 30 year old married woman living with her husband and mother of three school aged children. She doesn't work, she is only focusing on her family and her husband represents the main source of income for the family. Due to the hard financial situation, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s study fees. Her purpose is to ensure her children to achieve high educational levels to be competitive with others.

loans.use: to pay her children’s study fees

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saleh would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest market price, in order to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Saleh can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest market price. As a Babban Gona member, Saleh will also benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare.

Saleh is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is 37-years old lady and she lives with her husband and four children. She is taking a loan for purchasing raw materials for hand made embroidery. Her whole family is involved in this business. All of them are very expert in their professions and make very fine bridal dresses at home.

Due to demand, they are facing the shortage of material and unable to make fine embroidery. Therefore, she is requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can reduce the shortage of embroidery raw materials. Through this amount she will buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, precious stones, sequins, and pearls of various colors. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy embroidery’s raw material for her self embroidery work.

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en:
Sadaf is 32 years old married woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 1 child. Sadaf has been running her own beauty saloon for past 15 years, so she also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore Sadaf has applied for Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.
For this financial assistance, Sadaf is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Vern's Group

texts.en: Vern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vern makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Rabee

texts.en: Rabee is 33, married, and has 2 children. Since his father's death, he became financially responsible for his aging and sick mother. He has a small cattle fattening project and is requesting 7000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to make more cheese and butter which allows his wife to sell them in the local market.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle for milk to make butter and cheese for sale.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a 46-year-old resident of Quezon City, Philippines and a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She is currently involved in selling frozen foods such as tocino, sausages, hotdogs and the like. She is earning about 11,000 PHP each month.

Since there’s always an increased market demand for these items, Lilibeth dreams of having her business expanded where she can offer complete products to customers. She also aspires to be able to set aside regular savings every week for the future needs of her family. However, she’s still lacking the capital to run her business, which is why she decided to applied for a 10,000 PHP loan. The amount will be used to buy frozen foods to add to her business inventory, and she prays that readers will consider her story.

On a weekly basis, Lilibeth regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, gain business experience, and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy inventory of frozen foods.

loans.name: Rakhmanbek

texts.en:
Rakhmanbek is a 19 years old freshman at AUCA. He believes that our future depends on technology that is being developed today. He points out the lack of good software engineering specialists not only in Kyrgyzstan, but also in the whole world. According to his words, many AUCA Alumni of SFW Program have gained success in IT after graduation and many of them work at well-known giant companies as Google, Cisco, etc. He hopes that AUCA will give him the same opportunities and abilities to be smart and get the best education.

Rakhmanbek is applying for a Kiva loan because of the lack of money to pay for his university tuition fee. He comes from a family of 5: his mother, two brothers and younger sister. He says that his mother struggled a lot to support them and to give them a good education. At school Rakhmanbek and his siblings tried to get just A’s because that decreased schooling costs. His mother used to teach Latin at one of the local universities, but the salary didn’t cover their expenses and she was forced to quit, now she is unemployed.

Rakhmanbek says that he has a great motivation to study at AUCA and will do it with a pleasure. He believes that software developers’ average wage is very satisfactory, so he will be able to help his family and return a Kiva loan after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his BSc. degree in Software Engineering.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en: Mostafa is a 44=year-old married man living with his wife and three children who are still attending school. He is the main source of income for the family. He works as a taxi driver in order to fulfill their needs. His work is good so far but does not meet all their needs. That’s why Mostafa is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay his children’s school fees. He said that this loan will help him to become a better supporter to his family.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en: Majida is a 42 year old married woman living with her husband and mother of three children. Her husband is the main income source in the family, he works as an employee in a company and works also as an electrician. With the aim to help her children with their education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay their school educational fees. Her only dream is to ensure them a healthy life and help them to achieve high educational levels and being always able to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to pay school educational fees.

loans.name: Yomna

texts.en: Yomna is a 25 year old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two aged school children. She has worked as a private teacher since 2009 to offer her family with additional financial support. She loves her profession and always gives the best education she can. She arranged a special room in her house to receive students and also she visits them at their places. Today, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a scientific encyclopedia to improve her teaching skills and therefore increase her income. She notes that these purchases will facilitate her work preparation and wishes to receive additional students in the coming school season

loans.use: to purchase a scientific encyclopedia

loans.name: Dandja Marie

texts.en: Dandja Marie signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Dandja Marie is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Kader

texts.en:
Kader is 18 years old. She goes to school and also earns money by selling beauty products on a network system. She started this by getting her own beauty products at cheap prices and later on started selling to her friends and neighbours. With the help of the loan from Maya she bought products in bulk and increased her profit. In the future she wants to have a good profession.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Kader hanım 18 yaşında. Hem okuluna devam ediyor hem de kendi harçlığını çıkarıyor. Network sistemiyle güzellik ürünleri satan Kader Hanım bu işe ilk önce kendi kişisel ihtiyaçlarını daha ucuza almak için girmiş. Daha sonra arkadaşlarına ve çevresine satış yapmaya başlamış. Mayadan aldığı kredi ile toptan ürün siparişi vererek ürünleri daha ucuza aldı ve kar oranını artırdı. Gelecekte okulunu bitirerek iyi bir meslek sahibi olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for re-sale.

loans.name: Jamilu

texts.en:
Jamilu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Jamilu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Jamilu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Jamilu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Jamilu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/hectare.

Jamilu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 48-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three sons and two daughters. Her children are doing their study. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 4 years. Her husband is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Yasmeen's husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Yasmeen is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy clothes for her husband's clothes business.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en:
Yohanna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yohanna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Yohanna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Yohanna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Yohanna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is maize farmer from Liman village. As a member of Babban Gona, Samaila is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Samaila is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lima-Malma Abdu

texts.en:
Lima-Malma Abdu is a Babban Gona farmer.  Lima-Malma Abdu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Lima-Malma Abdu would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan Lima-Malma Abdu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Lima-Malma Abdu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Lima-Malma Abdu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to increase his farmland and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Halisu

texts.en:
Halisu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Halisu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Halisu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Halisu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Halisu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Halisu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university  education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Hafizu

texts.en:
Hafizu is a Babban Gona farmer.  Hafizu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Hafizu would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan Hafizu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Hafizu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Hafizu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to increase his farmland and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest market prices, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, he can store his maize and then sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest price. As a Babban Gona member, he will also benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare.

Yahaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community on his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 23-year-old Lebanese married woman with one school-aged child. Her husband is the main income provider in the family. He owns a mobile shop.

Fatmeh at this time is in a real need of a little help from Kiva. For that reason, she is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child’s educational fees to register him for the coming school year. She said that she is happy that she will be able to ensure for him a suitable education.

loans.use: to pay her child’s educational fees.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is a 47 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, one of them still studying. Her husband works as a plumber and as for her she works from home in selling industrial coal in order to fulfil their family needs and improve their lifestyle. Today, she is in need for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child school stationary fees and to buy his books. This makes her very happy that she will able to secure him a brilliant future.

loans.use: to pay her child school stationary fees and to buy his books

loans.name: Munevver

texts.en:
Münevver is a married mother of three. She sells Ersağ and knits babywear to make contribution to the family budget. For 9 years she has been selling Ersağ cleaning products via network and also her knitwear. With the help of this loan from MAYA she increased the variety of her products thus increased the number of her customers.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff:

Münevver hanım evli ve 3 çocuk annesi. Ersağ satarak ve bebek kıyafetleri örerek aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor. 9 yıldır ördüğü örgüleri ve ersağ temizlik ürünlerini çevresine satıyor. Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile ürün çeşitliliği sağladı böylece müşterilerini artırdı.

loans.use: to buy braid rope and cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 25, married, and has one child. He lives with his parents in the same house and has a small frozen meats store for which he pays rent. He is requesting 5000 EGP loan to buy frozen chicken, fish, and meat to expand his project and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy frozen chicken, fish, and meat.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 49-year-old married woman living with her five children in a rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by profession.

Safia's husband has been constructing buildings and houses for many years. He is very expert in his art. He has constructed a lot of beautiful buildings in his career. He uses tools such as a brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, jointer and level, which have been wearing out. He wants to buy new tools to continue his construction services, but he does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy these tools. Therefore, SAFIA has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can be empowered to buy tools for construction.

SAFIA thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy construction tools for her husband's work.

loans.name: Hameeda Begum

texts.en:
Hameeda is the age of 45 and a mother of five children living with her spouse and children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband owns a farming business. He has been working since 12 years to meet the family’s expenses.

Now her husband wants to invest in farming equipment for a proper income, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do so. Therefore Hameeda has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan,hameeda’s husband can spend it on equipments repairing to earn an income.
Hameeda and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy farming equipment for her husband.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Isah is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Isah would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isah will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/hectare, Isah now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Thank Lenders - Đông Lân2 Group

texts.en:
Hậu is 45 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling noodles for more than ten years.

Hậu lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Hậu faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to cook noodles for sale.

In 2013, Hậu joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hậu has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Hậu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase materials to cook noodles for sale.

loans.name: Bioysha

texts.en:
Bioysha lives in a rural area and she has a good opportunity to develop her business with animal husbandry. Her business is feeding cows, sheep, and selling milk products. She began this business 10 years ago because she needed to support herself after her husband died. She is her children's sole provider.

Bioysha now feeds 10 cows. She has a cowshed in her house. She also grows corn for cows in her orchard. She sells milk, sour-cream, and kefir from her house and many of her buyers are her neighbors. Her buyers are very happy with her products.

Bioysha is requesting a loan of 6,000 TJS to buy cows to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Manuel Jose

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre casado de 50 años de edad, el cual tiene dos hijos de 14 y 13 años, con su profesión de producción de lácteos busca generarles un excelente futuro y calidad de vida no solo a sus hijos, sino a su familia, pues viene de una descendencia de campesinos, arrieros y trabajadores que se quitan la comida de su boca con tal de dárselo a sus seres queridos.
Sus principales objetivos para su vida, son pagar la educación de sus muchachos, heredarles sus conocimientos y profesión y mejorarle la calidad de vida, sueños que de momento se están viendo afectados por la problemática global que hay en torno al precio de venta de leche.
Para contrarrestar este lío, el señor Manuel quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de dos vacas lecheras, busca aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 50-year-old married man.  He has two children who are 14 and 13 years old.  He is seeking to provide them with an excellent future through his dairy business, and give better living conditions not only to his children, but also his family, since he comes from a background of farmers, mule drivers, and workers who would take food off of their own plates to give it to their loved ones.  

His principal goals in life are to pay for the education of his sons and pass down his knowledge and profession, as well as improving their living conditions.  At the moment, these dreams are being affected by global problems that have occurred concerning the price of milk.  

In order to counteract this troublesome situation, Manuel wants to take out a loan to buy two milk cows and use them to increase his production.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows in order to increase his production.

loans.name: For A Better Future  - N1Trthi Group

texts.en:
An is 41 years old and she is married, but unfortunately her daughter was mentally ill. Her household was recognized by local government as poor, and moreover the market need is low in this region.

An lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has had a retail business selling incense and ghost money for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that An faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more incense and ghost money to resell.

In 2013, An joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is a reputable person in the community. An and four other women established the loan group For a Better Future - N1TrThi to get a loan and share experience in doing business for a better life.

With her business profit, An hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more incense and ghost money to resell.

loans.name: Diana Cristina

texts.es:
Ella es Diana, una mujer práctica, inteligente e ingeniosa, siempre le ha gustado todo lo relacionado con la moda, persiguiendo su sueño monto un negocio de confección directa, pues quiere sacar a flote y hacer de su pasión por la moda un medio de sustento para ella.
Su principal dificultad para seguir adelante con su trabajo es la falta de recurso para comprar maquinaria e insumos, pero todo puede cambiar, ya que puede recibir ayuda, un dinero muy necesario para comprar una máquina fileteadora, insumos y telas.
Su propósito es crecer y mantener a sus padres, ser reconocida por tener prendas frescas diferentes a lo encontrado en el mercado y que gusten.
texts.en:
This is Diana, a practical, intelligent, and ingenious woman.  She has always liked everything related to fashion.  To pursue her dream, she started a dressmaking business, since she wants to stay afloat and carry out her passion for fashion in a way that supports her family.  

When it comes to continuing forwards with her work, her main difficulty is the lack of resources to buy machines and supplies.  If she can receive help in the form of the money that she badly needs to buy an overlock sewing machine, supplies, and fabric, all of that can change.  

Her intention is to grow her business and support her parents, and to be well-known for making new garments that people like that are different from what they have come across in the market.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, supplies, and fabric.

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Él es Ruben es un hombre de 65 años de edad, todo un veterano de mil batallas, que se dedica a la producción de miel, tiene todo instalado en su finca, una que con tanto esfuerzo y noches de trasnocho logró construir, vive felizmente con su pareja, es un hombre humilde que tiene como mayor deseo, tener salud y fuerza para levantarse y trabajar.
Ruben actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo ya que necesita comprar cajones para los panales, comprar trajes y empaques para su producto.
texts.en:
Ruben is a 65 year old man, a veteran of a thousand battles, who works producing honey. He has everything set up on his firm, that he managed to build with much effort night after night. He lives happily with his partner. He is a humble man whose greatest desire is to be healthy and strong, in order to get up and work.

Ruben currently is seeking a loan since he needs to buy boxes for the honeycombs, and to buy suits and packaging for his product.

loans.use: to buy boxes for honeycombs, suits and packaging for his product.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 49 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Yasmeen has been running her own beauty saloon for past three years so she also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brushes and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore Yasmeen has applied for Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers, it will also helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance Yasmeen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy beauty creams for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Ella es Adriana, una madre soltera, cabeza de familia, con tres hijos, una persona que hoy se encuentra solicitando tu ayuda, pero no para mantenerse, un apoyo para consolidar un negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar, un préstamo que le traerá progreso, ella es humilde y lo acepta, no cuenta con muchos recursos para hacer crecer su negocio, principalmente porque sus obligaciones en su hogar le abarcan casi todo el dinero, pero su tienda es todo lo que tiene y por ello quiere luchar por crecer y vender mucho más, ya que espera ofrecer a su familia calidad de vida y un excelente futuro.
Por ello Adriana necesita de un préstamo que destinara en su totalidad en surtido para abastecer su negocio, pues como se ve en la foto, lo necesita de urgencia.
texts.en:
Adriana is a single mother, and the head of household with three children. She is a person who today finds herself seeking your help, but not for her own personal use but rather to strengthen her business selling staple goods -- a loan that will bring her progress.

She is humble and she accepts that. She doesn't have many resources to make her business grow, primarily because her obligations to her home require nearly all her money. But her store is all she has, and for that reason she wants to fight and sell much more, as she hopes to offer her family a quality of life and an excellent future. Accordingly, Adriana needs a loan that will be used in its totality to stock and supply her store, since as can be seen in the photo, she urgently needs to do so.

loans.use: to stock her store with staple goods.

loans.name: Charro Norma

texts.es:
Charro es una mujer de 28 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijas de 3 y 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de aceite y lubricantes. 
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy comprometida con su trabajo. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘chasquipampa’ caracterizado por su rápido crecimiento, anteriormente eran los pastizales para el ganado hoy convertida en una área residencial en constante crecimiento.
Charro es morena de baja estatura y vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que trabaja como chofer y con sus hijas que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta y cambio de aceite y lubricante, actividad que realiza en su tienda ubicada en su domicilio, “inicie mi actividad como ayudante, luego pude reunir el dinero para independizarme…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los productos no se vencen, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar mercadería. Su sueño es tener su casa propia, ella desea comprar lubricantes y aceites para abastecer su tienda. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Charro solicita un préstamo para comprar lubricantes y aceites para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Charro is a 28 year old woman, she is married and has two daughters, ages 3 and 9. Her business is selling oil and lubricants.
She is a good mother, independent and very committed to her work. Her business is located in the zone Chasquipampa that is characterized by its rapid growth. Previously there were pastures for the cattle and today they have been converted into a residential area in constant growth.
Charro is dark-skinned and short. She dresses traditionally (sombrero, sweater and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymará and she also speaks Spanish.
She shares her life with her husband who work as a driver and her daughters who study in school. They live in a rented house, which is made of bricks and has all of the basic services.
Her business is the sale and changing of oil and lubricants. She does this from her store which is located in her house. "I started this activity as an assistant and later I was able to save the money to become independent," she comments.
The advantage of her business is that her products don't expire. The disadvantage is the lack of funds to buy merchandise. Her dream is to have her own home. She wants to buy lubricants and oils to stock her store.
This is her first loan from the institution in the 8 years that she has been working in this area. It is for these reasons that Charro is requesting a loan: to buy lubricants and oils to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy lubricants and oils to stock her store.

loans.name: Grethel Yaosca

texts.es: Grethel es una mujer emprendedora de 25 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos por los que trabaja día a día para sacarlos adelante con sus esfuerzos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, carteras y cosméticos desde hace seis años, Ella ha mostrado ser una mujer responsable y puntual con los pagos de créditos anteriores, esta vez solicita el financiamiento número siete en la institución porque quiere invertir en la compra de camisas, pantalones, licras, chores y vestidos, con créditos anteriores logro comprar un televisor, su nuevo proyecto es vender cosas plásticas.
texts.en:
Grethel is an entrepreneurial 25-year-old woman.  She is in a relationship and she has two children.  She works hard every day to get them ahead.  She has made a living selling clothing, wallets, and cosmetics for six years.  She has shown herself to be a responsible and punctual woman with her payments for previous loans.  

This time she is requesting her seventh loan from the institution because she wants to buy shirts, pants, spandex, shorts, and dresses.  With her previous loan she was able to buy a television.  Her new project is selling plastic items.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, dresses and sandals.

loans.name: Vân's Group - Phú Quý

texts.en:
Mrs. Vân is 35 years old and married. She has had a manufacturing business sewing clothes for more than ten years. Vân lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, this job is unstable .

The main hardship that Vân faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine and material to do a tailoring service.

In 2014, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Vân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Vân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and material to do a tailoring service.

loans.name: Laazarus

texts.en:
Laázarus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. He hopes that he will have good harvest this season, which would create the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Laázarus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Laázarus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Laázarus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Laázarus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saifullahi

texts.en:
Saifullahi is a maize farmer from Gabas village. As a Babban Gona member, Saifullahi is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saifullahi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. Saifullahi will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Saifullahi no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD/hectare, Saifullahi hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a maize farmer from Galadima village. As a member of Babban Gona, Hannatu is excited about the opportunity to realise better yields on her farm. With Babban Gona’s support, she has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hannatu can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Hannatu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family, and in the end, hopes to use her increased earnings to ensure that all her children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Glacier Judit

texts.es:
Ella es Glacier una mujer con carácter fuerte, sería y enfocada en sus proyectos, a sus 42 años de edad es madre de 3 hijos adolescentes los cuales mantiene, puesto que se separó de su esposo quedando como madre cabeza de familia, vive del campo, nació en las zonas rurales de Lorica y se dedica la cría de cerdos. 

Glacier ha tenido varios inconvenientes climáticos y de enfermedades, en sus galpones ha presentado muertes, eso genera pérdidas y ya que su economía es apretada por el hecho de tener que ser el soporte monetario de su familia no se lo puede seguir permitiendo, por ello quiere solicitar un aliento económico para comprar materiales de calidad para la construcción de porquerizas, tales como cemento, zinc, madera, también comprara alimento, vacunas y cerdos.

Anímate a apoyar a una madre cabeza de familia del campo que hace un gran esfuerzo por mantener en buenas condiciones de vida a su amada familia.
texts.en:
This is Glacier, a woman with a strong character, who is serious and focused on her projects. At 42 years old she is the mother of 3 adolescent children whom she supports, since she separated from her husband, leaving her as the head of household. She lives in the country. She was born in the rural area of Lorica, and works breeding pigs. Glacier has had several drawbacks related to weather and sicknesses. She has had deaths in her barns, which cause losses. Now that her budget is tight, due to the fact that she has to monetarily support her family, she cannot allow this to continue.

For that reason she wants to seek economic support to buy quality materials for the construction of pigsties, such as cement, zinc and wood. She will also buy food, vaccines and pigs. Join in to help this head of household mother from the country, who works so hard to maintain her beloved family in good condition.

loans.use: to buy quality materials for the construction of pigsties, such as cement, zinc and wood.

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en:
Aliyu is maize farmer from Gabas village. As a member of Babban Gona, Aliyu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Aliyu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aliyu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Aliyu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahilla is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. She hopes for a good harvest this season, which could create the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rahilla would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Rahilla can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Rahilla will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Rahilla is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a university education.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Hany

texts.en:
Hany is 24, single, and lives with his mother and siblings. He has a small clothing and bedding project.

He is requesting 5,000 EGP to buy bed sheets and clothing to expand his project and increase his income, so he can afford his marriage expenses.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets and clothing.

loans.name: Ulan

texts.en:
Ulan is a freshman in the Software Engineering Program at AUCA. He is asking for a Kiva loan to cover part of his university tuition fee.

Ulan’s parents divorced 13 years ago and now he lives with his mother, grandmother and aunt. The reason that they live together is the lack of their own house. Ulan’s mother is a worker for an accounting firm. He thinks that his mother could change her work and earn more money, but she so loves her job and devoted to it that will not make such a step. Ulan’s grandmother is a pensioner. As with every old person, she often has health problems and she is happy to have her daughters and grandson with her, who help her financially and physically. The other thing that makes his grandmother happy is that his aunt is a doctor; thanks to her they can reduce their family’s medical expenses.

Ulan really wants to help his family and find a job, but understands that it will prevent him from concentrating on his studies. So he chooses to get a higher education first, then try to find a well-paid job and please his family members. He thanks Kiva for the opportunity and hopes to be one of the loan receivers.

loans.use: to pay for his Degree in the SFW Program.

loans.name: Inas

texts.en:
Inas is from Jenin refugee camp. She is single, 24, and lives alone. Inas owns a clothing shop inside her house, where she buys women's and kids' clothes; her customers are from her camp. She is very passionate woman and dedicated towards her work. She has been working in this business for 3 years but now she dreams to have an independent store containing of all kinds of clothes.

Inas applied for the loan to buy autumn and winter clothes in a large quantity. She is very thankful to the whole team in Kiva and its field partner Al-Ibdaa.

loans.use: to buy autumn and winter clothes in a large quantity, and sell them at retail to get high profits.

loans.name: Estefanny

texts.es:
Estefanny sigue soltera, ahora tiene un hijo y continúa con su negocio de sastrería. El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para comprar tela y materiales de sastrería, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque trabajo continuamente, actualmente cuenta con clientes continuos, la competencia no le ha quitado trabajo, “mi negocio mejora y las necesidades crecen…” cometa. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientela, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar una máquina de coser manual y rollos de tela. su sueño es tener su tienda propia y que sea conocida por todos, ella desea comprar una máquina de coser manual y rollos de tela para confeccionar. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Estefanny solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser manual y rollos de tela para confeccionar.
texts.en:
Estefanny is still single, she now has a child and continues with her business as a seamstress. She used the loan that she received to buy cloth and seamstress materials. She made her payments punctually because she was working continuously and currently has regular customers. The competition has not taken away her work. "My business improved and the needs grew," she comments.
The advantage of her business is that she can count on her customers but the disadvantage is the lack of funds to buy a manual sewing machine and rolls of material. Her dream is to have her own store that would be known by everyone. She would like to buy a manual sewing machine and rolls of material to use. This is the third loan that she has had from the institution in 6 years for this area of work.
It is for these reasons that Estefanny is requesting a loan: to buy a manual sewing machine and rolls of material to use.

loans.use: to buy a manual sewing machine and rolls of material.

loans.name: Bleider Brillit

texts.es:
Bleider es una mujer que todos los días quiere demostrar que es una gran empresaria que es importante para el hogar, que puede lograr a ser independiente económicamente, por ello montó negocio, su propósito es convertirse en la mejor criadora de cerdos, desbancar a los hombres en esta profesión y llevar a su familia al progreso, en especial a sus dos hijos.

Ella trabaja diariamente con una intensidad de 10 horas, buscando clientes, negocios, ofreciendo sus servicios, pone todas sus ganas y entusiasmo y aprende de cada experiencia.

Para un criador de cerdos lo más importante es la temporada navideña, por ello Bleider quiere solicitar un crédito para abastecerse y estar lista para la temporada, con el dinero comprara cerdos de cría, lechones, alimento y vacunas.
texts.en:
Bleider is a woman that wants to demonstrate each day that she is a great business owner who is important for her home, who can succeed, and be financially independent. For this reason, she opened her business with the purpose of becoming the best at raising pigs, out perform the men in her profession, and help her family progress, especially her two children.

She works daily for 10 hours, seeking out clients and business, offering her services, showing her desire and enthusiasm, and learning from every experience.

For a pig raiser, Christmas time is the most important season. For this reason, Bleider wants to request a loan to stock her business and be ready for the season. With the money, she will buy pigs to raise, feed, and vaccines.

loans.use: to buy suckling pigs to raise, animal feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Fevziye

texts.en:
Fevziye is 46 years old and has two children. After her husband was deceased her smallest son opened a small market in their neighbourhood. Fevziye sold her knittings, home-made jams and tomato pastes in order to make a contribution to the family budget. Sometimes she sold these on stands and increased the number of her customers. Fevziye has got her fourth loan and she wants to sell her products not only in her own town but also outside the city.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
46 yaşında olan Fevziye Hanım 2 çocuk annesi. Eşini kaybettikten sonra oğlu küçük bir mahalle bakkalı açmış. Evin bütçesine katkı sağlamak isteyen Fevziye Hanım da yaptığı örgüleri, reçel ve salçaları bu dükkan da satmaya başlamış. Bu ürünlerini bazı dönemlerde stantlarda da satarak müşteri çevresini genişletiyor. Maya’dan 4. kredisini kullanan Fevziye hanım ürünlerini şehir dışında da satmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products to sell.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu is a maize farmer from Gwani village. As a Babban Gona member, Saidu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saidu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. Saidu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Saidu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD/hectare, Saidu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Neriman

texts.en:
Neriman's husband is deceased and she has three children. She makes dough products at home. She is making a contribution to the family budget by making and selling bazlama, yufka and pastas at home. She is selling them to her neighbours. With the help of the loan from Maya she is planning to buy bulk lots of flour, butter, oil and eggs. She will make bazlama, yufka and pastas, sell them to make money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Neriman hanım eşi vefat etmiş üç çocuk annesi. Evde hamur işleri yapıyor. Bazlama, yufka, makarna yapıp ev ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor. Bunları evden yakınlarına satıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan un, yağ, yumurta alarak bazlama, makarna, yufka yaparak satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, oil and eggs

loans.name: Mey's Grouo Group

texts.en: Mey’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Mey makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Gamma Group

texts.es:
Luchando y trabajando fuertemente para brindarles las mejores condiciones de vida a sus seres queridos se encuentra conformado el grupo ¨Gamma¨. Conformado por 5 socias, quienes están por 4 vez trabajando con los crédito de ADIM, y formando una fianza solidaria para poder sacar adelante sus negocios. La líder es Marta, de 33 años, casada y con un hijo de 11 años, se dedica a la preparación y venta de nacatamales y a la venta de mesas de concretos, ahora el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, cebollas, manteca, tomates, carne de cerdo, chiltoma, papas y yerba buenas, también en cemento piedrín, arena, hierro y tablas. 
 Las integrantes son Belki, de 21 años quien se dedica a la venta de Ropa nueva, Rosa, 43 años, vende productos comestibles como llamadas cosa de horno (bollos, rosquilla, etc) y pan. Ericka de 35 años tiene una pulperia, y Ligia,  45 años  a la venta de cosméticos y ropa.
texts.en:
The members of the "Gamma" group are fighting and working hard to provide the best living conditions for their loved ones.  The group is made up of 5 members who are working with ADIM loans for the 4th time and forming a bond of solidarity so that they can move forwards with their businesses.  

Marta, the leader of the group, is 33 years old and married, with an 11-year old child.  She makes a living preparing and selling Nicaraguan tamales and selling concrete tables.  The current loan will be used to buy corn, onions, butter, tomatoes, pork, sweet peppers, potatoes, and spearmint, as well as gravel cement, sand, iron, and planks.  

The members of the group are Belki, 21, who makes a living selling new clothing, Rosa, 43, who makes a living selling baked goods (rolls, donuts, etc.) and bread, Ericka, 35, who has a grocery store, and Ligia, 45,  who sells cosmetics and clothing.

loans.use: to buy corn, onions, butter, tomatoes, pork, sweet peppers, potatoes, and spearmint, as well as gravel cement, sand, iron, and planks.

loans.name: Puerto De Guaqui Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PUERTO DE GUAQUI II” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de carne de cordero, venta de productos de limpieza, venta de mantas, venta de carne de pollo, venta de polainas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace más de veinte años, en la actualidad quien le ayuda en su negocio es su hija. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association “PUERTO DE GUAQUI II” will begin its eighth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Alto Lima focus group. It is comprised of nine members and is led by a board of which Juana is the President. The businesses run by the members of the communal association are varied, including the sale of clothes, the sale of lamb meat, the sale of beauty products, the sale of blankets, the sale of chicken meat, and the sale of leggings.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro enterprises in which Juana is a member. She notes that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling blankets. She adds that she learned the business on her own initiative over twenty years ago. At the present, her daughter helps her in the business.

The loan she will take out now will be for the increase of capital (to buy blankets wholesale) that she will acquire from wholesale vendors from the city of El Alto. Thereafter she will sell them from her market stall. This manner of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, as she lives in a common law marriage and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health and training programs offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy blankets wholesale.

loans.name: Gunnur

texts.en:
Günnür is divorced and has one child. She makes ornaments and candies for newborn baby's rooms at home. She gets orders from her neighbours, produces them at home and sells them. With the help of the loan from Maya she is planning to buy bulk lots of tulle, fabric and sugar. She is going to make her ornaments and candies, sell them and make money. She aims to expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Günnür hanım eşinden ayrı bir çocuk annesi. Evde yeni doğmuş bebek odaları süslemeleri ve şekerleri yapıyor. Evden tanıdıklarından siparişler alıyor üretiyor ve satışlarını yapıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan tül, kumaş, şeker alarak onları işleyerek üretmek ve para kazanmak istiyor. İşlerini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy tulle, fabrics and sugar

loans.name: Abdulkadir

texts.en:
Abdulkadir is a maize farmer from Gabas village. As a Babban Gona member, Abdulkadir is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdulkadir would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

Abdulkadir will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37 percent higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Abdulkadir no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Abdulkadir hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en: Vuthy’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vuthy makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
Adolat is a kind woman from the North Tajikistan. She is a careful mother of 3 children. Adolat’s husband is a pensioner. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 16 years. Adolat has a great experience in animal husbandry business. She buys cows, feeds some months and sells in a local market. Adolat little by little with the passing of the time has developed her business.

She is a repeated client of IMON and previous loans she has used for developing her business but now she needs to financial support for buying medicines because she is ill. Adoalt is asking for a loan of 1500 Somoni to buy medicines. She hopes to be healthy soon.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her treatment.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es:
Eddy continúa con su negocio de corte de ladrillos. El crédito que obtuvo lo empleo comprando ladrillos por mayor, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. Actualmente su negocio se extendió, corta y vende ladrillos, “mi negocio se estabiliza ahora tengo que ayudar en el negocio de mi pareja…” comenta. Su pareja se dedica al tejido de mantas de alpaca y vicuña, actividad que realiza de forma independiente y en su casa. La ventaja de su negocio es que ambas actividades cuentan con clientela, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para cubrir las necesidades de los negocios. Su sueño es construir su casa, el desea comprar lana para la actividad de su pareja. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que trabaja junto a su esposa en ambas actividades. 
Es por esos motivos que Eddy solicita un préstamo para comprar lana de vicuña para el negocio de su pareja.
texts.en:
Eddy continues with his business of cutting bricks. The loan that he received was used to buy bricks and he made his payments punctually. Currently, his business has grown to cutting and selling bricks. "My business is established so now I can help with my partner's business," he comments.
His partner works knitting sweaters from alpaca and vicuña wool. She does this independently and from her house. The advantage of the businesses is that both activities have customers. The disadvantage is the lack of funds to cover the needs of the businesses.
His dream is to build a house. He wants to buy wool for his partner's business. This is the second loan that has had from the institution in the one year that he has worked together with his partner in both activities.
It is for these reasons that Eddy is requesting a loan: to buy vicuña wool for his partner's business.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool for his partner's business.

loans.name: Ileana Patricia

texts.es: Doña Ileana es un ejemplo para muchos, a sus 46 años se dedica desde hace 18 años gracias al apoyo de su compañero de vida a la elaboración de vestidos, pañaleras, y a la confeccion de diversas estilos de ropa. Con la ayuda de sus hijas quienes junto a ella han sacado adelante el negocio y  han podido obtener ingresos para salir adelante y mantener sus gastos económicos, ahora con el crédito invertirá en los materiales de mayor consumo para la tener una mejor calidad, como tela dacron, tela bordada, tela tull, satin, canca, y adornos de diversos diseños, e hilos de colores. Con esto cubrirán la demanda de sus pedidos.
texts.en: Ileana is an example for many. Thanks to the support of her partner, at her 46 years she has been dedicated for 18 years to making dresses, diaper bags, and making various styles of clothing. With the help of her daughters her business has been successful and have been able to earn income to get ahead and pay for their expenses. She will invest this loan in buying high use materials so that she can provide a better quality. She will buy materials such as dacron fabric, embroidered fabric, tulle, satin, cancan fabric, various decorations, and thread in different colors. With these items they will cover the demands of their orders.

loans.use: to buy dacron fabric, embroidered fabric, tulle, satin, cancan fabric, decorations of various designs, and thread in different colors.

loans.name: Mamtaz

texts.en:
Mamtaz is a 43-years-old married woman with four children. She has been making embroidery by hand at home for many years to support her family. In fact her husband remains sick most of the time and unable to do a job. To look after her children and to meet household expenses, she started embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides her all raw materials for doing embroidery and she completes her tasks, along her daughters, over wooden frames.

She wants to sell her embroidery directly in the market so that she can earn more profit for her family. She has become expert in her art and wants to buy raw materials on her own, so that she can sell her hand made embroidery in her hometown.

Therefore Mamtaz has requested a Kiva loan to buy raw materials and wooden frames so she can do more embroidered dresses to sell and could generate maximum income.

She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials and wooden frames for her embroidered dresses and directly selling in the market. .

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en:
Rihab is a 40-year-old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and three children. Her husband is the main income provider in the family. She decided to support her husband and started to work in the agriculture field since 2012 and she was working days and nights to be able to manage her expenses and business operations as well.

She’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of agriculture tools. In this way, she will be able to increase her revenues thus improve her way of living. She looks forward to expanding her work.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of agriculture tools

loans.name: Lesbia Auxiliadora

texts.es: Laboriosa y perseverante son características que describen a Lesbia, una mujer de 43 años de edad, casada y madre de un niño de 3 años de edad, quien es su mayor motivación para trabajar día a día. Ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos naturales desde hace seis años, donde oferta a sus clientes variedad de sabores, solicitado por primer ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de frutas como: naranja, cálala, pitaya, cacao, leche y azúcar. Debido a que una de sus metas es aumentar la venta de refrescos naturales.
texts.en: Hard working and persevering are characteristics that describe Lesbia, a woman who is 43 years old, married and a mother of a three-year-old son who is her main motivation to work every day. She has been selling natural drinks for six years where she offers her customers a variety of flavors. She is requesting her first loan with this institution to buy fruits such as oranges, passion fruit, dragon fruit, cacao, milk, and sugar. One of her goals is to increases the sale of natural drinks.

loans.use: to buy oranges, passion fruit, dragon fruit, cacao, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 28, recently married, takes care of his aging parents, and has a small carpentry project. He is requesting 4000 EGP loan to buy new equipment for his project to afford good education to his children.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and wood, to help look after his children and parents

loans.name: Aysegul

texts.en:
Ayşegül is married and a mother of two. She is making a contribution to the family budget by making soaps at home for special days. With the help of the loan from Maya, she bought bulk soap ingredients, tulle and fabric. She will decorate her soaps, sell them, make money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
