Ayşegül hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Evde özel günler için sabun üretimi yapıyor aile bütçesine katkı sağlıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan olarak sabun malzemesi tül ve kumaşlar aldı. Yaptığı sabunları süsleyerek satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy soap ingredients, tulle and fabric.

loans.name: Chris

texts.en:
Chris is a married man, aged 37, with two children. He operates a bar in the city outskirts. He works all the days of the week so that he can maximize profits. The bar business cannot adequately meet all his financial demands, so he opened a mobile money outlet for which he is requesting funds to boost his float.

He encourages fellow youth to be innovative instead of complaining about unemployment. He appreciates the financial support accorded to him. He is hardworking and innovative.

Pictured is Chris with the UGAFODE credit officer in charge of his loan.

loans.use: to pay for mobile money float.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 40 years old with three children, ages 15, 13 and 10 years old.

She and her husband operate their sari-sari store (small grocery store) and sell groceries like noodles, biscuits, coffee, sugar and other items to generate additional income for her family.

Cresencia has been in this business for 16 years, and she works hard every day to help provide for her family expenses and her children education.

Cresencia wanted to expand her store and do wholesale to increase her income and take the opportunity to stock groceries for the upcoming holiday season, wherein more people are buying for their family. She also wanted to hire a helper in their community to help her with the store.

Cresencia is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to buy boxes of canned goods, beverages, snack foods and biscuits to sell as wholesale and retail to her customers.

The loan will enable her to increase her income and sell her items at lower prices.

Cresencia hopes to expand her store to increase her income to provide comfortably for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of canned goods, beverages, snack foods and biscuits to sell wholesale and retail to her customers.

loans.name: Nueva Luna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA LUNA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gladis es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de cemento, venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa, venta de helados, venta de frazadas, venta de verduras, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gladis es integrante, ella indica que es un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cemento; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de cemento por mayor por mayor) que adquirirá de la empresa de cementos de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “NUEVA LUNA” communal bank is starting their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani regional office. It is made up of nine members led by a board of directors with Gladis as President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Amongst them are: a neighborhood store, selling cement, the sale of salchipapas, clothing sales, selling ice-cream, the sale of blankets, selling vegetables and selling fruit.

The loan that they are taking out will help all these small micro-entrepreneurs Gladis being one of them. She indicated that she became part of pro Mujer one year ago joining on the invitation of adviser who is part of the institution. She currently has a business selling cement. She states that she learned the business on her own initiative a number of years ago.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (buying cement wholesale) that she will acquire at the cement companies in the city of El Alto. She will later sell it at her sales space. This method of work allows her to support her family economically as she is in a common-law relationship and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training and the health services that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy cement wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es: Ana de 44 años de edad, reside en casa propia al lado de su compañero de vida y su hija de 23 años de edad. Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la venta de manteles, ropa de cama, vestidos, etc. con lindos bordados que ella misma confecciona, actividad que realiza desde hace 20 años. Gracias al tiempo que lleva de administrar este negocio le ha permitido hacerse con un número bastante grande de clientes, lo que le permite poder obtener los ingresos necesarios para mantener la economía del hogar. Además su compañero de vida le ayuda con la economía de su familia. Ana solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, clavos y pago de mano de obra para reparar el techo de su vivienda, ya que debido al paso del tiempo se ha deteriorado y con la reparación desea mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and her daughter who is 23 years old. Ana is a hardworking woman who sells tablecloths, bedding, dresses, and other items with beautiful embroidery that she makes herself. She has been in this business for 20 years.

Thanks to the length of time she has been managing this business, it has allowed her to have a large customer base which allows her to obtain the income necessary to support her household. Her life partner also helps with the family's expenses.

Ana is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in metal sheets, nails, and to pay for labor to repair the roof of her home. Which, due to the passage of time, has deteriorated. With this repair she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, nails, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Claudia Urania

texts.es: Claudia es una joven quien durante 5 ciclos ha trabajado con los créditos de ADIM, gracias a esta oportunidad brindada ella ha podido salir adelante y seguir a flote con sus negocios. Ahora nuevamente requiere del préstamo para fortalecer su inventario en su pulpería y en la venta de diversos cosméticos quien desde hace 2 años se dedica para mejorar su condición de vida. Ahora invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, cosméticos como cremas, pinturas labiales, vanidad, perfumes, y prendas de acero y plata como anillos, pulseras, cadenas.
texts.en: Claudia is a young woman who during five cycles has worked with loans from ADIM. Thanks to this opportunity provided to her, she has been able to get ahead and stay afloat with her business. She again requires a loan to increase the inventory in her store and in the sale of various cosmetics which she has been selling for two years to improve her living conditions. She will invest in buying soft drinks, cosmetics like creams, lipsticks, compacts, perfumes, steel and silver jewelry like rings, bracelets, and necklaces.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cosmetics like creams, lipsticks, compacts, perfumes, steel and silver jewelry like rings, bracelets and necklaces.

loans.name: Sunusi

texts.en:
Sunusi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sunusi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sunusi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

With the help of this loan, Sunusi can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Sunusi will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Sunusi is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ilknur

texts.en:
İlknur is divorced and has two children. She is making a contribution to the family budget by selling cosmetics via a network system.  With the help of the loan from Maya she is planning to buy makeup and skin care products in bulk in order to sell them and make money. She wants to expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
İlknur hanım eşinden ayrı iki çocuk annesi.  Evde network sistemi ile kozmetik ürünlerin satışı yaparak aile bütçesine katkı sağlıyor.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan olarak kozmetik ürünleri olan makyaj malzemesi, cilt bakım ürünleri alarak ve satarak para kazanmak, işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy makeup and skin care products.

loans.name: Nermin

texts.en:
Nermin is married and has one child. She is selling cosmetics and beauty products via a network system.  With the help of the loan from Maya she is buying cosmetics and beauty products in bulk. Buying products in bulk has helped her increase her sales.  She aims to go up to a higher level in this system, make more money and prepare a good future for her child.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nermin hanım evli bir çocuk annesi.  Nermin hanım network sistemiyle kozmetik ve güzellik ürünleri satışı yapıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile toptan kozmetik ve güzellik ürünleri aldı.  Toplu mal alması satışlarına da faydalı oldu.  Hedefi network sisteminde yükselmek ve daha çok para kazanıp çocuğuna iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 29, married to a housewife, and is financially responsible for his four children as well as his aging parents. He has a small fattening project and is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to allow his wife to sell milk, cheese and butter.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María de 59 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 6 años de residir en vivienda propia, la cual ha sido construida con láminas y madera. María en busca de mantener la economía del hogar se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir tales como: vestidos, faldas, pantalones, trajes, etc. actividad que realiza desde hace 20 años y lo que le permite obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus necesidades básicas. El hogar de María por el paso del tiempo tiene partes que necesitan reparación ya que se encuentran deterioradas, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, láminas, madera y pago de mano de obra para reparar el techo y el piso de su vivienda. Logrando así tener una condición de vida mejor y más tranquila.
texts.en:
María, 59, is a single mother. For six years, she has been living in her own home built of wood and sheet metal. Seeking to cover her household expenses, María works making garments such as dresses, skirts, pants, and suits. She has been in this business for 20 years, and it allows her to obtain the income necessary to cover her basic needs.

Over time, some parts of María's home have deteriorated and need to be repaired. That is why she is requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in cement, sand, sheet metal, wood, and labor to repair the roof and floor of her home. She will be more comfortable and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, sheet metal, wood, and labor to repair the roof and floor of her home.

loans.name: Salomatjon

texts.en: Salomatjon is a repeat client of IMON. She is a responsible woman and has a good credit history. Salomatjon's previous loans have been used for developing her business because she has been busy with food selling for some years. She has a food shop where she sells a variety of food items such as sausage, candies, tea, coffee, milk products, flour products, etc. Salomatjon uses the profit from her business to provide her two little children with all the necessary things. Her children are schoolboys and they demand a lot of financial support. Salomatjon is going to increase her working capital and in this way attract more customers. Salomatjon is asking for a loan of 6,500 TJS for food items to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food items to increase working capital.

loans.name: Arcoiris Group

texts.es:
Rutid es  una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 9 y 12 años y su negocio es la tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, constante y muy paciente. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘taruma’ que se encuentra a solo 62 km de la ciudad donde la gente disfruta del rio que se encuentra a solo unos pasos del pueblo.
Rutid es morena de baja estatura y físico robusto (sentada la primera de la izquierda, viste blusa roja), su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como guía turístico, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de emprendimiento con negocios como; artesanía en cuero, taller eléctrico, elaboración de sombreros de sao, llantería, taller de soldadura, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de huevo y venta de refrescos. Su negocio es la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y víveres en su tienda de barrio, “es difícil encontrar comercio por estos lugares, mayormente todo lo que consumimos es producido aquí…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias y casi sin competencia, la desventaja s la falta de dinero para comprar mercadería de la ciudad. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable y bien surtido, ella desea comprar mercadería para su tienda por mayor. Esta es la 7 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que RUTID solicita un préstamo para abastecer su tienda de barrio con artículos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Rutid is a 35-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has 3 children, ages 5, 9, and 12. Her business is a neighborhood store.

She is a good mother, persevering, and very patient. She carries out her business in the town of 'taruma,' which is located only 62km from the city, where the people enjoy the river that is only steps from the town.

Rutid is dark-haired, short, and has a robust figure (seated first from the left, wearing a red blouse). Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband who works as a tourist guide. They live in their own home built of wood that has electricity and well water. The need to improve her business led her to form a bank undertaking with businesses such as: leather craftwork, an electric workshop, making straw hats, tire sales, a welding workshop, food sales, secondhand clothing sales, egg sales, and beverage sales.

Her business is the sale of basic need items and supplies in her neighborhood store. "It is difficult to find business in these places, mostly everything we consume is produced here..." she comments. The advantage of her business is that she has daily sales and almost no competition. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy merchandise from the city. Her dream is to have a stable and well-stocked business. She wants to buy wholesale merchandise for her store. This is the 7th loan cycle with the institution in 8 years with this business.

For these reasons, Rutid requests a loan to supply her neighborhood store with basic need items.

loans.use: to supply her neighborhood store with basic need items.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abubakar has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Abubakar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as buying food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Abubakar can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abubakar will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Abubakar is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Audu

texts.en:
Audu is a maize farmer from Baure, a village. As a Babban Gona member, Audu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Audu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Audu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. 

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Audu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/ha, Audu hopes to realize better yields and plans to use his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es: Rosa de 38 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia al lado de su compañero de vida y su hijo. Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que  se dedica a la venta de ropa para niño y ropa interior en general, negocio que administra desde hace aproximadamente 14 años y esto le permite tener un número bastante grande de clientes que prefieren sus productos y con lo que logra mantener la economía del hogar. Además su esposo le ayuda con la economía de su familia. Rosa en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de un muro en su vivienda y de esta manera poder tener una mayor seguridad en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and her son. Rosa is a hardworking and responsible woman who sells children's clothing and undergarments. She has managed this business for approximately 14 years and it allows her to have a fairly large customer base who prefer her products. She is able to cover her household expenses with this business. In addition, her husband helps with the household expenses.

Rosa is looking to improve her quality of life and is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, sand, cement, and to pay for labor to build a new wall in her home so that she can have more security in her home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, cement, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en:
Gambo is a maize farmer from Pegi village. As a Babban Gona member, Gambo is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Gambo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Gambo will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. 

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Gambo no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/ha, Gambo hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en: Ramadan is 30, married to a housewife and has four children. He has a small fattening project and is requesting 5,000 EGP to buy a head of cattle to allow his wife to make more milk, cheese and butter to sell in the local market.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Dina Jeannette

texts.es: Dina es una joven de 23 años de edad, quien reside en vivienda propia al lado de su compañero de vida y su hija de 1 año de edad. Dina es muy trabajadora y se dedica a la venta de pijamas para niños y así también manteles, ropa de cama, entro otros. Gracias a esta actividad, logra obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus necesidades básicas. Además su compañero de vida también le ayuda con los gastos de la familia. Ella vive en una humilde vivienda, en la cual con el paso del tiempo el techo se ha deteriorado para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, clavos, madera y pago de mano de obra para reparar el techo de su vivienda. De esta manera brindarle un mejor hogar a su hija y una mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Dina is a young woman who is 23 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and her one-year-old daughter. Dina is very hardworking and sells children's pajamas, tablecloths, bedding, and other items. Thanks to this business she is able to obtain the income necessary to cover her basic needs. Her life partner also helps with the family's expenses.

She lives in a humble home on which, with the passage of time, the roof has deteriorated. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy metal sheets, nails, wood, and to pay for labor to repair the roof on her home. This will allow her to provide her daughter with a better home and greater security.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, nails, wood, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Dúo Mariposas De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Mariposas de Vista Hermosa La encargada de este grupo es doña Hilda quien es madre de tres hijos,es casada,y tiene 30 años de edad y una persona muy luchadora, emprendedora desde muy pequeña Se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir  de tela variada como blusas para damas y niños, camisolas en general y otros.  Su sueño es que la fábrica crezca y con sus ganancias comprar otro terreno y hacer una casa grande para su familia y su fábrica.   Tiene varios pedidos de prendas de vestir variada pero le hacen falta algunos colores de tela que tiene que comprar por rollo valorados en Q. 1,150.00 cada rollo.  Por tal  motivo ella necesita otro préstamo para sacar los pedidos que tiene y no quedarles mal a sus clientes.  Les agradece su apoyo a pesar de la distancia y les desea muchas bendiciones.
texts.en:
The leader of Dúo Mariposas de Vista Hermosa is Hilda, 30, a married mother of three children. Since she was very young, she has been very determined and enterprising. Hilda works making garments out of various fabrics such as tops for ladies and children and shirts in general. Her dream is for her workshop to grow and to use her profits to buy another piece of land and build a large house for her family and her workshop.

Hilda has several orders for assorted garments, but she does not have some of the colors of fabric, which she needs to buy by the bolt for Q. 1,150.00 each. She needs another loan in order to fulfill the orders she has and not disappoint her customers. She thanks you for your support despite the distance, and wishes you many blessings.

loans.use: to buy material for making garments to sell.

loans.name: Gulfidan

texts.en:
Gülfidan is 37 years old and has one child.  After divorcing she started to work as a sales person in a company selling beauty products.  Her salary was not enough for her so she decided to make her own business. Now Gülfidan is selling beauty products and hair dyes in bulk from a catalogue to hair and beauty salons. With the help of her loan from Maya she made herself brochures and business cards.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Gülfidan Hanım 37 yaşında ve 1 çocuk annesi.  Eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra güzellik ürünleri satan bir firmada pazarlamacı olarak işe başlamış.  Buradan aldığı ücret kendine yetmeyince kendi işini yapmaya karar vermiş.  Gülfidan Hanım Kuaförlere ve güzellik merkezlerine katalog dan toplu olarak güzellik ürünleri ve saç boyaları satışı yapıyor.  Maya dan aldığı kredi kendine broşür ve kart bastırdı.

loans.use: to buy brochures and business cards.

loans.name: Ozlem

texts.en:
Özlem is 30 years old, married and has a child. She started doing business by selling womenswear to her neighbours. Later on she expanded her business and bought herself stands in local bazaars and continued selling there.

With the help of her third loan from Maya she bought bulk womenswear.

In the future, she wants to open a store of her own and continue selling womenswear.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Özlem Hanım 30 yaşında evli ve bir çocuk annesi. İş hayatına evinden çevresine kadın kıyafetleri satarak başlamış. Daha sonra işlerini geliştirerek semt pazarlarından kendine yer satın almış ve satışlarına buradan devam etmiş. Özlem Hanım Maya dan aldığı kredi ile toptan kadın kıyafeti satın aldı. Gelecekte kadın kıyafetleri satan bir dükkan açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy womenswear

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer from Pegi village. As a Babban Gona member, Adamu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Adamu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. 

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Adamu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Adamu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha lives in Nablus city. She is a 31-year-old married mother-to-be and housewife, while her husband is an employee. Maha is pregnant and she will have her baby soon, but she can't have a natural birth and needs caesarean surgery. Maha and her husband don’t have enough money to pay for the surgery, so, she asked Kiva’s partner ALIBDAA for a $1,500 loan to be able pay the costs of her surgery.

Maha is very grateful for Kiva’s team and their partner ALIBDAA.

loans.use: to pay the costs of having caesarean surgery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small stall for selling soft drinks

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Usman has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Usman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Usman can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Usman will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Usman is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Tevhide

texts.en:
Tevhide is divorced and has two children. After her divorce she had financial problems and started working. She started selling underwear, printed scarves and towels at womens' home gatherings. With the help of her loan from Maya, she wants to buy printed scarves, towels and underwear in bulk, sell them, make money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Tevhide hanım iki çocuk annesi eşinden ayrı. Tevhide hanım eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra ekonomik olarak zorlanmış ve çalışmaya başlamış. Evden ve günlere giderek çamaşır, yazma, havlu satarak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamış. Aldığı kredi ile toptan yazma, havlu, iç çamaşır alarak satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy printed scarves, towels and underwear in bulk to re-sell.

loans.name: Gulten

texts.en:
Gülten is married and has one child. She is contributing to the family budget by making home cooking, pastas, mantı and dough products at home. With the help of her loan from Maya she wants to buy flour, meat, butter and oil in bulk, sell them and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Gülten hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Gülten hanım evden sipariş alarak ev yemekleri, hamur işleri, mantı, makarna yaparak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor. Aldığı kredi ile toptan un, yağ ve et alarak üreterek satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy flour, meat, butter and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Adamu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Adamu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Adamu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Adamu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with

loans.use: buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, John is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, John would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, John will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, John now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Jose Nicolas

texts.es: José de 47 años de edad vive junto a su esposa tiene hijos pero ya no dependen de él, es un hombre trabajador honrado y capaz de trabajar en cualquier trabajo de jornalero lo importante para él es llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y llevarle lo necesario a su esposa, el presta sus servicios de vigilante en un lugar donde cultivan plátanos este se encuentra en el municipio donde vive; es de esta manera que él se gana la vida honradamente; él está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en lámina, madera, clavos, etc. Para el cambio de lámina del techo de su casa ya que este ya se encuentra  muy deteriorada y cuando llueve se filtra el agua y se humedecen todas sus pertenencias él espera comenzar con la mejora lo más pronto posible y mejorar la calidad de vida de él y la de su esposa.
texts.en:
Jose is 47 years old and lives with his wife. He has children, but they are no longer dependent on him. 

He is an honest, hard-working man who can do any type of day labor. The important thing for him is to bring daily sustenance to his home and provide his wife with what she needs.

He offers his services as a guardian in a place where they grow plantains, located in the same community where he lives. This is how he makes an honest living.

He is requesting a FUSAI credit to invest in sheets of metal, wood, nails, etc., in order to change the metal roof of his house. The roof is currently in a serious state of deterioration and when it rains, water filters in and all their belongings get wet. 

He hopes to begin the renovation as soon as possible to improve the quality of life for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to invest in sheets of metal, wood, nails, etc., in order to change the metal roof of his house.

loans.name: Boris Cesar

texts.es:
Boris continúa con su negocio de fabricación de mermeladas. El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizo comprando ollas y herramientas para su negocio, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo vender su producción. Actualmente sus ventas mejoraron, la calidad de su producto es cada vez mejor aceptada, “mis ventas mejoran porque mi producto mejora…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con experiencia, la desventaja es la falta de licencia de funcionamiento. Su sueño es obtener su autorización de funcionamiento para consolidar su imagen y empezar un nuevo desafío empresarial, el desea mejorar el ambiente donde se encuentra su taller para obtener la licencia de funcionamiento y acceder a nuevos mercados. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Boris solicita un préstamo para mejorar el ambiente donde se encuentra su taller para obtener la licencia de funcionamiento y acceder a nuevos mercados.
texts.en:
Boris continues with his business of making jams. He used the loan that he obtained buying pots and tools for his business. The payments on his account were punctual because he was able to sell his production. Now his sales have improved, and the quality of his product is better accepted every day. "My sales improve because my product improves," he comments.

The advantage of his business is that he has experience. The problem is the lack of an operating license. His dream is to obtain his operating permit in order to enhance his image and begin a new business challenge. He wants to improve the setting where his workshop is located in order to obtain an operating license and gain access to new markets. This is his second loan sequence with the institution in the two years that he has had this business.

It is for these reasons that Boris is applying for a loan to improve the setting where his workshop is located in order to obtain an operating license and gain access to new markets.

loans.use: to improve the setting where his workshop is located in order to obtain an operating license and gain access to new markets.

loans.name: Uguljon

texts.en:
Uguljon is a hardworking woman from North Tajikistan. She was born in 1967. Uguljon is married and has one non-adult child. 

Uguljon lives with her family in a village and her business is feeding cows. Uguljon buys cows, feeds them for some months, and then sells them in a local market. Uguljon has been busy with this business for more than 18 years, and she has great experience in this field.

Uguljon tries to develop her business year-by-year because her business is the main source of her family's income. 

Uguljon is asking for a loan of 2,200 TJS to buy a cow, to increase the number of cows she feeds. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a cow, to increase the number of cows she feeds

loans.name: Silver

texts.en:
Silver is a repeat customer of UGAFODE who lives in Namungo Mityana. He is an agriculturalist and majors in coffee growing and coffee trading, which he started in 2001. He is 46-years-old, and is married with five children. 

Silver is now looking forward to acquiring a loan of 500,000 UGX to improve his working capital and to overcome the challenge of climate hazards.He needs the loan to mulch his coffee plants so that they can produce a high yield.

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un padre de familia de 44 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Sololá, Pedro cuenta que con su préstamo pudo comprar sus insumos agrícolas para su cultivo, afortunadamente obtuvo una buena cosecha y en su mercado regional lo pudo vender. Pedro nuevamente tiene la necesidad de un préstamo para la compra de semillas de papa y fertilizantes, pues la época de verano en su comunidad ya se acerca y esta es una buena época para producir una  buena cosecha de papa.
Su gran sueño es incrementar su cultivo y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is the 44-year-old father of a family. He lives in a community of Sololá. Pedro says that with his loan he was able to buy his agricultural supplies for his crops. Fortunately, he obtained a good harvest and he was able to sell it in his regional market.

Pedro again has need of a loan for the purchase of seed potatoes and fertilizers, since the summer season in his community is already approaching, and this is a good time to produce a good harvest of potatoes.

His great dream is to increase his crops and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes and fertilizer

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Daniel is thankful that his days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land - 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Daniel would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Daniel will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season. This way, he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Daniel now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Cristian Adonay

texts.es: Cristian de 28 años de edad vive con sus padres su vivienda es propia es un joven muy trabajador y responsable se esfuerza todos los días para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar pues su padres ya son de avanzada edad y están a su cargo. Él trabaja en una empresa fuera de su municipio se levanta muy temprano y regresa a horas de la noche a su hogar él quiere darle una mejor vivienda a sus padres él quiere construir un cuarto que usará como servicio sanitario ya que con el que cuentan en estos momentos no cumple con las calidad necesaria y salubridad que se requiere es por eso que él está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en cemento, ladrillos, un servicio lavable, pago de mano de obra etc. Para construirlo y así darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres.
texts.en:
Cristian is 28 years old and lives with his parents;  They own their home. He is a very hard working and responsible young man who puts in a lot of effort every day to bring home their daily sustenance, because his parents are at an advanced age and he is responsible for their care. 

He works in a company outside his community. He gets up early and comes home in the night-time hours. 

He would like to offer a better home to his parents. He wants to build a room they will use as a bathroom, because the one they are using now does not have the necessary quality or offer the required sanitary conditions.

For this reason he is requesting a FUSAI loan to buy cement and cement blocks, a washable toilet, and pay labor costs, etc., to build the bathroom and thus offer his parents a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement and cement blocks, a washable toilet, and pay labor costs, etc., to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Sıddı Zeynep

texts.en:
Zeynep is divorced and has two children.  She had financial prodblems so she decided to work.  She is preparing home made food for resale, and making a contribution to the family budget.   With the help of her third loan from Maya she wants to buy meat and ingredients for her pickles, that she will sell in order to make money. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Zeynep hanım eşinden ayrı iki çocuk annesi.  Zeynep hanım maddi sıkıntılar yaşamış bu yüzden çalışmaya karar vermiş.  Evden sipariş alarak ev yemekleri, turşu, yöresel yemekler yaparak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan turşuluk malzemesi ve et alarak üretip satarak para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy meat and pickles products

loans.name: Dúo San José La Comunidad Group

texts.es: Dúo San José la Comunidad, Luz de 49 años es vendedora de refacciones  y tortillas desde hace más de 25 años.  Ella vende atol, chuchitos y tamales, también vende tortillas, ella acomoda su horario  según las necesidades de las personas que trabajan cerca de su comunidad. Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de productos comestibles para vender,y compra de maiz para elaboración de tortillas para vender. pues ella quiere darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El sueño de Luz es poderle dar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Dúo San José la Comunidad. Luz, who is 49 years old has been a vendor of snacks and tortillas for more than 25 years. She sells atol [a cornflour drink], chuchitos [similar to tamales, but eaten as a snack], and tamales. She also sells tortillas. She adjusts her schedule according to the needs of the people who work near her community.

She is applying for a loan for the purchase of food products to sell and for the purchase of corn to make tortillas to sell, since she wants to give better service to her customers.

Luz's dream is to be able to give a better lifestyle to her family.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: Franklin se dedica a la venta de ropa y otros artículos. Solicita un préstamo de dos mil dólares (₡ 2 000), para la compra de mercadería. Esto le permitirá incrementar su inventario de producto y mejorar su calidad de vida por medio de generar mayores ingresos familiares.
texts.en: Franklin sells clothing and other items. He is applying for a loan of $2000 (₡ 2000) for the purchase of merchandise. This will allow him to increase his inventory of products and improve his quality of life by generating greater family income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell in a general store.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 37-year-old married father of four children, and a Palestinian refugee, who started his electricity power supply services business in 2012.  He started his business after earning his maintenance experience working with power generator maintenance services for 13 years.

His newly established business is going well, but needs an external financial supporter to expand properly.  Thus, Naser is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy more electricity cables to expand his electricity supply working region to nearby villages.  Electricity is a major issue in his region, and Naser is working hard to help people acquire electricity as requested. 

Naser will work hard to develop his business so that in the future he will purchase more developed power engines and cover wider regions.

loans.use: to buy more electricity cables to expand his electricity supply working region.

loans.name: Dúo Gran Mirador Group

texts.es:
DUO GRAN MIRADOR
Josefa de 48 años, es madre de 6 hijos los cuales 4 son menores de edad y asisten a la escuela. Ella se dedica a la confección de mochilas desde hace 15 años y tiene varios clientes de su comunidad y de lugares un poco mas cercanos. A sido de mucha ayuda para su familia pues con su negocio a logrado sacar a su familia. Ella tiene el deseo de obtener un local propio para su negocio y así poder tener un mejor estilo de vida. Josefa solicita un crédito para invertir en telas para la confección de mochilas pues esta muy cerca la temporada de nuevo ingreso escolar.
texts.en:
Josefa is 48 years old. She is a mother of six children, and four of them are minors and are attending school. She has earned a living making backpacks for 15 years and she has various customers in her community and other places that are close. She has been a great help to her family, and with her business she has been able to move them ahead.

She wants to obtain her own place for her business and thus have a better lifestyle. Josefa is requesting a loan to purchase the fabrics for making backpacks since it is very close to the start of a new school season.

loans.use: to make and sell backpacks for school.

loans.name: Dúo El Campo Group

texts.es: Dúo El Campo, este dúo esta conformado por la señora Raquel de 28 años de edad,ella se ha dedicado al servicio de mototaxi, tiene ya varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de repuestos para su mototaxi ya que desea areglar unos desperfectos que posee, espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Dúo El Campo. This group was formed by Señora Raquel, who is 28 years old. She provides mototaxi service. She has already worked in this business for a number of years.

At this time she is applying for this loan for the purchase of parts for her mototaxi, since she wants to repair some deficiencies that it has. She hopes that you can help her with the loan she has applied for.

loans.use: to buy parts for the mototaxi that she uses for transportation service.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor es un hombre soltero de 53 años de edad, se dedica a la talabartería es  honesto, entregado a su profesión y familia, a pesar de no vivir con la madre de sus hijos, siempre está atento con ellos, les envía dinero y no permite que pasen necesidades.
Vive en la zona rural de Arcila, una zona de pocos habitantes, pero él con perseverancia, haciendo trabajos de calidad y dando precios justos ha sabido salir adelante y mantenerse por muchos años.
Héctor quiere crecer, llevar sus productos a más personas, pero los largos desplazamientos que debe realizar para comprar material y para vender no se lo permiten, principalmente por su economía, por ello le gustaría solicitar un impulso monetario para comprar materia prima con la que elaborara, llaveros, catas, catas, fundas para primillas, sillas para montar, entre otros.
texts.en:
Héctor is a 53-year-old single man who makes a living making leather goods.  He is honest and dedicated to his profession and his family.  Despite the fact that he doesn't live with the mother of his children, he is always attentive to them and sends them money.  He won't allow them to go without having what they need.  

He lives in a rural area of Arcila.  There aren't many people living in the area, but he has been able to get ahead and maintain his work for many years because of his perseverance, quality work, and reasonable prices.

Hector wants to grow and bring his products to more people, but the large trips that he has to take in order to buy material and to sell his goods don't allow him to do so, principally for economic reasons.  Therefore, he is asking for a monetary boost to buy supplies to produce key rings, slingshots, falconry gloves, and saddles, among other things.

loans.use: to buy supplies to produce key rings, slingshots, falconry gloves, and saddles, among other things.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо благорить Вас на поддержку. Благодаря Вам ее сын сейчас продвигает учебы. У сына еще остался год для завершения учебы. Зебинисо еще обратилась за кредитом на оплаты обучения сына. По причине она не смогла копить денежных средств для оплаты обучения. Зебинисо ждет Вашу поддержку. Ей очень нужно Ваша помощь. С Вашей помощью ее сын успешно закончить университет. Зебинисо хочет, чтобы ее сын стал образованным и большим человеком.
texts.en: Zebiniso thanks you for your support. Thanks to you her son is now carrying out his studies. He has one year left to complete and she is turning to you again for a loan to pay his tuition, as she has not been able to save enough money on her own. She awaits your support, which she needs very much. With your help her son will graduate from university. Zebiniso wants her son to become an educated and important man.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es:
Rosmery es una mujer de 46 años de edad, soltera, tiene 5 hijos de 15, 22, 24, 26 y 28 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por acoger a la migración campo – ciudad.
Rosmery es de tez trigueña, cabello largo castaño y baja estatura (de pie, la primera de la derecha, viste polera amarilla). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que son independientes y el menor estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa familiar construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de emprendimiento con negocios como; taller de cambio de aceite, taller de cerrajería, venta de verduras, venta de comida, elaboración de helados y tienda de barrio. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, ella compra ropa por mayor y la separa según estación, género y edad para venderla de esa manera, “vendo ropa por temporada, la ropa de verano es la que más se vende…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas por temporada, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar mercadería de temporada por mayor. Su sueño es tener un negocio consolidado, ella desea comprar ropa por mayor para abastecer su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosmery solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosmery is a woman of 46 years old, single; she has 5 children ages 15, 22, 24, 26 and 28. Her business is selling second-hand clothes. She is a good mother, enterprising and very hardworking. She does business in the neighborhood ‘plan 3000’, which is characterized as a center for the country-to-city migration.

Rosmery has a light brown complexion, long brown hair, and is short in stature (standing, first from the right, wearing a yellow polo shirt). She shares her life with her children who are independent and the youngest one, who attends school; they live in a family house built of brick that has all the basic services.

The need to improve her business led her to form a communal bank with businesses such as: oil change, locksmith, vegetable sales, food sales, ice cream, and neighborhood store. Her business is selling second-hand clothes. She buys clothing wholesale and separates it according to season, gender, and age to sell it that way, “I sell clothes by season; summer clothing is what sells best ...” she relates.

Her business’s advantage is that it has seasonal sales; its disadvantage is the lack of money to buy seasonal merchandise wholesale. Her dream is to have an established business, she wishes to buy clothes wholesale to supply her business. This is the 1st loan cycle with the institution in the two years that she has been involved in this trade. It is for these reasons that Rosmery is applying for a loan to buy second-hand clothes wholesale to supply her business.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothes wholesale to supply her business.

loans.name: Maximino

texts.es: Don Maximino se dedica a la actividad de sastrería. Solicita un préstamo de mil quinientos dólares ($1,500), dinero que usará para la compra de tela y demás materiales necesarios para el desarrollo de dicha actividad.Con el incremento en sus ventas podrá generar mayores ingresos que mejoren la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Maximo works as a tailor. He is requesting a loan for one thousand five hundred dollars ($1,500), which he will used to buy fabric and other materials needed to grow his business. With the growth in his sales, he will be able to generate more income to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: for the purchase of materials for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es: Don Mateo se dedica a la siembra de maíz. Con un préstamo de $300 puede comprar más semilla y fertilizantes para incrementar su volumen de siembra. De esta manera podrá generar un excedente para vender en la comunidad y asegurar así un ingreso económico en el hogar.
texts.en: Mateo earns a living planting corn. With a loan of $300 he can buy more seeds and fertilizers in order to increase his plant volume. In this way he will be able to generate a surplus to sell in the community and thus assure a financial income for his home.

loans.use: to buy supplies to plant corn.

loans.name: Las Unidas De Pariachi Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “LAS UNIDAS DE PARIACHI” conformada por 05 socias emprendedoras. Este es el caso Aldegunda de 58 años de edad separada. Aldegunda se dedica a la venta de frutas Desde hace más de 15 años que tiene dicho negocio gracias a su esfuerzo logro mejorar su calidad de vida. Su mayor deseo es de poder ampliar su negocio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de frutas como manzanas peras plátanos y naranjas .El grupo “las unidas de pariachi” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite mejorar su calidad de vida. Aldegunda es la segunda del lado derecho está de pie y viste polo color rojo.
texts.en:
This is the new group “Las Unidas de Pariachi," made up of 5 enterprising members. One of them is Aldegunda, 58 years old and separated. She sells fruit. She has had this business for 15 years, and thanks to her effort she has succeeded in improving her quality of life.

Her greatest desire is to be able to expand her business. She requested the loan in order to buy fruit such as apples, pears, bananas and oranges.The "Las Unidas de Pariachi" group is grateful to the Kiva lenders that made this loan possible, as it is allowing her to improve her quality of life. Aldegunda is the second person on the right in the photo. She is standing and wearing a red T-shirt.

loans.use: To buy fruit such as apples, pears, bananas and oranges.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan Ramón es un agricultor de 53 años que se dedica a cultivar distintos productos como ser: Café, repollos y tomate Juan tiene como meta fortalecer sus ingresos por cultivos que no sean el café ya que en estos momentos el café es la principal fuente de ingresos de su familia.
El cultivo de tomate bajo invernadero es una técnica que se ha hecho muy popular en la región ya que permite a los productores obtener ingresos extras y además el cultivo es amigable con el ambiente ya que es 100% orgánico, Juan está interesado en este proyecto ya que le ayudara a fortalecer su economía.
Juan solicita un crédito para iniciar las labores para la construcción de un invernadero para la producción de tomates que comercializara por medio de COCAFCAL, con las ganancias obtenidas por el producto vendido Juan piensa seguir invirtiendo en proyectos para diversificar sus ingresos.
Un crédito le ayudará a Juan a tener una economía más sólida que no dependerá de una sola fuente de ingresos, también le ayudara a tener ingresos extras para iniciar a formar un pequeño patrimonio para su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón is a 53-year-old farmer who cultivates various products such as coffee, cabbage, and tomatoes. Juan's goal is to strengthen his income from crops other than coffee, which, in this moment, is the main source of income for his family.

Cultivating tomatoes in hothouses is a technique that has become very popular in the region because it allows producers to obtain extra income, and in addition it is environmentally friendly, because it's 100% organic. 

Juan is interested in this project that will help him to reinforce his financial situation. Juan is requesting a loan to begin work building a hothouse to grow tomatoes that he will sell through COCAFCAL. With the income from the produce he sells, Juan plans to continue investing in projects that will allow him to diversify his income. 

This loan will help Juan reach a more stable economic situation that doesn't depend on a single source of income. Also, it will help him earn extra income so he can start building a small heritage for his family and offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an anti-virus blanket, tomato plants, coco fibers and organic fertilizers among other materials needed to build a hothouse.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel se encarga que uno de los principales platillos de Nicaragua siempre sea recordado y preferido por los turistas. Con más de 25 años vendiendo Vigorón, sabe cómo invertir en este patrimonio gastronómico, razón por la cual vive invirtiendo en su negocio. Anteriormente, él había solicita un préstamo para comprar paraguas para ponerle a sus mesas, pintura para acondicionar mejor el local y verduras para el plato nicaragüense. 
La inversión que hizo Manuel le trajo buenos ingresos y aumento su clientela, razón por la cual desea agradecerle a todas las personas que le ayudaron en ese préstamo. Ahora desea seguir invirtiendo, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar sillas y para pagar mantenimiento de las existentes. Esto le permitirá brindar un buen servicio y atraerá a más clientes. Al cancelar considera seguir trabajando fuerte con su hijo y su hermano para sacar adelante el negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel has taken it upon himself to make sure that one of the main Nicaraguan dishes is always remembered and preferred by the the tourists. With more than 25 years selling vigorón [a Nicaraguan dish], he knows how to invest in this gastronomic heritage. For this reason he lives investing in his business. Previously he had requested a loan to buy umbrellas to put on his tables, paint to better improve the venue, and vegetables for the Nicaraguan dish.

The investment that Manuel made has brought him good earnings and increased his clientele. For this reason he wants to thank all of the people that helped him through this loan. Now he wants to keep investing, and he is requesting a new loan to buy chairs and to pay for the maintenance of the existing ones. This will allow him to provide a good service and to attract more customers. Upon repayment he is looking forward to continuing to work hard with his son and his brother to move his business ahead.

loans.use: to buy chairs and pay for the maintenance of the existing ones.

loans.name: Andres De Jesus

texts.es:
Los colores que decoran el puesto de frutas y verduras de Andrés, hacen que su negocio sea uno de los más llamativos del mercado. Esto asegura que lo clientes se sientan seguros de dónde comprar. Este comerciante con más de 14 años de experiencia, agradece a todas las personas que lo ha apoyado en un préstamo anterior, puesto que con ese ha podido comprar las mercancías más saludables y frescas, por lo que ha permitido captar muchos clientes. 
Actualmente, desea volver a invertir, puesto que en el último préstamo obtuvo grandes resultados, con el cual pudo ahorrar para comprar un camión con el que transporta sus frutas. Por esta razón, Andrés solicita un nuevo préstamo con el cual pretende comprar mango, naranjas, plátanos, tomate, papas, piña, entre otras más frutas y verduras de la temporada. Esto le permitirá seguir ofreciendo productos de calidad y teniendo buenos ingresos. Al cancelar con este préstamo considera trabajar fuerte para mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en:
The colors that decorate Andrés' fruit and vegetable stand make his one of the most attractive stands in the market. This assures that customers are confident of where they want to shop. Andrés has more than 14 years of experience. 

He is thankful for everyone who has helped him with a loan in the past, which he has used to buy healthier and fresher products, which has allowed him to earn many customers. Now, he would like to invest again, as his prior loan had great results. Because of the prior loan, he was able to save up to buy a truck to transport his fruits. 

For this reason, Andrés is asking for a new loan, which he will use to buy mangoes, oranges, plantains, tomatoes, potatoes, pineapple, and other seasonal fruits and vegetables. This will allow him to continue to offer quality products, and to earn good income. When he repays this loan, he will work diligently to improve his business's infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, oranges, plantains, tomatoes, potatoes, pineapple, and other fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Suyen De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Lo que inició como una pequeña forma de ingreso extra para Suyen, se convirtió poco a poco en una gran idea y como su fuente de ingresos principal años después. Hace cinco años, esta emprendedora de treinta años de edad comenzó a vender cosméticos con unos cuantos ahorros que tenía en la zona franca donde trabajaba. Actualmente ella tiene su propia tienda de venta de cosméticos y mercadería variada en su casa. 
Suyen cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y de su suegra, pues todos sueñan con ver a los tres pequeños de la casa crecer como grandes profesionales. Por esta razón es que desea invertir en su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar perfumes, crema para el cuerpo, ropa interior, joyería y una vitrina. Esto le brindará la oportunidad de comprar y vender a mejores precios, lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos. En sus planes está mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y construir una casa.
texts.en:
What started as a small source of extra income for Suyen little by little became a great idea and her main source of income years later. Five years ago, this thirty year old entrepreneur started to sell cosmetics with a few savings that she had in the free trade zone where she worked. Now she has her own cosmetics and varied merchandise store in her house.

Suyen has her husband's and her mother in law's support. All of them dream of seeing their three little ones at home grow into people with great careers. That is why she wants to invest in the business and why she is asking for a loan to buy perfumes, body cream, underwear, jewelry and a display case. This will offer her the opportunity to buy and sell at a better price, which will allow her to increase her income. She is planning on improving her business conditions and building a house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, body cream, underwear, jewelry and a display case.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Ana ha sido clienta de Fundación Mujer por mucho tiempo, a través del cual ha demostrado ser una mujer muy esforzada, responsable y emprendedora. Uno de sus principales logros ha sido el tener su casa propia, donde se refleja lo dedicada y ordenada que es En los diferentes créditos ha tenido excelente moral de pago lo cual le respalda en la solicitud de este crédito.
Tiene 20 años de estar con la actividad productiva, actualmente ella viaja a otros países para traer mercadería cada tres meses. Su local esta en la parte del frente de su casa , un aposento que tiene adaptado como bazar donde además de la mercadería que trae , exhibe otros productos como las manualidades que ella misma confecciona. logra consolidar una cartera de 30 a 60 clientas que la esperan cada vez que regresa de los viajes para comprarle variedad de mercadería que trae. Desea este crédito para invertir en su salud, ya que en su ultimo viaje sufrió un derrame en su ojo derecho y necesita realizarse diferentes exámenes que tienen un alto costo.
texts.en:
Ana has been a client of Fundación Mujer for a long time, and has proved herself to be a determined, responsible, and proactive woman. 

One of her major successes was acquiring her own house, which shows how dedicated and organized she is. In her various loans she has shown excellent discipline in making her payments, which supports her in this loan request.

She has been working for 20 years. Currently, she travels to other countries every three months to bring back merchandise. Her business is in the front part of her house, in a room she adapted as a little store and where she displays, in addition to the merchandise she brings back, other products such as the crafts she makes herself. She has solidified a group of 30 to 60 clients who are waiting for her every time she comes back from a trip to buy the variety of merchandise she brings.  

She is requesting this loan to invest in her health, because during her last trip she suffered a burst blood vessel in her right eye, and she needs to undergo several different analyses that are quite expensive.

loans.use: to invest in her personal health.

loans.name: Francis Edgardo

texts.es:
Francis es un joven de 23 años que junto con su esposa se dedica al cultivo de diferentes productos de origen agrícola sus principales cultivos son el café y productos de hortaliza. Francis es creció viendo cómo funcionan los procesos de la agricultora y ahora quiere poner en practica algunos conocimientos que ha adquirido durante su vida, Francis tiene experiencia de campo en el cultivo de muchos productos su meta es poder producir de una forma diversificada para tener diversas fuentes de ingreso y además promover a que las personas consuman lo que se produce en la región.
Francis quiere iniciar un proyecto para la producción de tomates orgánicos bajo invernadero el producto cosechado lo comercializara por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, este cultivo es muy novedoso ya que el cultivo de tomate deja muy buenas ganancias además proporcionan fuentes de empleo para las personas.
Francis Solicita un crédito para iniciar a cultivar tomates orgánicos lo antes posible ya que él piensa que entre más rápido tengan nuevas fuentes de ingresos menos vulnerable será su economía ante la caída del precio de cualquiera de los productos que vende.
Un crédito ayudara a Francis a tener diversas fuentes de ingresos y por lo tanto le permitirá darle mejores oportunidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francis is a 23 year old young man, who, along with his wife, works in agriculture. His main crops are coffee and garden vegetables. Francis grew up watching how agricultural processes work, and now he wants to put the knowledge that he is acquired in life to work.

Francis has experience in the country growing many products. His goal is to be able to produce diverse crops to diversify his income, and also to encourage people to consume what is grown locally. Francis would like to begin a greenhouse-grown organic tomato production project. The harvested product will be sold through COCAFCAL, which Francis is a member of. This product is very novel, as tomato production brings very good earnings and also provide work for others.

Francis is requesting a loan to begin cultivating organic tomatoes as soon as possible. He believes that this will bring new, more reliable, income sources in case the prices of any other of the products that he sells drops. A loan will help Francis to have diverse income sources, and will thus allow him to provide better opportunity for his children.

loans.use: to buy an antivirus blanket, organic fertilizers, tomato plants, lumber, and other necessary materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz es una joven de 26 años de edad que desea seguirse superando profesionalmente. Actualmente, es química farmacéutica y ha plasmado todos sus conocimientos trabajando en una farmacia. Ella se siente apasionada por esta carrera, porque siente que ser parte del mundo de la medicina es una forma de ayudar a la sociedad, además que las oportunidades laborales son bastante amplias. 
Beatriz cuenta con el apoyo de sus tíos, que le envían remesas, y de su madre, quien es enfermera de una clínica. Por lo que se siente respaldada y con un buen soporte que la ayudará en su siguiente paso. Ella solicita un préstamo para pagar una especialidad de visitadora médica. Esto le permitirá aumentar sus conocimientos y aumentar sus posibilidades de mejores empleos. En sus planes está convertirse en visitadora médica y más adelante establecer su propia farmacia.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a 26-year-old, young woman who wants to continue improving herself professionally. She is currently a pharmacist-chemist and has been able to put all her knowledge to use by working in a pharmacy.

She is passionate about this career, because she feels that her participation in the medical world is a way to help society in general, in addition to offering ample employment opportunities.

Beatriz can count on support from her uncles, who send her remittances, and her mother, who is a nurse in a clinic, and for this feels encouraged and supported, which will help her in taking the next step. 

She is requesting a loan to finance a speciality as a medical representative. This will allow her to increase her knowledge and also her possibilities for better jobs. Her plan is to become a medical representative and in the future, to set up her own pharmacy.

loans.use: to finance a speciality as a medical representative.

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
This is Jesse and he runs a small canteen inside one of the schools in Polomolok, South Cotabato. He’s lucky enough to be granted a space inside the school because he can consider the students and their parents as captured customers. But due to his inadequate capital, he can only offer limited snack items such as biscuits, bread and candies.

He wants to cook delicious and nutritious meals like hot porridge, noodles, rice and viands. He’s reaching out to you for additional capital worth PHP 20,000, which he can use to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, frozen goods, rice, and additional snack items. With this amount he can prepare more meal choices that are enticing to students. A boost in his income will effectively sustain their everyday expenditures.

He’s married to Joy Celyn, a teacher who is also working hard for their children, one of whom is studying in college. The couple dreams to see all their children finish their college education to obtain better opportunities in life. Jesse constantly prays for a fruitful and happy life for his family. He gains inspiration from his co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories about their lives and businesses and also to draw strength from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, frozen goods, rice, and additional snack items.

loans.name: Mükerrem

texts.en:
Mükerrem is a mother of four. She started working by being a helper in people's stores. With her savings, she opened herself a small shop and started selling womenswear. Mostly she sells in bazaars.

She has big hopes for the future. Firstly, she wants to expand her business by opening a bigger store. This way she can provide a better future for her children. With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy bulk womenswear.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
4 çocuk annesi olan Mükerrem Hanım çalışma hayatına önce başkalarının yanında çalışarak başlamış. Daha sonra çalıştığı yerde ufak bir birikim sağlayarak kendisine küçük bir işletme açmış bu işletmede kadın kıyafetleri satışı yapıyor. Çoğu zaman pazarlarda da satış yapıyor. Gelecek ile ilgili planları ve ümitleri var. Öncelikle ilk hedefi ise şuan ki işletmesinden daha büyük bir yer açmak ve işlerini kazancını büyütmek. Bu sayede de çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek temin etmek istiyor. Aldığı kredi ile kıyafet alacak.

loans.use: to buy womenswear.

loans.name: Shahnaze

texts.en:
Shahnaze was living a tough life some years ago; it was very difficult to bear her household expenditures.

She is a 61-year-old woman who has been running a business selling milk for many years. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses.

She has two children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation; now, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.name: Hulya Dilek

texts.en:
Hülya is divorced and has two children. In order to make a contribution to the family budget she is making tarhana and dough products at home. She gets orders from home and makes them. With the help of her loan from Maya she wants to buy flour, butter, oil and eggs in bulk to make her products, sell them and make money. She wants to expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Hülya hanım eşinden ayrı iki çocuk annesi. Aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamak için evden tarhana, hamur işleri yapıyor. Yaptığı işleri sipariş alarak satıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan un, yağ yumurta alarak üreterek satarak para kazanmak istiyor. İşlerini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, oil and eggs.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salina is 58 years old and a married woman. She has two children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community.

She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Now, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

Salima expects a boost in her earnings with the loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Sajida is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her four children. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Sajida is also providing sewing services and earning income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She is needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and will also be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
Doña Julieta, vive en unión libre, tiene una hija de 23 años de edad y un hijo de 19 años de edad, ambos son estudiantes. Doña Julieta  se presenta y demuestra ser una mujer luchadora, responsable; entregada a su compromiso como microempresaria, madre y abuela, ya que cuida a su nieta, mientras su hija trabaja y estudia. Ella desde muy joven cuenta con la experiencia de cocinera, costurera y panadera. Su compañero sentimental tiene un taller de muebles, desde hace 50 años, en el que ella le ayuda a conseguir sus clientes y entregar los pedidos. Doña Julieta es muy conocida en el pueblo como la señora que vende pan casero y granizados.
Inicia vendiendo bolsas de pan desde hace 13 años, actualmente vende por semana unas 100 a 200 bolsas de pan casero, arroz con leche, repostería y granizados. Necesita este crédito con el fin de pagar un cuatrimestre de inglés intensivo para su hijo e hija, ella considera que lo más importante es poder apoyarles con el crecimiento académico por eso pensó en contar con un financiamiento para estudio de sus hijos. 
Una de las ventajas es que su casa está muy cerca de la calle por donde pasan todos los vecinos de la zona, además la escuela y la iglesia se encuentran muy cerca, por lo que es un buen punto de venta. En un futuro sueña con colocar una cafetería donde llega la gente a disfrutar de un buen café, junto con la repostería que ella realiza.
texts.en:
Julieta is cohabiting, she has a 23-year-old daughter and a 19-year-old son. They are both students. Julieta presents herself and shows that she is a hard-working woman, responsible, and dedicated to her commitment as a micro-entrepreneur, a mother, and a grandmother, as she takes care of her granddaughter when her daughter is working and studying.
