Since she was very young she has had experience as a cook, a seamstress, and a baker. Her partner has had a furniture workshop for 50 years, where she helps him to get clients and to deliver the orders. Julieta is well-known in the town as the woman who sells homemade bread and slushies.
She started selling bags of bread 13 years ago. Currently she sells around 100 to 200 bags of homemade bread per week, rice with milk, pastries, and slushies. She needs the loan to be able to pay a four-month course of intensive English for her son and daughter. She thinks that the most important thing is to help them with their academic growth, which is why she thought of asking for financing for her children's studies.
One of the advantages is that her house is very close to the street where all the neighbors in the area go by. Also, the school and the church are very close, making it a good place to sell. In the future, she would like to open a cafe where people could go to enjoy a good coffee, along with the pastries that she makes.

loans.use: to pay for her children's studies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 34 years old and has four children. Evelyn is married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been farming rice for 16 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 37 year old. She is a visionary with great talent. Pamela is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her six children.

She hails from Kapyeson, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. This area has good weather conditions and Pamela has been engaged in farming for the past ten years. Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming.

Pamela is contented with the farming way of life. Pamela is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal.

The Kapsowar, Kapyeson area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business.

Pamela feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Pamela is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children who are in school.

Please kindly invest in Pamela so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming and provide a better income for her six children.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is a 30-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kapsowar, which is a small agricultural center near the famous Rift Valley escarpments. She owns a small piece of land together with her lovely husband, and they have been blessed with lovely, angelic children. On the land, they have kept cows and grown vegetables for three years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. She recently ventured into a “side hustle” business. From Kiva lenders, Dinah is courteously seeking a loan worth 10,000 KES to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business.Juhudi Kilimo has teamed up with Kiva to provide Dinah with access to a loan that will help her to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business and that will also increase employment opportunities and bring about increasing profits. With your loan, Dinah’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but it will also reduce their income vulnerability.Be inspired and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business.

loans.name: Hanelyn

texts.en:
Hanelyn is 39 years old, married, and has two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from waiving bamboo making (use for house walling and drying rice grains).

She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

Hanelyn has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising pigs.

Rebecca dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, beans, ice cubes, etc.

Lilia has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, beans, ice cubes, etc

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
A 44-year-old married mother of four children. This is Jihad a hard working woman who runs her flower selling and special occasions decoration shop since 2006.

She is well known in her area, and supported by her neighbors. She is a good financial supporter to her family, especially to her husband who works hard in the concrete business to support his family.
Jihad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's increasing school tuition fees.
She hopes to expand her working sector in the future and spread her services in wider regions.

loans.use: to pay for her children's increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Sokha’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokha makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is the age of 48 living to the Lahore area. Her husband owns a workshop in a nearby town. He provides dent removal and painting services for damaged vehicle bodies. He has been doing this practice for many years and has a good reputation in the market. He appointed a helper over his workshop to look after and to encourage the customers from outside. The number of customers has increased due to his good attitude and impressive dealing.

To keep constant his reputation and to meet the increasing demands., he has urgent need of paint. Her husband is a poor person; due to household expenses he does not have enough savings to buy desired material and dent removal tools for his workshop.

Therefore, Parveenis trying to help her husband in the form of loan. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes to business and in the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to buy tools and paint for her husband's car repair and painting workshop.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en: Nisrine is a 21 year old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and three siblings. Her mother and father represents the main income source. Her parent’s only target is to satisfy their family needs and improve their lifestyle. Today, with the aim to pay her Technical study fees, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans to continue her education.

loans.use: to pay her Technical study fees

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 55-years old, married, and the mother of four children, living in the area of Lahore Pakistan.
Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw which is now in bad condition. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, she has contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can repair his rickshaw. He wants to maintain the engine’s piston, one wheel and want to pay labor cost over it. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

Rani is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain the engine’s piston, one wheel and body of auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is 59 years old and married woman. She has been doing a business of bangles sales for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. Her husband’s income is not enough to fulfill the family needs. Therefore she started her own business to contribute to the family income.

Sughran has requested a loan of 50000 PKR to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate an healthier source of income. She has a good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate an healthier source of income

loans.name: Tsisana

texts.en:
Tsisana is 52 years old woman, from village Akhali Samgori. She lives with her husband, who sometimes works as an artisan and gets a small income. The family used to have a dairy farm several months ago and now has no source of business income.

Tsinasa decided to set up a poultry farm with a special species of chicken and start selling them. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of significant income and live in under poverty.

According to above mentioned situation, Tsisana lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled her to get a loan of 4300 GEL and start poultry farming. She will purchase a special species of chickens and will start breeding them. The family will sell the grown chickens at the local open market and will generate a stable income which enables them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future. With support of the Start Up program Tsisana will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle their financial difficulties.

loans.use: to set up a special species of poultry farm.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 36, married and has 4 children. He has a small carpentry project and is requesting 5000 EGP loan to buy new equipment and wood for his project to afford the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and wood. .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more peanuts  and cellophane

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a businesswoman from Macalibre Alto, Lopez Jaena. She is 57 years old, married and has the expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Lydia is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied a loan to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Lydia continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Mamikon

texts.en:
Mamikon ended his first Kiva loan which greatly developed and enlarged the income from his hairdressing business. Mamikon has his own salon where he has been working for 12 years. Being professional, very friendly and polite in his work Mamikon greatly attracts and also keeps a lot of regular customers for many years. He manages his business in his native city Sevan of Gegharkunik region. Here he lives with his wife and their son, who is very famous sportsman.

Mamikon works every day without holidays and in this way he does not lose any customer. This time with this Kiva loan of 700.000 Armenian drams, he wants to provide more comfort for his customers and with this loan amount he will buy a sofa and armchairs and also a small table for his waiting room making his beauty salon more modern and nice.

loans.use: to buy a sofa and armchairs and also a small table for his waiting room, making his hairdressing salon more modern and nice.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida started her school in 2001 with the aim of educating the children in the rural area where she lives. Today, out of her 167 enrolled students 51% are female. The PKR 100,000 loan Rashida has borrowed will help her increase the quality of the school’s facilities and help her provide the community with a greater awareness and appreciation for education despite the challenges she faces in a low-income community.

loans.use: to increase the quality of the school’s facilities

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer from Gwani village. As a Babban Gona member, Saratu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Saratu will use this loan to store the maize she harvests, enabling her to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. 

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Saratu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Saratu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Seinern's Group

texts.en: Seinern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Seinern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Yab's Group

texts.en: Yab’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yab makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Gulbahar

texts.ru: Гулбахар, 53 года, замужем, есть шестнадцатилетняя дочь. У Гулбахар среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, вместе с супругом занимаются животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 5 лет назад. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 18 овец, на 0,34 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду, Гулбахар на сегодняшний день имеет хорошую прибыль от бизнеса в среднем 6,800 сом в месяц (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулбахар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Гулбахар планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и хочет накопить на обучение дочери в университете.
texts.en:
Gulbahar is 53, married, and the mother of a 16-year-old daughter.  She has a secondary education.  In order to provide for their family, she and her husband have been raising livestock and growing crops for the past five years.  Gulbahar now has three cows and 18 sheep on her farm, and she also grows corn for resale on 0.34 hectares of land.   Thanks to her very hard work, she makes a nice average income of 6,800 som per month (KGS) from her activity.  

In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her farming business.  She also wants to save enough money to send her daughter to university.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Эту милую и нежную девушку зовут Назокат. Ей 31 год. Ее муж работает поваром в Fast food. У нее в браке трое детей. Назокат дома занимается шитьем. Она шьет брюки, бриджи, домашнюю одежду и женскую одежду на продажу. Каждый день она шьет около двух одежды. Этим бизнесом она занята уже 5 лет. Назокат за столь время набралась большого опыта. Она хочет улучшить качество своей работы и этим привлечь больше клиентов. Таким образом, она собирается покупать новую машинку. Конечно, новая машинка будет влиять на качество одежды. Назокат верит, что скоро купит новую машинку и ее план осуществится.
texts.en:
Meet Nazokat, age 31, a kind and lovely young woman.  Her husband works as a cook in a fast food restaurant. The couple has three children.  Nazokat works from home, sewing pants, breeches, every-day clothes and women's dresses which she then resells.  She sews about two outfits on a daily basis.  She has been involved in this activity for the past five years and has gained a good deal of experience over time.  

Nazokat now wants to improve the quality of her work, so that she can attract more customers.  For this reason, she is planning to buy a new sewing machine, which will have a great impact on the quality of the clothes that she sews.  Nazokat is confident that she will soon be able to buy a new sewing machine and that she will achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and some fabrics.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans et mère de quatre enfants, Abla est une femme mariée vivant à Adidogomé. Abla est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner, Abla demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de bien vendre puis d’épargner et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et aider son mari à prendre en charge certaines dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: Abla is 34 and the mother of four children.  She is married and lives in Adidogomé.  She resells charcoal; she stocks up twice a month at the market and resells her merchandise in front of her house.  She is taking this loan to buy several bags of charcoal to increase her sales and save some money, which will in turn allow her to pay for her children's education and help her support her husband with some of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 30 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Styopa

texts.en:
Styopa, with his small family and small farm, lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region.

In his farm now he has cows, a heifer, a bull, sheep and chickens. With his wife Styopa sells his farm products, which are the only source of income for his family. They sell milk, macun (a national dairy-product), cheese, meat and eggs. All these goods he sells at the city’s wholesale market.

Styopa is very upset about his poor farm and the low income from it, which does not allow him to provide good living conditions for his son, who is school-aged now.

This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams Styopa asks as he wants to buy one more cow for his farm and also fodder for all his farm cattle. This will make his farm richer and enable him to store fodder for cattle since it will be needed over time.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for his farm and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza was born in 1997 in Tajikistan. Her family is large and she lives with her family together in a village.

She studied well in school and she always wanted to get higher education. Shahnoza now is a student of the second course at Tajikistan State University Politic and Business. Shahnoza studies well and she successfully takes part in different competitions.

Shahnoza is asking for a loan of 3,500 Somoni to pay for the university tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a housewife, Virginia wants to earn income while at home. She’s grateful because the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) helped her monetarily by approving her previous loan application of PHP 30,000. She also wants to thank lenders who provided financial assistance.

The previous loan helped her to sustain their essential needs and bought materials necessary for her tailoring business and grocery items for the variety store.

At times, there are customers who are delayed in making payments, which affects the business’ revenue. Despite this, Virginia perseveres to earn more each day. To keep her business running, she needs another loan. That’s why Virginia decided to apply for a PHP 40,000 loan this time to buy grocery items for her variety store and the other half for materials needed for her tailoring business.

Virginia has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears about religion and testimonies from partners. This made her become strong spiritually and dependent on God on every occasion.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries as well as items needed for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shahbana, 35, lives with her four children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Shahbana adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life.

Her husband sells silver crockery in his shop, which is very popular among his customers.

Shahbana is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. Her husband requires additional capital for the growth of his business. He would use the Kiva loan to purchase utensils, crockery and the required items to offer more varieties to his clients.

Shahbana hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business.

loans.use: to buy utensils and crockery for her husband's business.

loans.name: Makazi A Tazara 1 Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her mid 40s, is single and has one small child.

She has been running several projects, selling powdered soap, selling broiler chicken and making tie and dye materials for two years now. She works from 11:30 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Mary's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy chicks, powdered soap ingredients and ingredients for making tie and dye materials. She dreams of buying a machine for making bar soap.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group, MakaziI A Tazara 1, which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks, powdered soap ingredients and ingredients for making tie and dye materials.

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
Roselle is one of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) partners, who was granted a previous loan amount of PHP 23,000. She’s grateful as CCT and lenders helped her a lot with her business. The money was used to buy stocks of grocery items to add to the business.

Roselle aims to have a one stop shop some day where she can offer complete items needed by the consumers and support her children’s educational expenses as well. That’s why she’s contemplating ways that she can attract buyers/consumers. Turning her variety store into a grocery store is one of her goals.

She exerts her efforts and hard work for the business. Added capital and a revolving fund will help her business flourish. With this, she decided to apply for PHP 33,000 worth of loan to buy additional grocery items and other products for the store.

Despite being busy managing the business, Roselle spares time to attend the CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners and is able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is grateful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) was used by God to help her with her business. Aside from the monetary support, lectures and seminars are part of their program that help in moulding her continuously to be well equipped as an entrepreneur. With the prior loan of PHP 20,000, she was able to buy grocery items for her small variety store business. Having complete items is what she continually aspires to. The amount made a vast impact and she’s very thankful especially to all lenders.

Jeralyn aims to grow her business and be able save money for the future of her family as she wants her children to go until college and find a better job some day. With this, she’s requesting for a loan of PHP 22,000 for her to buy stocks of grocery items which will increase sales and attract more patrons.

Jeralyn regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Adamu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Adamu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Adamu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Adamu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
This is Abeer, a person who is adorable, serene, and happy, who ‎enjoys life and is grateful for the good things that happen to her every ‎day. She is a person who doesn’t need much to be happy.
‎
She is sewing traditional clothes and small pieces of fabrics; her ‎income helps to complement the money needed to provide for her ‎household, which she shares with her husband.
‎
Abeer has a very good business opportunity, but she needs a yarns ‎and fabrics and new requirements that she needs in her business. She ‎doesn’t have sufficient capital to buy them, which is why she is ‎requesting a loan to buy what she needs.‎

Abeer needs your help to achieve her dream which is an ‎independent sewing shop.‎

loans.use: to buy yarns ‎and fabrics and new requirements that she needs in her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is going to use the requested loan to redecorate his shop to attract ‎more customers to his shop, which sells electrical materials.

He is a ‎gentleman of age 35. He is married and has three children, all living in ‎Jarash. To get income, Ali owns a retail shop. The main reason for starting his business was personal ‎development. He is very honest that with the little earnings he gets he ‎has to save, educate his children and provide for his family.

The ‎main challenge he faces is adequate capital to run his project well, ‎given the fact that he dreams of constructing a good permanent ‎house for the family.‎

loans.use: to redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region with her husband. They have two daughters who are already married and live with their families.

Ofelya has higher pedagogical education and already 22 years of pedagogical experience. First she worked at the kindergarten, but in 2001, she began to work at the school as a teacher of Russian language and literature.

She mentions that being engaged in her beloved work, she work very hard and with great devotion. She is a very intellectual person and she wants to be aware of any news and innovations in the pedagogical world. This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams she asks for the purchase of a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature. All this will serve for her self-development, the thing that any person needs, no matter what profession he has.

loans.use: purchase a computer, accessories for it, and professional literature for her self-development.

loans.name: Fifi

texts.en:
Fifi is a single mother with four children. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She runs a textile shop selling clothes and a cosmetics shop. She built houses for rent so as to gain more income.

Fifi was forced to start up the business so as to cater for the family needs as any single parent would love to do. She dreams of educating her children to University level. She is challenged by inadequate capital to run all her businesses and her family at large.

She needs a loan to buy cosmetics and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tukur

texts.en:
Tukur is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Tukur has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Tukur would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Tukur can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Tukur will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Tukur is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ubale

texts.en:
Ubale is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ubale has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ubale would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Ubale can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ubale will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Ubale is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy improved farm machinery and hire skilled labour.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maram

texts.en:
Maram is 23 years old, a bachelor student. She is married and a mother of one child. Her husband is a worker in a quarry, but his income is not enough to pay the fees that she needs to pay.

Maram wants to earn her BA degree and find a good job after finishing her university to support her husband and her child.

Maram took from a loan of $1,000 from Alibdaa that will help her pay the fees for her higher education.

Maram is thankful to Kiva's partner Alibdaa.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Vanansio

texts.en:
Vanansio is a hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He takes care of his six children and wishes to educate all of them to a higher level of education though he lacks money.

He grows coffee and bananas as he does not have supplementary sources of income but he loves providing for his family and saving part of his income because he wants to construct a good residential house. His business is affected by unpredictable weather changes.

He is requesting a loan to buy mulches and fertilizers for his garden.

loans.use: to buy mulches and fertilizers for his garden.

loans.name: Bassima

texts.en:
Bassima is a 45-year-old married woman who has been working as a tailor for 32 years. She is a hardworking woman who puts so much effort into supporting her husband in covering their living needs.

She is well known in her region for the special talents she has in her domain.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car to facilitate her family's living.

Bassima is working hard to support her husband and hopes to expand her business in a well managed way.

loans.use: to buy a car to facilitate her family's living.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a hardworking, married, honest entrepreneur with four children based in Kamwenge, Uganda.

He mainly grows coffee to get income and has been a farmer for more than 20 years.

Edward loves being a good and caring father of his children given the fact that the whole responsibility rests on him. With the proceeds that Edward gets from his coffee, he has dreams of educating all his children to university, but he faces challenges of inadequate capital and soil exhaustion.

He needs credit to buy manure and fertilizers for his garden.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his garden.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is 34 years old and he lives in Zovaber village of Gegharkunik region. He has been a farmer from his very young age and as he mentions he likes all the work and activities connected with farming.

On his farm he has cows, calves, lambs, sheep, pigs and a lot of turkeys. He manages all his farming nearly alone since his father works as a driver and returns home very late and very tired, his mother and wife are busy with their family and house care. So he alone also arranges the sale of his farm products such as milk, meat, cheese, macun (national dairy-product) and also eggs.

Vardan feels great success in his farming and sure that in future he will have a farm richer with cattle and also more income from it. Now Vardan is asking for this Kiva loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as he wants to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle since with starting of autumn months any farmer must get prepared for the winter season.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle since with starting of autumn months any farmer must get prepared for the winter season.

loans.name: Asrorjon

texts.ru: Асрорчон 51 летный мужчина города Истаравшан. Он замужем и имеет двоих детей. Его жена работает учительницей в гимназии. Сам Асрорчон работает директором детской гимназии. У него есть собственная гимназия. В гимназии дети учиться с первого класса до седьмого класса. Асрорчон хочет, построит футбольную полю в гимназии. Ему не хватает денежных средств для купли строй материалы и зеленый газон. Газон и стройматериалы стоит дорого, по этой причине он обратился за кредитом. Асрорчон хочет улучшить все условия гимназию для детей. Он с детства мечтал стать директором и иметь собственную гимназию.
texts.en: Asrorjon is a 51-year-old man from the city of Istaravshan. He is married and has two children. His wife works as a school teacher. Asrorjon himself works as the headmaster of a children's school. He has his own school. In the school children study from the first grade to the seventh grade. Asrorjon wants to build a football pitch for the school. He does not have enough funds to buy the construction materials and green lawn. Lawn and construction materials are expensive, and so he has applied for a loan. Asrorjon wants to improve the conditions of the school for the children. He dreamed of becoming a headmaster since childhood and having his own school.

loans.use: to buy an artificial lawn and construction materials.

loans.name: María Lisa

texts.es:
En el barrio Cuba de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Las Increíbles.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 51 años de edad, está separada, pero  de esa relación tuvo cuatro hijos, todos  mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Ella hace varios años atrás aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña María es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para salir adelante, antes para sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora para ser independiente y no depender de nadie,  ella realiza trabajos de arreglos en prendas y también se dedica al comercio, ella compra y vende maní, compra el maní molido y quebrado a comerciantes mayoristas que le dejan a buen precio el mismo que luego ella vende en un local que tiene en su casa, ella también en ocasiones compra pescado al por mayor y también vende  en su casa por libras, de esta forma trabajando honradamente ella sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar maní, pescado y materiales de costura para sus trabajos. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Cuba in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited during all times of the year by local and foreign tourists, and for being one of the most important ports in the country and in America located on the shores of the Pacific, the Credit Group called Las Increíbles meets every 15 days.

This is where María lives. She is 51 years old and separated, but from this relationship she had four children who are all adults. One of her children still lives with her. Many years ago, she learned tailoring in a local school.

María is a woman who has had to work very hard to succeed, previously to support her children and now to be independent and not to have to depend on anyone. She works tailoring clothing and also buys and sells peanuts. She buys broken and crushed peanuts from wholesale vendors who give her a good price, and later sells the peanuts in a shop that she has in her house. Occasionally she also buys fish wholesale and also sells fish in her house by the pound. In this way she prospers by making an honest living.

This loan is to buy peanuts, fish and sewing materials for her work. She has worked with the Credit Group for 7 years and she likes it because the loans help her greatly. Her dream is to have good health to keep doing her work.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, fish and sewing materials.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar, 43, lives with her husband and three kids, who are all in school full-time. Her husband ‎works, and has a low income.‎

Sahar is hard-working and likes to make her own living so she can help her husband with the household ‎expenses, therefore she decided to depend on herself and start her own business.‎

She has tile washing machines which she runs from home. Her husband is helping her and now he is the one ‎who wash the tiles whether the tiles are in homes, companies, hospitals or supermarket, etc. ‎

Now she applied for a loan to help her husband more and more and buy new versions of these machines ‎with updated features that she need to improve the quality of her work and increase her income.‎

loans.use: to buy new tile cleaning machines ‎to help her husband.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda, where he grows crops as his main source of income. He has been a farmer for over eight years.

He has a dream of buying more land and increasing his household income, although he also has other household tasks to look after his family.

Alex faces a challenge of bad seasons that affect the growth and output of his crops.

He needs a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides for his gardens.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for his gardens.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is 37 years old and from the Gaza Strip. He is married and a father of five children.

Hani chose to take a loan from ACAD to buy new bags and women's accessories for his cosmetic store, and sell them to the people of the Gaza Strip so he can earn some money and improve his family's standards of living.

Hani says that the main challenge to his business is the weak economic situation in Gaza. He is looking to expand his store in Gaza so that he can serve more people.

Finally, Hani would like to thank ACAD and Kiva for letting him share his story.

loans.use: to buy new bags and women's accessories for his cosmetics store.

loans.name: Gregoria Primitiva

texts.es:
En el barrio Cuba de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Las Increíbles.
En este lugar vive la señora Gregoria, tiene 55  años de edad, está separada pero de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, con ella vive una hija.
Doña Gregoria  es una mujer muy luchadora que no le gusta ganarse la vida con su trabajo, ella hace poco y con la ayuda de los créditos empezó un negocio en su casa, con el primer crédito adecuo un local en el cual con la ayuda del crédito siguiente surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres, allí ella actualmente está vendiendo solo  víveres, actualmente está solicitando este nuevo crédito para poder comprar más variedad de productos que le permitan ir ganando mas clientela ya que sus clientes cada vez le piden mayor variedad de productos es por eso que ella espera surtir mas su tienda y así ganar mejores ingresos para su vida.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Cuba neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are visited by many domestic and foreign tourists and as being one of the most important ports in the country and in America located on the Pacific, the Las Increíbles loan group meets every two weeks.

Gregoria lives in this place. She is 55 years old, separated but from this relationship she has 6 children who are now adults. One daughter lives with her.

Gregoria is a very determined woman who doesn't like to earn her living with a job. A little while ago, and with the help of loans, she began a business in her home, with the first loan she outfitted a space where, with the help of the next loan, she stocked a small grocery store. There, she currently is selling only groceries. Currently she is asking for another loan to be able to purchase a greater variety of products which will allow her to get more customers since her customers always ask for a greater variety of products and, so, she hopes to stock her store more and, in this way, get more income for her life.

She will use this loan to stock her store more, she will purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other products. She has been in the loan group for 3 loan cycles and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she gets ahead. Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other products.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 39-year-old married man from Jabalia City, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: María José

texts.es:
En el barrio Cuba de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Las Increíbles.
En este lugar vive la señora Maria, tiene 28 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  10, 8  y 5 años de edad,  todos  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, ya que son muchos los gastos y lo que él hace no alcanza para solventarlos, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y zapatos por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella sale ya sea en las mañanas o noches a ofrecer sus productos, aprovecha estas horas ya que a estas horas es más fresco y encuentra a sus clientes con más facilidad,  ella también vende en sus casa, lleva más de 3 años  que se dedica a esta actividad  la cual le permiten ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, zapatos, camisas, blusas, entre otras prendas. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Cuba in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented during all times of the year by locals and foreigners, and for being one of the most important ports in the country and America situated on the shores of the Pacific, the Credit Group called Las Increíbles meets every 15 days.

This is where María lives. She is 28 years old and in a common-law relationship from which she has three children, who are 10, 8 and 5 years old. All are studying in school. Her husband is a bricklayer.

María is a woman who likes to work to help her husband to succeed, since there are many expenses and what he earns does not cover all of them. For this reason she works in business. She sells clothing of all types and shoes by catalog. She sells door to door, in the mornings or the evenings. She takes advantage of these hours of the day because at these times it is cool outside and she is able to more easily find customers. She also sells from her home. She has done this job for more than 3 years and it has allowed her to make a living.

This loan is to buy pants, shoes, shirts, and blouses, among other types of apparel. She has worked with the Credit Group for 3 loan cycles and she likes it because it provides her with loans. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy pants, shoes, shirts, blouses, and other clothing.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a hardworking woman, currently involved in a buy-and-sell business of personal products. In managing the business for 11 years, she still needs guidance in making the business grow. With this, she takes advantage every time there are seminars for entrepreneurs conducted by Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She’s been a longtime member of CCT and grateful that aside from the seminars, they were able to approve her previous loan, which made a vast impact on the business. The amount was used to buy personal products.

Raquel dreams to continually succeed in her chosen industry. Despite that there are customers who are late in terms of paying for the products and some forget to pay at all, which affects the income of the business.

She wants to keep funds to support her buy-and-sell business, that’s why she’s applying for a Php 20,000 loan to buy stock of personal products like clothing items and other similar items that are usually asked for by her clients for orders. By determination and perseverance she believes that the business will grow and indeed, with the help of God. She’s hoping that her request will once again be considered.

On a weekly basis, Raquel regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of clothing items for her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn lives in Masindi, Uganda. She sells general merchandise such as sugar and sodas among other items. She built houses for rent so as to increase on her income generation. She started the business to support her husband as the saying that goes "two heads are better than one". She hopes to open up another shop despite competition and constant price changes of retail products, which is a great challenge in her business. She will use the loan to buy sugar, sodas and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sodas and other items to sell.

loans.name: Iliyasu

texts.en:
Iliyasu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Iliyasu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Iliyasu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Iliyasu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Iliyasu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Iliyasu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Georgina Monserrate

texts.es:
En el barrio Cuba de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Las Increíbles.
En este lugar vive la señora Georgina, tiene 18 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre pero aun no tienen  hijos. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Georgina es una mujer muy luchadora que  le gusta colaborar con su marido para así salir adelante, ellos tienen un negocio de venta de bebidas en su casa, venden aguas, sodas, cervezas, energizantes  y otras bebidas, así como también ciertos bocaditos y cosas de picar, ellos entregan a domicilio el agua y de esto se encarga su marido con lo cual se gana algo extra que les sirve para tener mejores ganancias, llevan un años con este negocio el cual les está dejando lo necesario para vivir.
Este crédito es para comprar agua, sodas, cervezas y otras bebidas. Lleva dos ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Cuba neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are visited by many domestic and foreign tourists and as being one of the most important ports in the country and in America located on the Pacific, the Las Increíbles loan group meets every two weeks.

Georgina lives in this place. She is 18 years old and is in a common-law marriage but doesn't have any children yet. Her husband is a construction worker.

Georgina is a very determined woman who likes to work with her husband to get ahead. They have a business selling drinks in their house. They sell water, sodas, beer, energy drinks, and other drinks, and also some snacks and other small items. They deliver water to the home and her husband takes care of this, with which he earns a bit extra which helps them have more earnings. They have been in this business for one year, which is giving what they need to live.

This loan is to purchase water, sodas, beer, and other drinks. She has been in the loan group for two cycles and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase water, sodas, beer and other drinks.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 30-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Santa Gertrudis

texts.es:
En el barrio Cuba de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Las Increíbles.
En este lugar vive la señora Santa, tiene 39 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, dos ya mayores de edad y los menores  de  14, 12, 7  y 5 años de edad,  los 4 menores  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es ayudante de fotógrafo.
Doña Santa es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganar sus propios recursos por el bien de su familia, ella trabaja en una casa en las mañanas cuidando a una niña por lo cual recibe un pago mensual, pero también en su casa  tiene una tienda de víveres, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad,  también vende productos de Yanbal aunque este tipo de ventas también lo hace puerta a puerta, son sus hijos los que le ayudan en su negocio en las mañanas que ella trabaja pero cuando ella llega es la que se hace cargo del negocio y de sus actividades en el hogar.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar víveres que aun le hacen falta para surtir su tienda y productos Yanbal. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy buenos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Cuba in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented during all times of the year by locals and tourists, and for being one of the most important ports in the country and in America situated on the shores of the Pacific, the Credit Group called Las Increíbles meets every 15 days.

This is where Santa lives. She is 39 years old and in a common law relationship. From this relationship she has six children, two of whom are adults and the others who are 14, 12, 7 and 5 years old. The 4 younger ones are in school. Her husband is an assistant to a photographer.

Santa is a woman who likes to work for herself and earn her own money for her family. She works in a house in the mornings taking care of a little girl for which she receives a monthly wage, but she also has a convenience store in her house. She sells all types of staple products. She also sells Yanbal products (a brand of beauty products sold in Ecuador), and she sells these products door to door as well. Her children help her with her business on the mornings that she works but when she returns, she is in charge of the business and her activities in the home.

This loan will be used to supply her store. She is going to buy provisions that are lacking from her store and Yanbal products. She has worked with the Credit Group for 3 years and likes it because the loans are very good. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy provisions and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Yarita Jaqueline

texts.es:
En el barrio Cuba de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Las Increíbles.
En este lugar vive la señora Yarita, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 2 hijos de  11 y 9 años de edad,  ambos  estudian en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en un almacén en la ciudad.
Doña Yarita es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja tres o cuatro días a la semana, aprovecha las horas de la mañana que sus hijos están estudiando para salir a realizar sus recorridos con más facilidad, ella también vende en su casa a clientes, vende a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, ella lleva poco tiempo con su negocio el cual espera mejorar con la ayuda de los créditos.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, vestidos, entre otras prendas de catalogo. Lleva 5 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
In the Cuba neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are visited by many domestic and foreign tourists and as being one of the most important ports in the country and in America located on the Pacific, the Las Increíbles loan group meets every two weeks.

Yarita lives in this place. She is 29 years old, married, and in this relationship has 2 children, ages 11 and 9, both of whom are students. Her husband works at a store in the city.

Yarita is a homemaker who, to get her own income, works selling clothing from catalogs. She sells from door to door, and works three or four days per week. She takes advantage of the morning hours, since her children are at school, to go out to make her rounds more easily. She also sells to customers from her house. She sells on credit and collects weekly. She has had her business for a short time and she hopes to improve it with the help of the loans.

This loan is to purchase pants, blouses, dresses, and other clothing from the catalog. She has been in the loan group for 5 years and she likes it because the loans are quick and very helpful. Her dream is to give her little ones the best.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, dresses and other clothing.

loans.name: Safeye

texts.en: Safeye is 44, married and has three children. Her husband is retired and receives a low pension.‎ Safeye enjoys working so she can earn her own income and help with the household expenses and study ‎fees. She sells all types of clothes. Her business located in her home and she is running it alone. ‎She applied for a loan to buy more clothes and more blankets to sell and increase her income. She needs your support to achieve her dreams.‎

loans.use: to buy more clothes and blankets to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Dolores Gusman

texts.es:
En el barrio Cuba de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Las Increíbles.
En este lugar vive el señor Dolores, tiene 50 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, llevas 2 años ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le agrada porque gracias a los créditos él puede salir adelante. 
Don Dolores es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta a base de esfuerzo y trabajo salir adelante y ayudar  a sus padres que son de escasos recursos, el se  dedica al comercio,   vende toda clase de ropa en su casa. El que hace poco tuvo un accidente que le impide salir a vender razón por lo cual la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su casa, gracias a los créditos él ha podido salir adelante y solventar gastos de medicinas, actualmente ya está casi repuesto y espera con este crédito poder mejorar el negocio que es el que le permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y otras prendas. Sus sueños es tener un carro para salir a vender.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Cuba in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented during all times of the year by locals and tourists, and for being one of the most important ports in the country and in America situated on the shores of the Pacific, the Credit Group called Las Increíbles meets every 15 days.

This is where Dolores lives. He is 50 years old, single and lives at home with his parents. He has worked with the Credit Group for 2 years and he is grateful because thanks to the loans he has been able to move forward.

Dolores is a very hardworking man who likes to succeed through his hard work and help his parents, who have scarce resources. He works in business, and sells all types of clothing in his home. A short time ago he had an accident that prevented him from leaving home, which is the reason why the majority of his sales are made in his house. Thanks to the loans, he has been able to move forward and pay for medical expenses. He has now almost recovered and awaits this loan to be able to improve the business which allows him to earn a living.

The loan is to buy pants, T-shirts, blouses, and other clothing. His dream is to have a car to go out and make sales.

loans.use: to buy pants, T-shirts, blouses and other clothing.

loans.name: Darwin Daniel

texts.es:
En el barrio Cuba de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Las Increíbles.
En este lugar vive el señor Darwin, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 3  hijos de 11, 9 y 5 años  de edad, todos estudian  en escuela. Su mujer es comerciante. 
Don Darwin es un hombre que siempre le ha gustado trabajar en varias actividades para sacar adelante a su familia,  hace mas de 3 años  y con la ayuda de los créditos emprendió un negocio el cual comparte con su mujer, ellos se dedican a la venta  ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ellos salen a vender por toda la ciudad y en ocasiones el se desplaza a otros lugares, cuando el sale su mujer se queda en casa hasta donde también llegan sus clientes. Este negocio él lo puede financiar gracias a los créditos razón por lo cual está muy agradecido.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas y  otras prendas. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the Cuba neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are visited by many domestic and foreign tourists and as being one of the most important ports in the country and in America located on the Pacific, the Las Increíbles loan group meets every two weeks.

Darwin lives in this place. He is 33 years old, and is in a common-law marriage from which he has 3 children, ages 11, 9 and 5; they are all students. His wife is a saleswoman.

Darwin is a man who has always liked to work in various jobs to get his family ahead. More than 3 years ago, and with the help of the loans, he undertook a business which he shares with his wife. They work selling all sorts of clothing, they sell from door to door. They go out to sell all over the city and sometimes they go to other places. When he goes out, his wife stays in the house where customers also come. He is able to finance this business thanks to the loans, for which he is very grateful.

This loan will be used to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and other clothing. He has been in the loan group for 5 loan cycles and he likes it because the loans help a lot. His dream is to give his family the best.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts and other clothing.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 40-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Jamal took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.ru: Гулназ, 36 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, уже 7 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть корова, 10 овец, и 0,32 Га собственной и 0,50 Га арендованной земли, где выращивает ячмень. Благодаря упорному труду Гулназ, ее деятельность позволяет приносить около 9,000 сом в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Гулназ в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка. Доходы от кредита Гулназ планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность приобрести автомобиля для ее семьи.
texts.en: Gulnaz is 36 years old, married, and has four childrne. She has a secondary education and she has been rearing animals and growing crops for seven years. She has a cow and ten sheep, and she has 0.32 hectares of her own land and 0.50 hectares of rented land where she grows barley. Thanks to Gulnaz's hard work, her business brings her about 9,000 som [KGS] per month which is the basis for covering the family's outgoings on food and household needs. In order to develop her business further, Gulnaz has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy a calf. Gulnaz plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further growth of her business in order to be able to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy a calf in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Katherine Andreina

texts.es:
En el barrio Cuba de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Las Increíbles.
En este lugar vive la señora Katherine, tiene 22 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  6 años de edad, son gemelos y  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Katherine  es una mujer muy trabajadora que hace lo posible por darles a su familia lo necesario para vivir,  ella y su marido se  dedican a  la venta de pescado, ellos tienen un local en le mercado central de la ciudad en el cual de lunes a sábado venden el mejor pescado a sus clientes ya sea por libras o por piezas, todos los días su marido se desplaza hasta las playas de la localidad lugar en el cual compra el pescado a pescadores de la zona los cuales le venden a buen precio para luego vender en su local, llevan 5 años dedicados a esta actividad la cual le da lo necesario para vivir.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Lleva un año en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su vida y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Cuba in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented during all times of the year by locals and foreigners, and for being one of the most important ports in the country and America situated on the shores of the Pacific, the Credit Group called Las Increíbles meets every 15 days.

This is where Katherine lives. She is 22 years old and is in a common law relationship. From her relationship she has six-year-old twins, who go to school. Her husband is a businessman.

Katherine is a very hardworking woman who does everything possible to provide her family with what they need. Her and her husband work selling fish. They have a shop in the city's central market in which from Monday to Saturday they sell the best fish to their customers by the pound or by piece. Each day her husband travels to the local beaches where he buys the fish from fishermen in the region, who sell him the fish at a good price so that it can later be sold in the market. They have spent 5 years working at this job, which provides them with what is necessary to live.

This loan is to buy fish. Katherine has worked with the Credit Group for one year and likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dream is to continue improving her life and provide the best for her sons.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Mazira

texts.ru: Мазира, 56 лет, замужем, имеет 6 детей. У нее среднее образование, 17 лет торгует мыло-моющей продукцией на рынке. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 34,000 сом (KGS). Мазира очень приветливая и общительная, а также любит порядок в делах. В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса и приумножения прибыли, Мазира обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение оборотных средств в торговле. На доходы от кредита Мазира хочет и дальше развивать бизнес.
texts.en: Mazira is 56 years old, married, and has six children. She has a secondary education. She has been selling soap and washing products at the market for 17 years. Her monthly income is about 34,000 som (KGS). Mazira is very friendly and sociable, and she also likes order in her affairs. In order to develop her business further and increase her profits, Mazira has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to increase her stock of goods. Mazira wants to continue to develop her business with the proceeds of the loan.

loans.use: to buy soap and washing products to increase the stock in her shop.

loans.name: Kennedy Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kennedy está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres. Está ubicado en la ciudad de Caacupé, con 16 integrantes realizan muchos esfuerzos para así poder salir adelante junto con sus familias. 
La señora Candida, una de las integrantes, ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con la venta de perfumes y mercería, comenta que trata siempre de poner su mayor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante y mejorar en su humilde emprendimiento.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de perfumes, cremas, colonias, etc., y otros productos variados para poder seguir con sus ventas, y esforzándose por salir adelante para ayudar a su familia. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos a través del programa de comités.
texts.en: The group called Kennedy is in its first loan cycle of the women's committee. It is located in the city of Caacupe, with 16 members who work hard to move ahead with their families. Candida, one of its members, helps supporting her family with the sale of perfumes and haberdashery items. She comments that she always puts her greater effort to move ahead and improve in her humble enterprise. She is requesting this loan to buy perfumes, creams, colognes, etc., and other varied products to continue with her sales, and to work hard to help her family. She is grateful for this given opportunity that she is getting to be able to improve her life conditions and those of her loved ones through the committee program.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, colognes, etc., and other varied products.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector continua con sus estudios, esta esforzándose por ser un buen profesional y por medio de sus estudios poder ayudar a las demás personas, el comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda para poder continuar estudiando.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo, ya que quiere volver a pagar sus cuotas, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer.
texts.en: Hector continues with his studies, and he is working hard to be a good professional and be able to help others through his education. He comments that with his previous loan he was able to pay for his tuition fees, which was very helpful to continue studying. Today, he is requesting a new loan, because he wants to pay his fees again and be able to continue with his studies. He is grateful for this new given opportunity to be able to grow.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition fees.

loans.name: Mahmmoud

texts.en:
Mahmmoud is 34 years old, married, and has two children. He is from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from regular power outages 12-16 hours a day. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Mahmmoud requested a loan from FATEN, which he will use to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive, and inefficient. This loan will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.en:
Chichicastenango is a beautiful city, full of color, rich in trade, and blessed with hard-working citizens.

“Luz Divina”, or “Divine Light” trust bank, a group of 8 women with a median of 30 years of age, is in its 3rd loan cycle being supported by Kiva investors. Most of the women of Luz Divina have had the opportunity to study up to between 4th and 6th grade, and have goals to provide good quality of life and education to their children, running businesses weaving and embroidering huipiles and fajas, traditional blouses and belts, and raising animals to send in the local market.

Jerónima is a group member who is 59 years old, and was not able to go to school, but worked hard to provide education to her 3 children, who are now grown. Her business is in animal husbandry, raising pigs, chickens and bulls to sell. With the loan that she is requesting, Jerónima will buy more pigs, with a plan to raise them up, healthy and strong, to sell for a good price and bring in some income.

The women comment that “in these loan cycles and with the support of Kiva, we have achieved growth and increased profit in our businesses in addition to learning how to manage our businesses wisely, through the dynamic and involved workshops Friendship Bridge provides us.”

loans.use: to buy more pigs, with a plan to raise them up, healthy and strong, to sell for a good price and bring in some income.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou est âgée de 52 ans et est une femme mariée. Akou vit avec ses trois enfants à charge à Adidogomé où elle prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs et du mil pour ses consommateurs qui en trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Akou s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs, du mil et du sucre  en vue de mieux revendre puis de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire et ainsi promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants et bien réorganiser son commerce.
texts.en:
Akou is 52 years old and is a married woman. She lives with her three children that she takes care of in Adidogomé, where she prepares mash made from corn and millet for her consumers who are satisfied with her activity.

Akou gets her supplies once a month at the market and is requesting this loan to order bags of corn, millet and sugar so that she can resell better and then earn a good profit margin, hence promoting her children's education and reorganising her trade properly.
