loans.use: to buy one bag of millet, one bag of corn and one bag of sugar.

loans.name: Tanpousemdi (Petit Groupe)

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA est la responsable du groupe TANPOUSEMDI (PETIT GROUPE). Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 30 ans et le moins âgé a 08 ans. 07 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 07 personnes en charges. 
Mme fait du maraîchage depuis 25 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 02 boîtes d’oignons, 06 sacs d’engrais et 01 boîte de tomate.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans activité et aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande productrice.
texts.en:
Mrs Aminata is the leader of the Tanpousemdi (Petit Groupe) group. She is married and mother to seven children. The eldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 8 years old. Seven children attend school and she has seven persons in her care.

Mrs has been growing vegetables for 25 years. She gets her supplies in surrounding villages. With the money received, she intends to buy two boxes of onion seeds, six bags of fertiliser and one box of tomato seeds.

She wants to use the income from the loan to reinvest in her activity and help with her children's schooling. She has the ambition to become a great farmer.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of onion seeds, six bags of fertiliser and one box of tomato seeds.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 45-year-old married father of three and a Palestinian refugee. Twenty nine years, he started manufacturing wooden boards. He is trying desperately to cover the increasing needs and expenses of his family.
Ahmad is a hard worker who is trying to develop his business and line with the market, thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to buy a generator which will facilitate his work for the state's electricity, which is not stable in Lebanon.
Ahmad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and provide his family with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator which will provide constant electricity to facilitate his work.

loans.name: Wend-Panga Lougvisse Grand Groupe

texts.fr:
Mme MAMOUNATA est  la   responsable du groupe WEND-PANGA LOUGVISSE GRAND GROUPE. Elle  est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 16 ans et le moins âgé a 10 mois. 01 enfant va à l’école  et  elle a 05 personnes en charges.
Mme fait du maraîchage depuis 25 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter  10 paniers de tomates et 25 sacs d’oignons.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour  réinvestir dans son  activité. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
Mrs Mamounata is the leader of the Wend-Panga Lougvisse Grand Groupe group. She is married and the mother of five children. The eldest is 16 years old and the youngest is 10 months old. One child goes to school, and she has five persons in her care.

Mrs has been growing vegetables for 25 years. She gets her supplies in surrounding villages. With the money disbursed, she intends to buy ten baskets of tomatoes and 25 bags of onions.

She wants to use the profits from the loan to reinvest in her activity. She has the ambition to become a great trader.

loans.use: to buy ten baskets of tomatoes and twenty-five bags of onions.

loans.name: Ndre

texts.en:
Ndre is married and in the early fifties and has two children. For about fifteen years now, he's been doing construction as seen in the photograph. The last few months, he was been feeling very sick and a paid visitation to a private clinic in the capital city of Tirana, gave him the heads up on what was going and what he was supposed to do in the very near future. They then scheduled him for immediate oral surgery. Ndre's family lives in a little town known for the highest poverty rate and also the highest corruption and crime rate in the country. Before the collapse of the regime, the town was very industrial and as such, everyone in the town came from other regions for work. After the collapse, all these families were left unemployed and struggled financially. Some of the youngsters did the unthinkable, they committed crimes or got involved in other such hateful activities; however, some of them, continued living under the extreme poverty, accepting the fate, as Ndre said during the interview.
The reason for this loan is to pay for an oral surgery of Ndre.

loans.use: to pay for an oral surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN JOVEN PADRE DE FAMILIA QUE ACTUALMENTE ES EL SUSTENTO DE SU FAMILIA, SUFRE DE PROBLEMAS DENTALES YA QUE LAS MUELAS DEL JUICIO LE SALIERON EMPALMADAS Y LE URGE UNA CIRUGÍA PARA EVITAR ALTERACIÓN EN LA MANDÍBULA. DESAFORTUNADAMENTE SUS INGRESOS SON MÍNIMOS Y ES EL ÚNICO SUSTENTO DE LA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
He is a young father who currently supports his family. He suffers from dental problems because his wisdom teeth overlap.

Surgery is urgent to avoid changes in his jaw. Unfortunately, his income is minimal, and he is the only support for his family.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Kiswendsida 4 Hommes Koubri Group

texts.fr:
Mr DANIEL  est  le responsable du groupe  KISWENDSIDA 4  HOMMES  KOUBRI. Il est marié et père de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13 ans et le moins âgé a 10 mois. 02 enfants vont à l’école et il a 05 personnes en charges. 
Mr  fait du  jardinage  depuis  07 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte  s’acheter  02 sacs d’engrais.
Il  veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son  activité. Il ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mr Daniel is the leader of the Kiswendsida 4 Hommes Koubri group. He is married and the father of three children. The eldest is 13 years old and the youngest is 10 months old. Two children go to school and he has five persons in his care.

Mr has been gardening for seven years. He gets his supplies in surrounding villages. With the money disbursed, he intends to buy two bags of fertiliser.

He wants to use the profits from the loan to grow his activity. His ambition is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy two bags of fertiliser.

loans.name: Wendpagoe Group

texts.fr:
Mme PAULINE  est la responsable du groupe WENDPAGOE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 32 ans et le moins âgé a 16ans. 02 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charges. 
Mme fait de l’élevage  depuis 22 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 06 porcs et 200 kg de foin.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son  activité. Elle ambitionne offrir un bel avenir à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs Pauline is the leader of the Wendpagoe group. She is married and the mother of three children. The eldest is 32 years old and the youngest is 16 years old. Two children attend school and she has six persons in her care.

Mrs has been rearing livestock for 22 years. She gets her supplies in ne

loans.use: to buy six pigs and 200 kg of hay.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, es mayor de tres hermanos, estudia la carrera de Contaduría Pública, desea seguir especializándose una vez que termine su carrera en el área de su profesión y más adelante montar su propia oficina de contabilidad. 
Él es una persona muy dedicada a sus estudios que pone todo de sí para poder cumplir su meta de ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Eduardo is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. He is the oldest of three children. He is studying for the Public Accounting degree. He wants to continue specializing in this profession once he obtains his degree and later set up his own accounting office.

He is very dedicated to his studies. He puts all he can to fulfill his goal of becoming someone in life.

He requests this loan to pay the tuition. This will enable him to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay the university tuition.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La socia Silvia continua dedicando al negocio de confección de muñecas de tela, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de telas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Silvia continues with her business of making fabric dolls. She has been in this business for years, and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. She is a responsible and hard-working person.

She wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way. She is requesting the loan to buy fabric and other items.

She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy fabric, among other items.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
La socia Maria Victoria pertenece al banco comunal LAS HIJAS DE MARIA, la socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de librería y a la vez continua trabajando como asistenta social, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar  plumones, papeles, lapiceros entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Victoria belongs to the Las Hijas De Maria communal bank. She continues with her school supply business, and she continues working as a social worker. She is a very responsible and hard-working person. She has been in her business for a good amount of time, and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.

She wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way. She is requesting the loan to buy markers, paper, pens, and other items.

She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy markers, paper, pens, and other items.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina used her previous loan to rent a kisubi (banana) plantation. She operates a business distilling waragi, a local brew, in her village. In addition, she operates a retail shop and grows food crops such as ground nuts, beans, and bananas. Hardships such as limited capital to invest more is still a major hindrance to the development and expansion of her business.

Regina requested another loan, which she will use to rent a kisubi (banana) plantation. She dreams of increasing her income generating activities.

loans.use: to rent a kisubi (banana) plantation.

loans.name: Aitazhihan

texts.ru: Айтажихан, 60 лет, вдова, есть 2 детей. У Айтажихан средне-специальное образование, она много лет занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 3 овцы. На 0,16 Га она выращивает картофель для реализации. Совокупный ежемесячный доход Айтажихан около 5,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойное содержание семьи. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели и удобрений для обработки почвы. Айтажихан является лидером группы "Маданият", всего в группе состоят 3 человек. Доходы от кредита Айтажихан планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и покупку автомобиля для бизнеса.
texts.en:
Aitazhihan is 60 years old, a widow, and has two children. Aitazhihan has a secondary vocational qualification. She has been farming for many years. She has two cows and three sheep. She grows potatoes for sale on 0.16 hectares of land. Aitazhihan's gross monthly income is about 5,000 som (KGS) but these funds are not sufficient to support the family in a decent way. To develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a heifer and fertilizer to treat her land.

Aitazhihan is the leader of the "Madaniyat" group which comprises three people. Aitazhihan plans to use the proceeds of the loan to develop her farm and buy a car for the business.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and fertilizer to treat her land in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

With the help of this loan, Samaila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, he will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Samaila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia Maria Mercedes continua dedicándose  al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia se siente agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas en la plazo establecido, la socia continua vendiendo los productos de primera necesidad a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, gaseosas, arroz, aceite entre otros.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes continues with her grocery store business. She is a responsible and hard-working person.

She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established time frame.

She continues selling basic needs products to her customers that request them. This is the way that she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy milk, soft drinks, rice, and cooking oil, among others.

loans.use: to buy milk, soft drinks, rice, and cooking oil, among others.

loans.name: Ninoska

texts.es:
La socia Ninoska pertenece al banco comunal LAS HIJAS DE MARIA;la socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de venta de licores, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable ,la socia agradece el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas mensuales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de licores y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Ninoska belongs to the Las Hijas De Maria communal bank. She continues with her business of selling liquor. She has been in her business for a good amount of time. It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. She is a responsible person.

She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her monthly payments. This is the way that she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy liquor and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy liquor and soft drinks.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is married and has children. She is a helpful and ambitious woman, who is working hard to help her husband (in the ‎photo).‎ Her husband opened his own coffee ‎kiosk.

Nisreen requested a loan, which she will use to help her husband buy more products and coffee to increase his sales and his income.‎

loans.use: to help her husband purchase more ‎products and coffee.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina, a 62-year-old woman, is from a small village called Meore Sviri. She has a pensioner husband. The couple requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for their agricultural business, but without any success. Valentina's loan request was rejected each time because of their low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of the income for the family is from a small agribusiness, particularly from a vineyard and from cattle breeding.

According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Valentina's loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

Valentina will make a heating system for her greenhouse and start harvesting vegetables and greens. She will sell the products at the open market of the nearby town.

As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will significantly increase. Valentina and her husband will be able to create better living conditions for themselves.

loans.use: to make a heating system for her greenhouse.

loans.name: Ozlem

texts.en:
Özlem is married. She works in an accountant's office. She has been selling Tupperware for two years. In this way she makes extra money to easily supply her needs. She sells the products to her friends and neighbors.

She aims to buy a house by increasing her sales and making savings.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Özlem Hanım evli. Bir muhasebe dükkanında çalışıyor. İki yıldır Tupperware ürün satışı yapıyor. Bu işle kendine ek gelir elde ederek ihtiyaçlarını daha rahat karşılıyor. Ürünlerini arkadaşlarına ve çevresine satıyor. Gelirini arttırıp, tasarruf yaparak bir ev almak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware products.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 49-year-old, widowed man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like Irish potatoes, and also does retail selling of produce foods like beans, posho and rice. He started these activities with a hope of earning a living.

Joseph has hardships like low capital that hinder expansion of his business. However, he has future hopes of educating all his children given the task of playing both fatherly and motherly roles, and expanding his business to new areas.

Joseph needs a loan to buy bean seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy more bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 24-year-old, married woman who started one year ago selling blankets and more to help her ‎husband in covering their needs and expenses.
‎
She has professional skills in this domain and is well-known among her region. She is working hard to ‎develop her business, so today she is acquiring a youth loan to buy necessary products and new blankets ‎to be ready for the winter season and satisfy her customers' needs.
‎
Asmaa hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's ‎living conditions.‎

loans.use: to buy necessary products and new blankets.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 47-year-old, hardworking, married woman with three children aged 6, 10 and 14 years. All her children attend school. She also takes care of two more children of her relatives, and the whole family lives in Kamwenge, Uganda.

Annah grows crops, especially bananas, which she supplements with goat grazing. The intention of all her effort is to have improved standards of living in her home. She cherishes her children and has a vision of educating all of them, then constructing a good permanent house, but she faces challenges of unpredictable weather changes and inadequate capital.

She is requesting a loan to buy manure for her banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy manure for her banana plantation.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en: Hussain is a 22-year-old Jordanian single man living with his parents and five siblings. He attends the ‎university and is in his fourth year, majoring in accounting. Hussain also works as a smith ‎with his father for extra money. Today, he is applying for a loan to pay his university educational fees. He ‎states that this loan will help him to pursue a good education.

loans.use: to pay his university educational fees.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina de 60 años de edad es una microempresaria residente en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla y al contar con el apoyo de su cónyuge quien le sugirió emprender su negocio desde la comodidad de su hogar, en el año 2013 adquirió un enfriador en el que conserva bebidas y refrescos, los cuales comercializa entre los habitantes del sector.  Alterno a esta actividad comercial, también confecciona prendas de vestir, arte que aprendió desde muy joven y que ejerce con muy buenos resultados. Guillermina es muy enérgica a pesar de su avanzada edad, y no es un obstáculo para que todos los días de la semana esta mujer pueda estar al pendiente de sus negocios, ella está dispuesta a atender a su clientela a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m.  En la temporada que se avecina las ventas se incrementan y debe estar preparada con un mayor stock de productos, es por ello que está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para surtir el enfriador con bebidas compradas al por mayor entre ellas cervezas, gaseosas y jugos. Su meta a futuro es aperturar un local y realizarle remodelaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Guillermina, age 60, is a small businesswoman who lives in a neighborhood in the Barranquilla municipality. She has her husband's support, and he suggested that she understake this business from the comfort of her home. In 2013 she got a cooler for the drinks and soft drinks that she sells to the residents in the area. In addition to this commercial activity, she makes clothes. This is an art she learned when she was very young, and she practices it with very good results.

Guillermina is very energetic, in spite of her advanced age. Her age does not prevent her from being able to be vigilant with her businesses every day of the week. She is ready to tend to her customers from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.

In the coming season sales increase, and she needs to be prepared with more stock of products. That is why she is applying for a loan. This is her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. The loan is to stock her cooler with drinks like beer, soft drinks, and juices that she will buy wholesale.

Her goal for the future is to open a place and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to stock her cooler with drinks like beer, soft drinks, and juices bought for wholesale.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 49-year-old woman who loves caring for children because she has patience for children. Rosemary has been working as a nursery teacher for the past 15 years with a private kindergarten school in Accra. Currently, she provides after-school care to children whose parents do not have anyone else to help care for their children and their job schedules do not allow them to pick up their kids on time as required by the school.

Rosemary started this after-school care a year ago and is working with about 15-20 kids. A loan of 3,000 GHS will help her to buy more plastic chairs, toys, and story books to help the children to feel at home whenever they come over to her care center.

“My future plans are to construct a permanent structure and a standard playground for these children. My challenge has been the inconsistency in the payment of the children's bills. I also want to thank all the investors of these loans and also entreat them to visit Ghana since we are a peaceful nation.”

loans.use: to purchase chairs, toys, and story books.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is an active and hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He is married with five children and also looks after one orphan.  He used his previous loan to buy seedlings for his farm. He still grows crops as his main source of income alongside grazing of goats.  With these two sources of income, he has been able to improve his household income.  John has hopes of educating all his children and expanding his coffee gardens into a modern and significant coffee farm, but he is still limited by bad weather and inadequate capital.  He is requesting a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his gardens.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his gardens.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 59 years old, hardworking, and married with three children. He runs a general store at Alajo, a suburb of Accra, Ghana. A loan of 5500 GHS will enable Benjamin to stock up his general store to increase sales. The loan is to help him purchase more goods such as canned drinks, snacks, cookies, and other groceries to be able to meet the growing demands of his customers. His customers are people living in the community. In the future Benjamin wants to establish a corn milling business at his residence and also save enough money to put back into the business. He wishes to express his heartfelt gratitude to lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to resell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 48-year-old, hardworking, married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She lives with four children and deals in cattle fattening, but also earns extra income from rentals, which has helped her improve upon the standards of living of her home.

Joyce faces challenges of inadequate financial support and labor to work on her farm, though in the nearby future, she hopes to expand her animal farm and build more rentals to earn more income.

She is requesting a loan to buy more cows to add to her farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add to her farm.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is single. She deals in farming, growing mainly tomatoes. The challenges she encounters are price fluctuations and floods. She tries to handle this by diversifying in business. For example, she also operates a tea room as side income.

At the moment, she wants to construct rentals for income generation, but the materials onsite, like sand, stones, and bricks, are not enough for the kickoff stage. She lacks other materials like cement and timber.

She is requesting financial support to buy the missing construction materials like cement and timber for her house. She will be grateful for your help.

loans.use: to buy missing construction materials like cement and timber for her house.

loans.name: Richmond

texts.en: Richmond is studying logistics and supply chain management at the Pentecost University College. He is soliciting for this loan to help pay for his tuition fees. He is inspired by his work because it involves problem-solving and finding solutions to issues, which he enjoys. The interest in his profession stems from the fact that it gives him the opportunity to solve issues concerning international trade and other related challenges. He hopes to manage his own logistics firm after the completion of his studies. The loan from Kingsbridge has given him the opportunity to pay his tuition fees on time without any hassle from the school authorities, and he is grateful. He says, “I live in a community surrounded by smart children who need the help of investors like you to give them the necessary support to obtain their academic goals.”

loans.use: To pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Dúo San Cristóbal Group

texts.es:
Dúo San Cristóbal
María  tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, los cuales uno es menor de edad. Sus 3 hijos estudian, los mayores van a la universidad y la pequeña estudia en la escuela de primaria. María se dedica a la confección de prendas y ropa de cama, cortinas y otras costuras para el hogar. María en esta ocasión esta solicitando un nuevo crédito para la compra de telas para la confección de ropa de usos domesticos, Agradece a la fundación y a kiva el trato especial que se le ha brindado. ella sigue adelante con su negocio pues es a lo que ella se dedica desde hace 19 años y lo cual le ha ayudado mucho para salir adelante. María espera lograr su sueño de tener un local propio para su negocio y expandirlo a mas lugares .
texts.en:
Dúo San Cristóbal

Maria is 47 years old, married, and has three children, only one of which is still a minor. Her three children go to school; the oldest two go to university and the yougest goes to primary school. Maria makes a living by sewing clothing and bed sheets, curtains and other items for the home. Maria is asking for a new loan in order to purchase more fabric to make household items. She is thankful to the foundation and to Kiva for the special treatment they have shown her. She wil continue ahead in her business, because it is all she has known for 19 years and it is a profession that has helped her to get ahead in life. Maria hopes to achieve her dream of having her own storefront and to expand to new locations.

loans.use: purchase fabric and bed sheets.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He is a farmer growing bananas and sweet potatoes, plus rearing pigs. He is been in this business since 1998, having started this activity with a hope of increasing his income for his family.

He faces challenges of weather changes, especially heavy rains that destroy his crops, and inadequate capital, which hinders the progress of his business.

In the future, he intends to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. Hebert has asked for another loan to help him pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Eslin Noe

texts.es:
Eslin, de 28 años de edad, está casado, tiene un hijo y vive con su esposa en una localidad del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Barbara. anteriormente Eslin se dedicaba a laborar como asalariado en una empresa privada y en vista que se quedo sin su empleo, decidieron junto con su esposa poner un negocio propio, que actualmente se establece en su hogar desde ya más de 1 año, este es una pulpería que ofrece productos de a canasta básica así también como refrescos, carnes, lácteos, pan, jugos, dulces, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza, azúcar, arroz, harina, huevos y otros abarrotes, que hasta el momento les ha ido bien.
El solicita un prestamo de 15,000.00 Lempiras para poder surtir su negocio de productos varios y tener una mayor variedad que le reporte un aumento en sus clientes e ingresos. Comprará granos básicos, carnes, refrescos, productos de aseo y lácteos. Su meta es buscar la estabilidad económica y proveer las condiciones necesarias para su familia.
texts.en:
Eslin is 28 years old, married, and has one child. He lives with his wife in a neighborhood of Quimistan, Santa Barbara. Eslin used to work as a salaried worker at a private company, but after he found himself unemployed, he decided to open his own store with his wife. Their business is currently located inside their home and they have ran it successfully for a full year. Their business is a grocery store that sells basic necessities as well as sodas, meats, dairy products, bread, juices, sweets, canned goods, cleaning supplies, sugar, rice, flour, eggs and more. Everything is going well for them.
Eslin is applying for a loan in order to stock his store with various items in order to have a larger selection and to attract more business. He will purchase basic grains, meats, sodas, dairy products and cleaning supplies. His goal is to have a stable financial situation and to provide good living conditions for his family.

loans.use: stock his grocery store with basic gains, meats, sodas, dairy products and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: El-Shadai Group

texts.en:
The El-shadai group is made up of four members; three are women and one man. Between them, they are responsible for their families by supporting their partners. They are from Accra, Chorkor, which is known for being a productive area for trade and industries. They are selling second hand clothing, soft drinks and cooking ingredients, charcoal, slippers, soft drinks and toiletry.
The group has shown responsibility in their repayments. They are working hard to make progress with their different jobs, with their dreams and goals, and to provide their children with the stability that they need.

Because of his dedication, the representative of this group is Isaac, who has been selling toilet supplies for 6 years. He works eight hours a day. It is work that he really enjoys, since it provides a way of feeding his family.

The loan money will be used to buy more toilet supplies which he will sell to his customers who operate public toilets and the individuals as well.

In the not-too-distant future, he expects to earn more money. This is his sixth loan with ID-Ghana.

loans.use: to buy more toilet supplies which he will sell to her customers who operates public toilets and the individuals as well.

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Alhaji has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Alhaji can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Alhaji is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is maize farmer from Maájah village. As a member of Babban Gona, Hamza is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 


Before joining Babban Gona, Hamza would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 


With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hamza can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Hamza is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney, also known as JMV, is a serious entrepreneur with a big smile. JMV runs a social enterprise in Nyamagabe District, the poorest in Rwanda with some of the country's most severe malnutrition. JMV operates a milk collection and distribution center for the people in his community and neighboring refugee camp.

Many families in the district own cows, and these cows often produce more than that family consumes. So JMV buys the excess milk from the families and sells it to people who don't have cows, people in the neighboring refugee camp, and local restaurants. He also runs a program for vulnerable children in the village to come to the collection center in the afternoon for a free cup of milk.

AEC has been working with JMV for nearly two years. We started supporting him by giving him a loan for a tricycle to distribute milk nearby the center. Now, JMV has outgrown the tricycle and is looking for financing to purchase a truck.

With this truck, JMV will be able to collect and distribute 3 times the amount of milk as he does today. This truck would also allow him to go into more remote places in the district.

JMV is one of the most responsible entrepreneurs we've ever worked with. He keeps meticulous records and every week he meets with new potential partners, suppliers and buyers. He hasn't been able to capitalize on as many as he would like, but with this truck he will be able to do so.

Thank you so much for your consideration and support for JMV!

loans.use: To buy a truck to increase capacity at the milk collection center.

loans.name: Marjo

texts.en:
Marjo is 40 years old and lives together with his wife and two children. He works as a field worker in a rice research center.

For an extra income, Marjo cultivates rice on a land of 5 hectares. For the cultivation of rice, he uses his father's tractor.

Because the paddy price was very low this season, he couldn't make much profit. That's why Marjo lacks finances for purchasing fertilizers and pesticides. For this reason, he needs SRD 5,000. In the future, he wants to have his own tractor.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Khải's Group - N2T10Tdương

texts.en:
Mrs Khải is 41 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling fruit for 10 years. Khải lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Khải faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to resell.

This is Khải first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Khải hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Aishe

texts.en:
Aishe is a married rural mother of three and for the past ten years she's been doing agricultural work to earn a living, whereas her husband has been working for a private construction company that builds roads and paves asphalts for a monthly pay of $220, as that is the minimum pay in Albania. On that note, on a daily basis, the pay goes only to $8.

In the land that they own, they plant mainly wheat that they use it for the family consumption and also they plant medicinal plants such as Malva Sylvestris. Aishe is seen in the photograph at the so-called 'drying bed' where she puts the plants to dry. The annual net earnings from the sales of the plant are roughly $1600.
They live in a countryside and the loan that Aishe is requesting will be used to place an order for planting seeds.

loans.use: to place an order for plant seeds and also perform some other agricultural work.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 28, single, and is financially responsible for his parents. He has a small fattening project and is requesting 8000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to make cheese and butter and allow his mother and siblings to sell them in the local market and generate more income to his family and afford his marriage expenses

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle, for milk, butter and cheese making

loans.name: Rukhsana Bibi Group

texts.en:
Rukshana is the age of 46 and a mother of six children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family’s expenses.

Now Rukshana’s husband wants to buy a new auto rickshaw for proper transportation services but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to buy it. Therefore Nadia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan,Rukhsana’s husband can purchase the auto rickshaw and provides the proper transportation services to earn an income.
She and her family will be thankful to the KIVA, lender s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Sustainable Development -N3Pnngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Chính is 55 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has had a manufacturing business, making bread for 3 years. Chính lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Chính faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make bread for sale.

In 2012, Chính joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Chính has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the Sustainable Development -N3PNNgạn, which consists of 7 members.
With her business profit, Chính hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make bread for sale.

loans.name: Hadiye

texts.en:
Hadiye is 50 years old, married and has two children. After her husband's retirement they bought a small garden and started apiculturing with an advice from their friends. They started this with very limited sources. With her third loan from Maya, Hadiye bought sugar, honeycombs and beehives. She pays for her loan with the money she gets from her honey sales to her neighbourhood. In the future she wants to make her own apiculture farm.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
50 yaşında olan Hadiye Hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi. Eşi emekli olduktan sonra küçük bir bahçe satın almışlar ve arkadaşlarının tavsiyesiyle arıcılık işine girmişler. Kısıtlı imkânlarla bu işe başlamışlar Maya’dan 3. kredisini kullanan Hadiye Hanım bu krediler ile arılarına şeker, petek ve arı kovanı aldı. Çevresine bal satışı yaparak kredisini ödüyor. Gelecekte arı çiftliği kurmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy sugar, honeycombs and beehives.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is thirty five year old single male living in Masindi-Uganda.He is responsible for looking after five children.He bought a motorcycle for transport business so that he can get income to cater for the family. He started tree planting to gain more income. He is challenged by poor roads that hinder his movements in transportation. He needs a loan to buy motorcycle tyres.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle tyres.

loans.name: Hilda Maris

texts.es:
En el añ0 2004, Hilda se trazó un objetivo cuando inicio su vida como independiente, el cual era, ser la tendera más exitosa del barrio, un reto grande ya que tenía como competencia, tiendas con años de tradición, pero a ella no le importo, sigue su objetivo incasablemente, en su camino ha recogido buenos frutos, pues ha mejorado la calidad de vida de su familia, una excelente educación y vida a sus hijos, no lo tienen todo, pero no les falta nada, tiene amor y no pasan necesidades, pero estos logros no quitan de su cabeza su objetivo mayor.
Persiguiendo su meta, la señora Hilda quiere solicitar un préstamo, para realizar una gran apuesta por el crecimiento, el dinero será destinado en productos de la canasta familiar, rancho y licor.
texts.en:
When Hilda started working independently in 2004, she set a goal for herself: to become the most successful shopkeeper in her neighborhood, a very big challenge as her competitors were longtime established shops. However, that did not bother her, and she incessantly pursued and pursues her goal. Along the way, she has enjoyed the fruits of her labor, improving her family's standard of living and providing her children with an excellent education and standard of living. They do not have everything, yet they have everything they need: they love each other and they have no urgent necessities; notwithstanding these achievements, her main goal never gets off her mind.

Pursuing her goal, Hilda wants to ask for a loan, thus betting on the growth of her activity. The loan will be used to buy basic necessities, groceries and spirits.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities, groceries and spirits.

loans.name: Mikaila

texts.en:
Mikaila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Mikaila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Mikaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Mikaila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Mikaila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 


Mikaila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ykhyval

texts.en:
Ykhyval is 18 years old freshman in the Sociology Program at AUCA. Love of studying, achieving her dreams and facing new experience are not something new for her. She strongly believes that she will be able to achieve her future goals and dreams through higher education. Studying in an international university was her dream from school days. Unfortunately, financial problems keep her from moving forward and served as a wall in front of her.

Ykhyval comes from a financially unstable family. Her family is a big one: her parents, her brother with his own family (his wife and two daughters) and herself. Her father is retired and gets a monthly pension from the state. Unfortunately, his pension isn’t enough even for his own expenses. Her mother is an accountant. Three years ago she had health problems, what didn’t allow her to work, but understanding their financial difficulties, she is working and earns some money, what is a great help for the family.
Her family is not able to provide her university expenses, so she needs an assistance of Kiva lenders. She hopes for the lenders consideration of her profile.

loans.use: to pay for her Bachelor Degree in Sociology

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 61 years old with 6 children and a hard working entrepreneur.

Elizabeth together with her husband they operate their vulcanizing shop and tire shop.

She used to work as the caretaker of the shop and her husband its worker but due to their diligence and perseverance, the owner decided to sell it to them through installment until they fully paid the shop. Their vulcanizing and tire shop has been their bread and butter, it helps a lot with their everyday expenses and the education of her children.

Today, Elizabeth has able to employ 2 helpers in their community to help her husband with selling tires and repair for cargo truck which is abundant in their community because of the location of shipping companies. Elizabeth and her husband operates the shop to be able to help with their own expenses and support the school expenses of her youngest child in college.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 120,000 to buy a pick up truck to be used in delivering tires for her customers.

The loan will enable her to increase her income by delivering her products to her customers with the help of the new pick up truck.

Elizabeth is hoping to expand her business to help more with her family and also to help her community.

loans.use: to buy a pick up truck to be used for delivering tires to her customers.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Brenda is 48 years old and has one child in school.

Brenda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Brenda requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies .

Brenda has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Brenda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a forty two year old married male, he lives in Masindi-Uganda.He is charged with a responsibility for taking care of seven children. He deals in cattle trading and transport hire so as get income to cater for his family. He dreams of enlarging his farm so as to widen his income. Due to variation of seasons in his business less income is generated and this hinders his returns. He intends to use the loan facility to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Laith

texts.en:
Laith is a 19 year old man. He is single man lives with his parents in ‎Ramtha.
‎
His father is working as driver and his mother does not work. ‎Nevertheless, with the support of his family, he was able to continue ‎his college education majoring in Islamic Religion. However, he is ‎currently requesting a loan to pay some costs that he has not been ‎able to cover. Laith request a loan to pay tuition fees. ‎

loans.use: to pay tuition fees in Islamic studies

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is 62 years old woman, from Kutaisi city. She has a son, who is temporarily unemployed and also a husband, whose pension is the only source of income. As the existing income is not enough for three-member family and Lili can’t find the job, she decided to start her own business. All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.

After several unsuccessful attempts, Lili applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.

With the received amount Lili will purchase a special refrigerator and stock of products for general store and also fruits and vegetables and will start trading business. She will start working as a sales lady and make the significant source of income for her poor family.
This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to open a general store and also trade with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sumamei 2 Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Sumomei 2 and are beginning their fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is made up of eight members and represented by Elizabeth. The members of the group run a variety of businesses, including cutlery sales, cooking rice and stew, maize, bean and plantain, local food joint, smoked fish and grocery. The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro businesses like Elizabeth's.

She states that she joined ID-Ghana five years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, her business is the sale of cutlery. She explains that she learned this business previously because it was a family business. She is 27 years old and single with one school-going child. The loan that she will take now is to increase her capital for the purchase of cutlery and sell to customers. She will acquire the items from the market to sell them at another market. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her child. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the institution's health-related offerings. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the total loan amount of GHS 10,300.

loans.use: to purchase cutlery for sale and sell to customers.

loans.name: Yau

texts.en:
Yau is a maize farmer from Gidan Dogaji village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yau would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. He will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yau no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, he hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 44 years old woman. She is doing business of tailoring for many years. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase new sewing machine along with more reels of thread and packs of buttons for meeting the orders on time.

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Kousar hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine along with more reels of thread and packs of buttons for meeting orders on time.

loans.name: Gugulami Group

texts.en:
Tsitsi attended a hairdressing school in 2004 at the age of 30 and attained a Hairdressing and Beauty Therapy Certificate. She then constructed a cabin structure with a lot of help from her husband in Kuwadzana Extension, a high density suburb where they live. She set up the cabin as a salon from where she did women’s hair and makeup, which she did for about eight years until the market become more competitive and the business became very slow. In December 2013 she constructed a fowl run and changed the salon cabin into a brooder.

Tsitsi would brood the day-old chicks in the brooder for the first two weeks and then move them to the fowl run. She started with a batch of 50 birds even though her fowl run had the capacity to carry 200 birds because she lacked enough capital and experience. In the early stages of her business, she faced challenges that included high mortality rate due to inexperience and failure to get customers for her chickens.

Tsitsi attended a poultry seminar arranged by Irvine’s, a poultry breeder. At this seminar, she learned how to take care of chickens as they grow, the right amounts of feed and water, and what medication to give to the chickens as well as when to call for a vet if the batch got diseased. She also got some marketing tips from the Irvine’s trainers as well as from the other attendees present. She applied these marketing skills she learned at the seminar and she got a good response from customers. In August 2014 she managed to increase her batch size to 100 birds at a time, by year end she was doing a three-week cycle and still produced the same good quality birds.

Tsitsi has received financial literacy training from Thrive Microfinance and believes that the knowledge she received will help her boost her business. Being a mother of two, from the profits of her business, she has managed to assist her husband in providing a formal education for their children. Gugulami is a four-member group and Tsitsi is one of the hardworking women in this group. They are requesting a loan for $1250. Tsitsi wants to use her portion to finance her poultry business to meet demand for chickens in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to further extend her fowl run and buy more chicks.

loans.name: Magai

texts.en:
Magai,who is in his mid 40's is married with four kids, three girls and one boy, all of whom are in school. He has been selling a small dried fish called dagga for twelve years now. He works from 07am to 06:30pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Magai's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on the dagga stock and has paid back his all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan. He used the profit to pay school fees for his kids, to reinvest in business, to repay the loan and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase on the small dried fish. He dreams of expanding his business and sell his fish out of the country.

Maiga will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on his stock of small dried fish.

loans.name: Benny

texts.en:
Fifty-five-year-old Benny from Polomolok, South Cotabato drives this nice tricycle for income. He owns another unit which is being rented by his friend. Benny takes care of his tricycle units very well. He does the regular cleaning and maintenance. However, he cannot avoid the wear and tear of the tires (interior and exterior) because of the rough roads in their community. This is the reason why he seeks your kind support in the amount of PHP 15,000. He will buy new tires to replace the worn out ones, and some spare parts that are usually needed for maintenance. Part of the loan will be spent for the renewal of his driver’s license so he can continue driving without hassle. His income sustains his family’s everyday needs and the college expenses of his youngest child. His wife, Eliza, maintains the household and takes care of the family. Benny prays that his family will stay happy and united, and his children will have a brighter future.

Benny meets with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God. *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy new tires and spare parts; and to pay for the renewal of his driver's license

loans.name: Lianna

texts.en:
Lianna is 36 years old and with her parents she lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. She is not married and works as a music teacher. Her father is a driver and her mother is housewife.

Lianna lately managed to do some repairs to their flat with great hope of providing comfort for her parents. The flat has not been repaired for many years and the work here was so much that during the summer months she started and still there are some works to do. Lianna mentioned that she used all her saving that she had with the help of her father, but now a lack of money made her stop and she is upset with this fact.

Now she greatly hopes that this loan of 500.00 Armenian drams will great help her as she wants to spend it on her flat repairs, finally making it clean and nice.

loans.use: to spend it on her flat repairing works finally making it clean and nice

loans.name: Munaza

texts.en: Munaza  is 31 years old, married woman and a mother of a child. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. Munaza  aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she at present owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life

loans.name: Alh. Sani

texts.en:
Alh. Sani is a maize farmer from Yauran Gari village. As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Sani is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Sani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

Alh. Sani will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. 

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alh. Sani no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Alh. Sani hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a university  education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 43 years old, hardworking woman. She has been providing the service of sewing clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in sewing. Naseem’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

Naseem has requested for a loan amount 60000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of thread and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of thread and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Narcisse is 42 years old and is married with two children who are 1 and 3 years old. He is well-known in the business of buying sorghum and resale, which he has been doing for about two years. Narcisse is the president of this group TUZAMURANE, he is the first person on the first line, on the left side with a white t-shirt. Total group members are 15 but in the picture we have 12, other 3 members were not around because they had different issues. His hours of selling sorghum are from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day except on Sunday sometimes .

Narcisse wants to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of sorghum for sale. With the profit from this loan, he will purchase enough food for the family, to buy new clothing for his children and to buy medical insurance for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul is a forty two year old married man living with four children. He earns a salary from teaching that maintains his standards of living for his family. When he realized that salary alone cannot sustain his family needs, he decided to build rentals so as to boost his income. He desires to build a good house for his children and educate them  to university level. However delayed salary payments affect him and tenants take time to pay their rent. He needs a loan to pay school fees for his children now that his sources of income can't bill him out at the moment.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a 28 year old single man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He owns a business of selling foods like posho, rice, beans and cassava flour. He started this business with a hope of increasing his income and sustain himself. He has a goal of extending his business in town and expanding it into wholesale, however, he is limited by increasing prices of maize and other cereals during the rainy seasons. Timothy needs a loan to  buy stock of beans, peas, posho and rice for selling.

loans.use: to buy stock of beans, peas, posho and rice for sell.

loans.name: Sagesse Group

texts.fr:
Mr MOROU  est  le responsable du groupe SAGESSE. Il est marié et père de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé a 16 ans et le moins âgé a 01 an. 05 enfants vont à l’école  et il a 11 personnes en charges.
Mr fait du jardinage depuis plus de 15 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 03 sacs d’engrais, 01 boîte de graine de choux et 03 boîtes d’herbicides.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Il ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mr. MOROU is the head of the SAGESSE group. He is married with 8 children ages 1 to 16 years old, five of whom go to school. He supports 11 people.

Mr. Morou has been a gardener for over 15 years. He buys his supplies in surrounding villages. He plans to use this loan to buy 3 sacks of fertilizers, 1 box of cabbage seed and 3 boxes of herbicide.

He will use his profits to expand his activity. His goal is to buy some land.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizers, one box of cabbage seed and three boxes of herbicide.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 57, married and has 6 children. He has a small fattening project and is requesting 5000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to generate more income for his family and afford his children's marriage expenses.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Zieda

texts.ru: Зиёда, 43 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Зиёды среднее образование, она 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. У Зиёды в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. На 0,32 Га она выращивает картофель и кукурузу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Зиёды около 7,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма и реализации. Зиёда является участником группы "Маданият", всего в группе состоят 3 человек. Доходы от кредита Зиёда планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Zieda is 43 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Zieda has a secondary education. She has been farming for ten years. Zieda's farm has two cows. She grows potatoes and corn for sale on 0.32 hectares. Zieda's monthly income is about 7,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some cows for fattening and resale.

Zieda is a member of the "Madaniyat" group which comprises three people. Zieda plans to use the proceeds of the loan to develop her farm and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy some cows in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a client in Ugafode microfinance and applying for a loan of 1500,000/=. She is a married woman with children.
She is a business woman engaged in selling of charcoal and also does agriculture on a small scale. In a bid to increase on her working capital /expand on the business, she has applied for a loan of 1500,000/= to buy improved seedlings and pesticides to increase her banana production and therefore sales and profit.

Robinah is hard working and appreciates the financial boost and support towards growing her business.
She is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.

loans.use: to buy farm in puts.

loans.name: Dinanath

texts.en:
Dinanath is 52 years old and has a family with two school aged children. Dinanath does rice cultivation on a land of 4 hectares. He also works as a field worker for others colleagues for an extra income.

With the support from Seva MFI he has expanded his rice areas and repaid his loans fully. He asks Seva MFI a new loan of SRD 5.000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia was able to maintain her business through the financial support extended to her by Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She’s grateful that there are people like you who are willing to share God’s blessings without expecting anything in return. Because of the loan, she was able to purchase grocery items for her variety store business. Once more, a sincerest appreciation she wants to send.

Lucia just started with a very small capital back then, and now she’s able to support her family and even pay for household expenses through all her hard work in the business. She aims that her business will have visible progress in the next few years, that’s why she wants to maintain funds and be able to buy stocks of grocery items. She will need to borrow again another Php25,000 and hopes that lenders would consider her loan application once more.

Lucia is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mirjeta

texts.en:
Mirjeta, a married mother of two grownups has been doing agriculture for the past 15 years. In the land that her family owns, they plant mostly garlic, wheat, beans, corn, fodder for the animals and medicinal plant of sage.

"Our pensions are as little as $170/month total for both me and my husband. This money is not even enough to cover for our medication let alone for other things. Many elders don't have the money to cover for their medical needs and they die, some suddenly and some others knowing that they're dying due to the lack of medication. I don't want to end up like them. I have to shift my focus somehow to raising pigs and then sell them. Sometime our plantations are damaged from the flooding or the snow and we get no compensation from the government for the natural disasters cause. In the land now we will plant mostly feed for the pigs and also continue with the sage growing," said Mirjeta during the interview with the loan officer.

loans.use: to buy 20 piglets and build a stable for them

loans.name: Ömür

texts.en:
Ömür is 47 years old and a mother of two. After her husband's death she started making and selling mantı, pasta and tarhanain order to supply her children's school needs. First she was selling to her neighbours but then she started selling on stands. This is her third loan from Maya. With the help of her loans from Maya she bought flour, meat and tarhana in bulk, thus increasing her profit.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Ömür hanım 47 yaşında ve iki çocuk annesi. Eşinin ölümünden sonra çocuklarının okul ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için mantı, makarna, tarhana yaparak bu ürünlerini satmaya başlamış. Önce çevresine daha sonra stantlarda satış yapmış. Ömür hanım mayadan 3. kredisini kullanıyor. Mayadan aldığı krediler ile toptan un, kıyma ve tarhana malzemesi aldı. Böylece kar oranını artırdı.

loans.use: to buy flour, meat and tarhana materials

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Forty one-year-old Asteria does not boast of any academic papers from a higher learning institution but she is an accomplished farmer from the Nkubu area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She has 4 children, whom she really loves and cherishes. Asteria and her husband work as a team, supporting each other, and have practiced mixed farming for the past twenty years. Asteria often says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” From her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day, and this helps her support her family.

Asteria also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs; that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques; and therefore, using high-quality seeds will assure him of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. Asteria believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid education background. This loan will be her way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as high quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Tahzeem

texts.en:
Tahzeem is a married woman and has been running her beauty parlor for the past two years. She does her job passionately. She knows the techniques of makeup and hair design. She is a well-known beautician in her town.

Tahzeem is a responsible mother of four children and is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of her family. Now she has requested a loan to buy more beauty products including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently.

loans.use: to purchase needed items for her beauty parlor business

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 31-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day, regularly. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Wael took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, but that can be dangerous, expensive, and inefficient. This will help Wael to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Edith Marlene

texts.es: Edith de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas (chile dulce y tomates) desde hace 10 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su casa y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es que logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos agricolas como abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, entre otros, para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Edith is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children.  She has made a living growing crops (sweet pepper and tomatoes) for 10 years.  She sells her produce in different markets that are close to her home and she is able to use the profits to move forwards.  

She is asking for a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as manure, fertilizer, herbicides, and other products, so that she can continue with her work and therefore gain a better income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as manure, fertilizer, herbicides, and other products.

loans.name: Hard Working - N1Pbành Group

texts.en:
Mrs Đào is 46 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has had a retail business selling coal for 5 years. Đào lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Đào faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase coal to resell.

This is Đào first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the "Hard Working - N1PBành" group, which consists of 7 members.
With her business profit, Đào hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more coal to resell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is maize farmer from Kerau village. As a member of Babban Gona, Ibrahim is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Ibrahim is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to buy a maize grinding machine.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hajara is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Hajara would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hajara will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when her can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Hajara now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members, and would like to use this additional income to diversify her farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is maize farmer from Gwani village. As a member of Babban Gona, Amos is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Amos would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Amos can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Amos is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a 38 year old hardworking man with 6 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a business of brewing waragi a local drink in his village plus teaching in local government. He has been in this business since 2013, which he started with a hope of increasing more income for his family.

Tom faces challenges of unpredictable weather changes and limited capital, that hinders expansion of his business.
