However, he is working very hard to make sure his production is big and all his children are educated up to the required levels of learning. Tom has asked for a loan to rent a Kisubi (Banana) plantation.

loans.use: to rent a Kisubi (Banana) plantation .

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a maize farmer from Maájah village. As a Babban Gona member, Ismail is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

 Before joining Babban Gona, Ismail would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Ismail will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. 

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ismail no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Ismail hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Victoriya

texts.en:
Victoriya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Victoriya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Victoriya would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Victoriya can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Victoriya will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. She is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the lives of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abischak

texts.en: Abischak is 35 years old, has a family with two daughters. He works for the government and lives in his parent’s house. Abischak is also a rice grower; he inherited a 2nd hand tractor from his father. Abischak has been qualified in 2012 for a microloan to expand his rice cultivation on rental plots. This loan he has repaid fully and now he asks for a new loan of SRD 5.500 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. His goal is to save for his own house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Luis, el socio pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
El socio continua  dedicándose a su negocio de restaurante, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio continua elaborando diferentes tipos de platos para sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 El socio  Luis está muy agradecido con KIVA y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio Luis solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, papas, carnes entre otros.
texts.en:
Luis is a member of the communal bank "El Templo de Inca" (The Incan Temple) in the city of Cusco, Perú.  He continues to make a living through his restaurant business and has been in the business for a long time.  Thanks to his daily determination, the business is going well.  He continues to prepare different kinds of meals for his customers.  He wants to be able to continue working to support his family.  

Luis is very grateful to KIVA and he is committed to making the established payments.  Luis is requesting a loan to buy rice, potatoes, and meat, among other supplies.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes, and meat, among other supplies.

loans.name: Ernestina De Jesus

texts.es: Ernestina de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado y caracol desde hace mas de 10 años vende de manera ambulante por los diferetes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y es gracias a ese trabajo como ha podido salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas prodcutos por mayor y asi seguir con sus ventas que le genera buenos ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Ernestina is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her husband.  She has made a living selling fish and snails for 10 years.  She does her selling on foot, traveling to different markets that are near her home, and this work has allowed her to get ahead.   

She is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale products and therefore continue with her sales that generate a good income for her.

loans.use: to buy fish and snails wholesale

loans.name: Adeleida

texts.en:
Adeleida is 29 years old, married, and she is a businesswomen. She is applying for a loan of $1000 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop for the business and she also sells from village-to-village. Adeleida has been involved in business activities since a few years ago. She started with her own working capital.

She is earning a good income from her business, because many people like to buy from it. She is still happy to do her business. Adelaide one of the women who has a very high interest in doing business, so she is taking this to buy more items like watches, blankets, mattress fabric, perfume and other things.

loans.use: to buy watches, blankets, mattress fabrics, perfume and other things.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mary has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mary would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Mary can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Mary will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Mary is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is maize farmer from Karsawa village. As a member of Babban Gona, Mohammed is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mohammed would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.


With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mohammed can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Mohammed is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona farmer. Ibrahim is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan, Ibrahim can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.


Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Ibrahim has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/hectare. Ibrahim is thankful that he no longer has to worry about not having money to improve his farming skills and looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anabeth

texts.en:
Anabeth is an 18-year-old high school graduate who lives in Silay City. She belongs to a family of six. Her father is a carpenter and her mother is working as a housekeeper in Bacolod City. Anabeth has three siblings. Her older brother works as a promodiser in Manila, while her two younger siblings are still studying in elementary school. The family's total monthly income is PHP 18,800 ($407).

Anabeth wants to help her family, but didn't have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed Bagosphere's selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Once Anabeth starts earning, she can help provide for her family's basic needs and then save money for her siblings' education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: Arran Jane

texts.en:
Arran Jane lives in Corrales, Jimenez Mis. Occ. She is a single mother blessed with a beautiful daughter. She is already 29 years old. Being a single mom is not easy; she has to raise her child alone. Because of this, Arran Jane strives hard in order to provide for the needs of her daughter. She engages in different kinds of businesses like buying and selling coconut fruits, coconut shells and “ready-to-wear” dresses.

Now she has a sari- sari store (small store with different dry goods in it). She has earned PHP 8,000 monthly income from this business. This business has done a lot for her. It helps her send her daughter to school and provides them their daily needs. As customers are increasing, she plans to expand her business, but she needs a fund in order to realize this. She went to GDMPC and borrowed an additional capital to buy some goods for her sari-sari store. If God permits, she wishes to have a grocery store in their place.

loans.use: to purchase goods for the store.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is a Babban Gona farmer. Abdu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Abdu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan, Abdu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.


Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Abdu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/hectare. Abdu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about not having money to provide healthcare for his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu will store the maize he harvests and delay the sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/hectare, Yakubu now has the opportunity to realize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Bello

texts.en:
Bello is maize farmer from Kurungofi village. As a member of Babban Gona, Bello is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bello would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bello can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Bello is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jenet

texts.en:
Jenet is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Jenet has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Jenet would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Jenet can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Jenet will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Jenet is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Amina has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Amina would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Amina can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Amina will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Amina is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the lives of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: I Made

texts.en:
I Made lives in Ekasari Sari Village. He is 50 years, married and has three children. His job is a driver; he obtains an average income per day of 70,000 IDR. Besides being a driver, I Made also keeps pigs with income per month of 200,000 IDR.

To increase his pig business, he applied for a loan of 6,000,000 IDR to use to purchase five superior piglets, feed and to renovate the cage. I Made plans to save the profits from his businesses for the future of his children. I Made spends 50,000 IDR for the cost of the kitchen every day. To help the family income, his wife sells bananas and coconuts at the market.

loans.use: to purchase five superior piglets, feed and to renovate the cage.

loans.name: Haydee Teresa

texts.es:
La socia Haydee sigue  con el comercio de artesanías, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo joyería y adornos, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aretes y pulseras.
La socia está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite crecer en su actividad. 
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The member Haydee continues with her handicraft business. She has had the business a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she puts into her work each day. She continues to sell jewellery and decorations. She wants to continue working in this manner so she can continue to support her family.

The member is requesting the loan to buy earrings and bracelets.

She is very grateful for the support from Kiva in helping her strengthen her economic activity which allows her to grow in her business.

She belongs to the “El Templo del Inca” communal bank in the city of Cusco – Perú.

loans.use: to buy earrings and bracelets.

loans.name: Lorenzo Antonio

texts.es:
Lorenzo, de 28 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador, está acompañado y vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos, su pareja es ama de casa y se encarga del cuidado de los bebes. 

Lorenzo, trabaja como corralero, se encarga del cuidado de peces y terrenos de su patrón; tiene más de 12 años realizando esta actividad, en la cual se ha vuelto un experto porque sabe mucho sobre ese trabajo.

Lorenzo, se ha ganado el respeto y la confianza de su patrón, ya que le permite utilizar las peceras para criar pescado y cuando ya este listo que lo pueda vender y que le queden las ganancias para él como un salario extra; él esta muy agradecido con su patrón por ayudarlo de esa manera. 

Lorenzo, necesita el préstamo para comprar alevines de tilapias para la crianza, porque considera qu es una buena forma de generar ingresos y le ha gustado realizar esta actividad, es por eso que ha decidido comenzar su propio negocio de venta de peces. 

Los sueños de Lorenzo, son tener una mejor condición de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 28 years old, is a very hard-working young man.  He is in a relationship and he lives with his partner and their two children.  His partner is a housekeeper and takes care of the babies.  

Lorenzo works as a groundskeeper, taking care his boss's land and fish.  He has been doing this job for more than 12 years, during which time he has become an expert because he knows a lot about this kind of work.  

Lorenzo has gained the respect and trust of his boss, since he allows him to use the fish pools to raise fish, and when it's ready he can sell it and keep the profits as an extra salary.  He is very grateful to his boss for helping him out in that way.  

Lorenzo needs a loan to buy tilapia fish fry to raise, because he thinks that this is a good form of generating income and he has enjoyed working in this business.  Therefore, he has decided to start his own business selling fish.  

Lorenzo's dreams are to have better living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy tilapia fish fry to raise.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a 39 year old married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has been a retailer since 2014, serving his daily customers who describe hims as a hard working man, and he had a vision of getting an income for his family. He has future prospects of constructing a good residential house for his family, however, hardships of inadequate capital and customers who delay to pay him are a major hindrance to his goal. Deo needs a loan to buy cooking oil, sugar, match boxes and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, match boxes and salt to sell.

loans.name: Habibu

texts.en:
Habibu is a Babban Gona farmer.  Habibu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Habibu would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan Habibu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Habibu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Habibu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida  is 52 years old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is a mother of 5 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 50000 PKR  to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently.

loans.name: Zabida

texts.en: Zabida is a maize farmer from Gidan Dogaji village. As a Babban Gona member, Zabida is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Zabida would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs. Zabida will use this loan to store the maize she harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Zabida no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Zabida hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is maize farmer from Karofi Magada village. As a member of Babban Gona, Lawal is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Lawal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Lawal can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Lawal is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is a 47-year-old college undergraduate who lives in Bacolod City. He is married to Rosemarie, a housewife. They have an eight-year old child.

Ricky was working as a part time bartender in Palmas del Mar resort. Their total monthly family income of PHP 5,700 ($124 USD) was not enough to provide even for their family's basic needs. Thus, when Ricky qualified for the two-month training program of BagoSphere, he found hope that there's actually a chance to uplift his family's life in a few months.

Ricky wants to provide education for his child and the basic needs of his family. Your loan assistance might just help Ricky to have a successful career in a BPO (Business Process Outsourcing) industry.

loans.use: to pay the tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: Abesamihigo Group

texts.en:
Innocent is 56 years old and married, with three children. He is the president of the group ABESAMIHIGO and he is the first person on the left side with a hat. This is the 3rd cycle in this group to request a loan in Vision Finance Company and the previous on were paid on time. Innocent sells various food, such as sweet potatoes, beans and bananas. He has four years of experience in this work.

He works from 8 a.m until 6 p.m every day. Innocent has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various food, such as sweet potatoes, beans and bananas for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and to get his own boutique.

loans.use: to buy various food, such as sweet potatoes, beans and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Mahpurat

texts.ru: Махпурат успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. У нее в хозяйстве есть корова, лошадь, 20 овец. На 0,56 Га собственной и 1,35 Га арендованной земли она выращивает арбузы, картофель, кукурузу, морковь, перец и клевер. На сегодняшний день деятельность Махпурат приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Махпурат планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и строительство жилого дома.
texts.en: Mahpurat successfully repaid her loan, having used it for its intended purpose. She is grateful to the Kiva fund and to everyone who helped to finance her. She has a cow, a horse, and 20 sheep. She grows watermelon, potatoes, corn, carrots, peppers and clover on 0.56 hectares of her own land and 1.35 hectares of rented land. Today Mahpurat's business brings her a monthly profit of 20,000 som (KGS). To develop her business further she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) which she will use to buy some cattle. Mahpurat plans to use the proceeds of the loan to develop her farm and build a house.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle to increase her herd.

loans.name: Irodahon

texts.ru: Иродахон, 39 лет, замужем. У Иродахон среднее образование, она занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. На 0,08 Га Иродахон выращивает кукурузу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Иродахон около 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Иродахон является одним из 3 участников группы "Маданият". Доходы от кредита Иродахон планирует использовать для развития своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Irodahon is 39 years old and married. Irodahon has a secondary education. She is a farmer. She has two cows. Irodahon grows corn for sale on 0.08 hectares of land. Irodahon's monthly income is about 12,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her farm further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock.

Irodahon is one of the three members of the "Madaniyat" group. Irodahon plans to use the proceeds of the loan to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Ilknur

texts.en:
İknur is a young entrepreneur, 29 years old. She took over a glassware store from a friend and is now running it. She deals with everything in her store. With the help of her loan from Maya she bought products in bulk.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
İknur Hanım 29 yaşında ve genç bir girişimci. Arkadaşından devir aldığı züccacciye dükkanını işleterek kendi geçimini sağlıyor. Dükkanın bütün işleri ile kendi ilgilenen İlknur Hanım Maya dan aldığı kredi ile toptan ürün aldı.

loans.use: to buy kitchen products for sale in her store

loans.name: Mileidy Esperanza

texts.es: Mileidy, es una madre soltera de 22 años de edad, que vive junto a su hija en el municipio de San Luis, Santa Barbara.  Hace 1 año se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta básica como ser arroz, frijoles, maíz, refrescos, harina, lácteos y también ropa que siempre ha vendido. Esta actividad le ayuda al sustento de su hogar.  Ella solicita la cantidad de 10,000.00 Lempiras para comprar carnes, refrescos, lácteos y embutidos para brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejorar ingresos, de esta manera ella podrá crecer como comerciante y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y bienestar económico.
texts.en:
Mileidy is a 22-year-old single mother who lives with her daughter in the town of San Luis, Santa Barbara.  She has made a living selling basic groceries such as rice, corn, soft drinks, flour, dairy products, and clothing for a year.  Her goods have always sold.  This business helps her support her household.  

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy meat, soft drinks, dairy products, and sausages in order to provide a better service to her customers and bring in more income.  She will be able to grow as a salesperson and provide better living conditions and economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, soft drinks, dairy products, and sausages to expand her business.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Lawal has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Lawal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Lawal can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Lawal will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina has been involved in business activities for a few years. She started with her own working capital. She has come to the age of 31 and her husband is also a businessman.

Silvina is applying for a loan of USD 1,000 to improve her business. She has a kiosk in the center of the market and she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin.

She will use the loan to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, including water, noodles, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, detergent, sardines, biscuits, milk, salt, slippers, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other things to sell.

Silvina is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin because, with it, she can improve her management of her business.

loans.use: to buy water, noodles, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, detergent, sardines, biscuits, milk, salt, slippers, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Maendeleo Riz Group

texts.fr: Le souci de renforcer son capital fait à ce que Kiza sollicite un deuxième crédit pour les travaux de repiquage, sarclage, achat engrais et produits phytosanitaires et paiement de la main d'œuvre à la récolte. Grâce à son premier crédit, il a pu agrandir sa superficie et la réalisation de quelques projets familiaux tels que le paiement de frais scolaires des enfants, l'alimentation, les soins médicaux, l'amélioration de sa maison et la constitution d'une petite épargne. Kiza a aussi contribuer à certaines circonstances sociales (deuil et mariage). Les difficultés rencontrées sont les oiseaux ravageurs et l'insuffisance des eaux d'irrigation qui ont nécéssité des travaux de curage du canal. Sur les deux cent cinquante investis, il a pu réunir une récolte de trois cent cinquante dollars.
texts.en:
Concerned about bolstering his capital, Kiza is requesting a second loan to cover transplanting, weeding, fertilizer, plant care products, and the labor for harvesting. Thanks to his first loan, he was able to expand his arable land and realize a few family plans, such as paying for the children’s school fees, food, and medical care; improving his house; and building up a small savings account.

Kiza has also helped with certain social situations (bereavement and marriage). The difficulties encountered are ravenous birds and insufficient water for irrigation, thus the need for dredging of the canal. With the [$]250 invested, he was able to gather a $350 harvest.

loans.use: to pay for weeding, fertilizer, and plant care products

loans.name: Hien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hien, 46 years old, is the Kinh ethnic majority woman. She currently lives with her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family’s main income is from her salary of civil servant, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount.

She wants to repair her house and its sanitation work but she does not have money to buy materials for this. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.
She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have spacious house with better living condition.

loans.use: to repair her house and its sanitation work

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Sheila lives in the small village of Seti, Jimenez, she is a 39 years old woman, married with 2 children. The main livelihood of their place is farming. Her husband is a farmer who works overtime in order to support the needs of family. Sheila found a vacant area to plant bananas and vegetables for them to have an additional income. Its already 5 years since then this business becomes their main source of livelihood. They get P3, 000.00 monthly income from the said business and hope to increase their profit.

But to realize this she has to plant more vegetables & bananas. For the moment, she borrowed some amount from GDMPC to pay for the fertilizer and for the labor cost of farm preparation. She hopes for the sustainability of the business and plans to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer & to pay for the labor cost of farm preparation

loans.name: Yory

texts.en:
A local farmer living in the Cheung Prey district of the Kampong Cham province, Yory is 50 years old and a married mother of two children, one of whom is depending on her to support his studies. To make a living, she has been growing rice, cassava and selling grocery items for 32 years. The price of cassava is decreasing so she couldn’t yield outputs as high as before. 

Yory is a new borrower of VisionFund who applied for this loan in order to support her farming business. Anyway, this loan will be used to buy fertilizer and pesticide to increase productivity of her crop yield. She hopes that this first loan will help her to earn more income and be able to keep supporting her son’s studying.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to increase productivity of her crop yield

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a public employee and he is the father of 3 kids. Walter is happily married but his wife is not working right now so he has to take care of the entire family.

Walter needs a loan to complete the paperwork and uniform of the pre-military service of one of his sons. In Bolivia the boys of the graduation class have to do the military service, so that is an expense that Walter is forced to have. He hopes you can help him. In the picture Walter is at his house - his boys were at the school at the time the picture was taken

loans.use: to pay the paperwork and uniform of the pre military service of one of his sons

loans.name: Deolfa

texts.en:
Deolfa is 42 years old and a mother of her 2 children. She helps her husband who does fishing in providing the needs of her family. She owns and manages her banana farm to earn more profit in order to support the educational needs of he children. She has been selling bananas in their local community member. She wants to expand her business and engage to other business activities. Recently, she joined and gain from GDMPC, she avail a new loan to pay for her banana replanting cost so that she will be able to produce plenty of bananas in the market.

Deolfa's plan in the future is to save more money and improved the general living condition of the entire family.

loans.use: to pay for her banana replanting cost

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana has been a fish vendor for more than 10 years. She serves locals and town-dwellers in the place where she lives. She is a 58-year-old married woman with seven grown children. 

Aside from selling fish, she also raises pigs as an additional source of earnings.She resides in the the rural town of Dumanjug, Cebu.

Maria would like to improve both of her businesses. She decided to join CEVI to access loans and to boost her livelihood. She wants to purchase fresh fish and more piglets. With these, she would be able to cope with demand. In that way, she could improve her financial income. She could start to settle her finances and set aside some of the profit for future use.

Ana hopes to continue to expand her livelihood to become productive in the years to come and in preparation for old age.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish and more piglets

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine has been selling goods in her community for many years. She's earning well. In fact, she was able to pay her previous loan used in her business. She wants to expand her business. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more goods to sell and to boost her inventory to have higher sales. She wants to save more money for the educational needs of her children, particularly when they get into college.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

location.town: P1, BITIBOT, SAPANG DALAGA, MISAMIS OCCIDENTAL

loans.name: Hecel

texts.en:
Hecel is a married woman, aged 34. She and her husband are engaged in a fishing business. They have been doing this for ten years. Aside from fishing, Hecel is running a sari-sari store (general store) and has a hog raising business.

They work together to raise their two young children. Her oldest child is six years old while her youngest child is two years old. So, Hecel is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy gasoline to operate their fishing boat. She will also need the amount for additional capital for her sari-sari store and to purchase piglets to raise. 

In the future, Hecel wishes to move her sari-sari store business into the town proper of Iloilo.

loans.use: to buy gasoline to operate their fishing boat, for additional capital for her sari-sari store, and to purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Hajra

texts.en: It was hard for Hajra  to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Hajra  is 30 years old, married woman. She is a mother of 2 children.  Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Hajra  has gained great confidence in the business as she has learnt how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Noeuk

texts.en:
Noeuk is 47 year old, widowed, and has one child. She lives in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum province’s Dambae district. The main source of her family’s income is from growing cassava and rice, which she has been doing for 30 years. Recently, her cassava has grown not well because insects destroyed it.

Noeuk’s requested her first loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizer and pesticide to enhance her crop with nutrients. She hopes to get high yields to earn more income so that she can expand her current business and upgrade her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en:
Magaji is maize farmer from Maájah village. As a member of Babban Gona, Magaji is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

 Before joining Babban Gona, Magaji would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Magaji can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Magaji is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Rutemba Group

texts.fr: C'est depuis les années 1999 que les membres du groupe RUTEMBA ont commencé à cultiver la tomate. Mashariki, président du groupe, reconnaît que cette expérience a été acquise de ses parents et ses bienfaits. Lors de la saison dernière, il a pu capitalisé un montant de deux cents dollars après déduction de charges d'exploitation. Cela lui a permis de scolariser ses enfants malgré divers obstacles comme l'absence de l'eau dans les champs, l'insuffisance de moyens financiers,... Il estime qu'avec une bonne récolte, ils seront capables d'élargir leurs champs, scolariser leurs enfants et améliorer leur habitat. Sur photo, Mashariki tient un carnet rose dans sa main droite.
texts.en: The members of the group RUTEMBA began growing tomatoes in 1999. Mashariki, the group’s president, acknowledges that his experience was acquired from his parents and his blessings. Last season, he was able to capitalize on $200 in funds after operational costs were deducted, thus enabling him to provide schooling for his children despite diverse obstacles, such as the absence of water in the fields, insufficient means, …  He believes that, with a good harvest, the fields could be expanded; the children, educated; and their housing, improved. In the photo, Mashariki is the one holding a pink booklet in his right hand.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, fertilizer, and plant care products

loans.name: Acts Group

texts.en:
Rufaro is a 60-year-old widow and has three children who are still in school. She lives in a high density suburb called Dzivarasekwa in Harare. She used to depend on her brother in law for her family’s livelihood after her husband had died, but he was retrenched from work some two years ago.

She then had to fend for her family so she used the little money she had to build a fowl run so that she could rear broiler chickens and sell them. For a period of six weeks, Rufaro cleans her fowl run daily as she needs to provide a clean environment for her broilers. She provides them with fresh water and feeds daily to keep them healthy. During the six week period of raising the broilers, she is usually half-asleep in her bedroom so that she gets up at the slightest noise to ensure that cats, dogs, and thieves that move around at night in her neighbourhood, do not get to her chickens.

After six weeks when her broilers mature, Rufaro dresses the chickens, freezes them and gets on a bus to her rural home where she supplies the chickens to a boarding school there. Currently, she keeps a batch of 100 birds every 6 weeks and this is not enough to meet the demand from the school so she sometimes surrenders the business to someone else who can supply the right quantity of chickens at the required time.

Rufaro is asking for a loan so that she can stagger her chickens at two week intervals and also to increase the batch size to 200. This will ensure a steady supply of chicken to the school as they need 195 birds every fortnight.
If she is able to do this then Rufaro knows she will not have cash flow problems and will be able to send her children to boarding school as well. She is in a group called ‘Acts’ with three other women who are also running their small business.

loans.use: so that she can stagger her chickens at two week intervals and also to increase the batch size to 200.

loans.name: Dien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dien, born in 1977, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of four members, including her husband and her two sons. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family’s main income is from selling cattle and poultry, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. She wants to expand the breeding by raising pigs to sell but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding, and when selling the coming pig herd, it will bring her family a considerable profit. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to expand the breeding by raising more pigs

loans.name: Famillle Muhamba Group

texts.fr: Le crédit sollicité par la famille MUHAMBA est représenté par Julienne et Josias, mère et père de la famille. Après le constat que la production du manioc est devenue faible, le couple a décidé de se lancer dans la culture du paddy vu sa rentabilité; la possibilité de scolariser les enfants et de couvrir les autres charges familiales. Aujourd'hui encore, ils se plaignent de l'insuffisance de fonds alloués à différents travaux, le manque quelquefois de l'eau d'irrigation et les oiseaux ravageurs. Par ailleurs, Julienne souhaiterait que leur espace cultural soit élargi par rapport à la précédente, assurer la scolarité des enfants et l'amélioration de leur habitat.
texts.en:
The MUHAMBA family’s loan being requested is represented by Julienne & Josias, the mother and father of the family. After noticing the shrinking harvest of cassava, the couple decided launch into ‘paddy’ farming, given its profitability and the chance to provide schooling for the children and to cover other family expenses.

Today, they still complain of insufficient funds to cover the work to be done, of the occasional lack of water for irrigation, and of ravenous birds. However, Julienne would like to expand their arable land even more, ensure their children’s education, and improve their housing.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, fertilizer, and plant care products

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:
Garba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Garba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

 Before joining Babban Gona, Garba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Garba can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Garba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Garba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Duterimbere Migina Group

texts.en:
Chantal is 34 years old and is married with three children. For the past one year, she has owned and operated a business selling various goods like: cooking oil, lotion, soap, rice, sugar etc. Chantal is a leader of DUTERIMBERE MIGINA. In the picture of the group, Chantal is the individual holding a black hand bag, on the first line, is a fifth person from right side. A typical day for Chantal begins at 6 am, when she opens her store front. She remains there until she sells her daily inventory.

If business is not good on a particular day, she will close her storefront at 5 pm. Her business and marketing plan are well organized as she has received business training from VFC.

Chantal has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase additional inventory for her business, including bread, fruits and vegetables. With the profits from this loan, she will be able to get medical insurance for her family, pay school fees for her children, get enough food for her family, to build her own house and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase various goods like: cooking oil, lotion, soap, rice, sugar etc for sale.

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en:
Intisar is building her house a few years ago with her husband, and she plans to complete it before winter. But she doesn’t have enough money to buy more materials such as sands, planks, nails, one door, stone, and two windows to continue the construction on her house.
Intisar is requesting a 700 USD loan from kiva’s partner ALIBDAA. She is very hopeful that she could finish her home.

loans.use: to purchase buy sands, planks, nails, one door, stone, and two windows to continue the construction on her house

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 52-year-old married mother of three children, who has been running her convenience store since 2012, and is working hard to develop it to make sure it will provide her family with a better income.
Samira is well known in her region, supported and encouraged by her neighbors to develop her business and improve her family's living.
Samira is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua,  her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business capital through buying requested merchandise with special offer prices.
She hopes to stay financially stable and maintain having a reliable elderly living.

loans.use: to increase her business capital through buying requested merchandise with special offer prices.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of taro and cassava to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.en:
Rukhshona as a responsible mother of 2 children works hard to earn for living. She lives with her children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Rukhshona is the main feed keeper of her children. She sews a variety of woman dresses for 5 years. She has own workshop and she tries to offer a good standard of service. Rukhshona’s working day usually begins early morning.

She works hard but she is ill now. She must buy medicines for her treatment and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni to buy medicines for her treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her treatment.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 50-year-old woman who dreams of having a stable business in the future, a business that can help her raise her two children. The ages of her children are 18 and 17 years old. 

Gemma is engaged in buying and selling fresh and dried fish. Aside from this, she also sells food to the community of San Dionesio, Iloilo. She has been doing this for 20 years to earn a living. Her husband is also a vendor and work hard to provide for the needs of their family. 

To uplift their livelihood, Gemma is asking a bigger amount of loans to buy fresh and dried fish to sell. She will also buy food ingredients such as flour, sugar and cooking oil. She hopes that in this way they could have better lives.

loans.use: to buy to buy fresh and dried fish; food ingredients such as flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn, 37, is a native of the town of Carmen, Bohol. She earns a living by operating a motorcycle transportation service locally known as "habal-habal" a motorcycle with extended seat that travels from one place to remote areas. She earns from the rent of that vehicle.

She also raises hogs and does farming as well. She toils the land and grows rice.

She is married and has four children. Her husband has an income that can also help defray the family's expenses.

She has limited capital to improve her sources of income. She would like to enhance the quality of the pigs she is about to raise and improve the yield of her farm. She is doing her best to continue to support the needs of her family.

Analyn has requested a loan to buy motorcycle accessories, farm fertilizers and pig feed. Thus, slowly, she could able to improve the yield of her farm, provide smooth and safe travel for the motorcycle transportation service and increase the livestock supply.

She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle accessories, farm  fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Sororero Group

texts.fr:
Claver  fait partie du groupe  Sorero et  habite à Bubanza. Il a 50 ans et est marié à Venatie ,une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 5 à 20 ans,tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de Savons  depuis  7 ans. 

Il est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de l'huile de noix de palme  pour la fabrication des savons, à vendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Claver is part of the group Sorero and lives in Bubanza. He is 50 ans and married to Venatie, a merchant. Together they have five children, from 5 to 20 years old, of whom all are students.

Claver has been doing commerce in soaps for seven years.

He is on his 3rd loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his captial and purchase a large amount of palm nuts oil for making soaps to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of palm nut oil to make soaps to sell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is 51 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Her business is selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in the business for 20 years. She earns a monthly income of 4,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, oranges, and cabbages to sell to her customers.

She will use the profits from the expanded business to repay the loan and educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, oranges, and cabbages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a maize farmer from Gidan Dogaji village. As a Babban Gona member, Hauwa is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs. Hauwa will use this loan to store the maize her harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when she can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hauwa no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Hauwa hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 36 years aged man and lives in Kyotera town. He operates a mobile money business and repairs phones. He works seven days and each day he works for 12 hours. He also does small scale farming to feed his family.

He started his business in 2010 with the aim of earning a living. He has acquired this loan facility in order to add float on his mobile money business line.
His clients are fellow residents from surrounding town and his dream is to enlarge his business but he still faces the challenge of lack of enough capital.
He describes himself as a hard working and a honest man.

loans.use: to boost his mobile money business by increasing float.

loans.name: Marileidy Altagracia

texts.es:
Marileidy Altagracia es una joven que desea estudiar Licenciatura en Educación, mención Orientación Escolar, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia:
Mi nombre es Marileidy tengo 23 años de edad, actualmente resido en la Provincia San Pedro de Macorís. Nací en Santo Domingo, allí estuve viviendo hasta los 18 años de edad. Tengo dos hermanos de los cuales yo soy la mayor. No estoy casada, no tengo hijos. Mi madre tiene una tienda de ropa y mi padre es herrero. 
Quiero estudiar en la Universidad Católica de Santo Domingo, la carrera de Orientación Escolar porque desde pequeña me ha gustado trabajar con niños, me encanta observarlos, escucharlos, orientarlos. Soy voluntaria de un Ministerio llamado Operación Niños de Navidad donde llevamos regalos a diferentes actividades con los niños, como obras, musicales y danza. Me gusta mucho la Fotografía donde puedo expresar el arte que llevo por dentro. Aún no he podido ingresar a la Universidad por carencias económicas.  Necesito el préstamo porque a través de él es que cubriré los gastos necesarios que conlleva la carrera y la universidad. De no recibir el préstamo no podría estudiar por el momento y tendría que ponerme a trabajar hasta poder ahorrar el monto necesario para cubrir la universidad. Afectaría en que si tendría que dejar de estudiar para trabajar, esto podría traer un atraso tanto en mis estudios como en mis deseos de ser profesional, ya que a través de los que fueron mis estudios en la escuela he sido una buena estudiante, he sido premiada como sobresaliente. 
Dentro de mis metas académicas están la de ser unos de los estudiantes de la universidad con mayor índice académico, poderme destacar en el área y poder terminar mis estudios con las mejores competencias de la carrera a cursar. Dentro de lo familiar esta dar todo el apoyo necesario para contribuir con cualquier necesidad y alcance. Mi meta personal es crecer como persona responsable y solidaria dentro de los talentos a desarrollar mi carrera y seguir destacándome como una persona aplicada, como la cual me considero. Me gustaría que al terminar mi carrera trabajar en una área de la misma y si me pusieran a mí a elegir mi tipo de trabajo seria encargada de orientación en una escuela o colegio, y allí poder resaltar mis cualidades y destrezas como la buena profesional que quiero ser.
texts.en:
Marileidy Altagracia is a youth who wants to study for a degree in Education, honorable mention in Educational Orientation. She is requesting a loan to be able to pay her educational expenses. This is her story:

"My name is Marileidy. I am 23 years old, currently residing in San Pedro de Macorís Province. I was born in Santo Domingo, and lived there until I was 18. I have two siblings and I am the oldest. I am single and have no children. My mother has a clothing store and my father is a metal worker.

I want to study at la Universidad Católica de Santo Domingo, in Educational Orientation as since I was small I have enjoyed playing with children. I love to observe them, listen to them and give them advise. I am a volunteer in a Ministry called "Operación Niños de Navidad" where we take gifts to different activities with children like plays, music and dance. I like photography a lot as I can express the art I have inside me. I have not started University yet due to the lack of financial means. I need the loan as with it I can cover the necessary expenses of the course and the university. If I don't receive the loan I won't be able to study for now and will have to go to work until I save enough money needed to cover the university costs. It will affect me as if I have to quit my studies to work, this will delay my studies and my desire to be a professional. As to my studies in school I was a good student and won awards for being outstanding.

Amongst my academic goals I want to be one of the students with the highest academic standing. I want to be outstanding in my field and be able to complete my studies with the utmost competence in my degree. My family is ready to give all the support needed to contribute to any need within their means. My personal goal is to grow as a responsible and supportive person within my ability to develop my career and continue to stand out as an industious person, as I see myself. I would like to complete my studies working in my field and if it was up to me to choose my work I would be responsible for the professional guidance of a school or college where I could highlight my qualities and skills as the good professional I want to be.

loans.use: to cover the costs of her higher education.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina must dig a water well in the front yard due to the lack of drinking water. She also must add some more elements to the home before winter starts.

loans.use: to dig a water well in the front yard and do some more work at their home.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor engages in making native pots and stoves made of clay. She has been in that kind of livelihood for more than ten years, serving locals and town dwellers.

She is a married woman and has five children. Her husband also has an income to support the needs of her family.

She has a limited amount of funds to continue to expand her business. She would like to cope with the demands and wouldn't let her respective clients wait for too long. She decided to avail herself of a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI to to invest in materials like clay and cement.

Leonor hopes that her business will become productive and sustainable in the coming years. That could definitely improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to invest in materials like clay and cement.

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lorena está solicitando un nuevo crédito para poder fortalecer su negocio, comprara maíz, harina, aceite, repollos, tomates, quesillo, etc., para preparar pupusas para vender, espera que su negocio mantenga su estabilidad.
Anteriormente también vendía ropa y para ello había solicitado el crédito, tuvo buenos ingresos y respondió a sus obligaciones, su grupo familiar se mantiene y no ha tenido problemas para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Lorena is seeking a new loan to strengthen her business. She plans to buy maize, flour, oil, cabbage, tomatoes, cheese etc. to make pupusas (stuffed tortillas) to sell. She hopes that her business will remain stable.

In the past Lorena sold clothing and used a loan to help with that. She had a good income and fulfilled her obligations. Her family remains the same and she has not had any problems with continuing her work.

loans.use: buy maize, flour, oil, cabbage, tomatoes, cheese etc. to make pupusas (stuffed tortillas)

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 55-year-old, single resident of Dolores, Clarin. She provides her basic needs from the little amount of 10,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own hog raising business that she has had for ten years.

However, since 2004 she's been a member of GDMPC. She applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy feeding supplies in volume.

Nida wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hong, born in 1968, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. Her family consists of four members, including her husband, her two daughters. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family’s main income is from planting vegetables and pig breeding so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. She wants to expand the breeding model by raising pigs for meat but she does not have enough money to do this. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding and when selling the pigs next year, it will bring her family a considerable profit. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to expand the breeding model by raising pigs for meat.

loans.name: Sumber Bunga Group

texts.en:
The main goal of all pig farmers group is to be successful and independent in terms of capital. Sumber Bunga group has undergone several periods of repayment of the loan and this time they shared they success in their pigs business. As a group that not only received venture capital, but also received training, it is attracting some women to join. They want to develop a raising pigs business and a better quality of life.

As a leader, Wayan successfully manage the pigs and lead the Sumber Bunga group. With the new loan, she will use it to buy superior feed and renovate the pig pens. Wayan and all members of Sumber Bunga group hopes to become successful pig breeders and self-sufficient in terms of capital.

loans.use: to buy superior feed and renovate the pig pens.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Fishing has been the source of income in most communities in Concepcion, Iloilo. Arlyn and her husband live in one of those communities and have been engaged in a fishing business. To earn a living, they have been doing this business for 11 years.

Arlyn is a 33-year-old woman, with five children, ages 14, 13, 10, 7, and 3 years old. All of them need their support and they are dependent on this livelihood.

Arlyn dreams to uplift her business, to have a better life, and to support her children in their studies. She wants them to finish and become professionals someday.

We can help Arlyn by giving her the funds she is requesting to pay for boat repairs and to buy a new engine, as well.

loans.use: to pay for boat repairs and to buy a new engine.

loans.name: Bioliya

texts.en:
Bioliya is a widow and brings up and feed keeps her 2 children alone. Bioliya loves her children much and tries for them well-being. Bioliya has been busy with food business more than 28 years. She sells food items in a store which located near bus station.

Bioysha now needs financial support because she is really ill. Bioysha must go to hospital but she has no money. Bioysha is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy medicines for her treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her treatment.

loans.name: Shela Mae

texts.en:
Shela Mae is a 25-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and the mother of two young children, ages three and one year old. Her husband is a fisherman, while Shela Mae buys and sells crude oil (fuel). She has been doing this for three years. Aside from this, she also helps her husband in fishing.

With this, she is asking for a loan to buy crude oil (fuel). She will also need an amount to repair their fishing boat and buy fishing net as well in order to enhance their catch.

Shela Mae is thinking of other business opportunities that will help them augment their livelihood. Thus, she plans in the future to start a sari-sari store (variety store) business and wishes to raise pigs to sell.

loans.use: to buy crude oil (fuel), for fishing boat repair and to buy fishing net.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix, 41 years old, is a hardworking man. He is married & has 5 children and lives in Mitugas , Tudela Mis. Occ. His wife helps him in farm. And to earn a living, he decided to plant bananas. Their business is already 4 years in existence and got a profit of P3, 000.00 per month. This income is not enough for them so he plans to make a banana farm so that he can continue to send his children to school.

His main problems is he needs an additional fund to buy fertilizers & seedlings, so he went to Gata Daku MPC to ask for help. He applied for a loan amounted to P5, 000.00 and was released last October 15, 2015.
Felix’s main objective is to earn a living for them to support the needs of the family and continue sending their children to school. He aims to have another piece of land for the expansion of their business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old, married, and has four children. Her business is operating a quarry, which she has been doing for three years. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES.

Mary requested her first loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to diversify into the used clothes business and rent more land for her quarry. She will use the profits from her expanded business to increase her savings and service the loan. She hopes to be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to diversify into the used clothes business and rent more land for her quarry.

loans.name: Amelsy Del Socorro

texts.es: Amelsy es una microempresaria de 35 años de edad que emprendió su venta de comidas rápidas en una localidad de la capital del departamento de Bolívar, Cartagena de Indias, obteniendo gran acogida por residentes y transeúntes del lugar, quienes cualquier día de la semana pueden llegar a su establecimiento y degustar de deliciosas hamburguesas, perros calientes, mazorcas, asados de carne o pollo, salchipapas, entre otros platos de su carta de comidas. Ella reside en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos en una urbanización del municipio y comparte su tiempo entre su familia y su trabajo, el cual es flexible al permitirle estar en la mañana y tarde al pendiente de su hogar y a partir de las 7 p.m. hasta las 10 p.m. en su negocio. Amelsy desea mejorar la imagen de su local, ella desea proyectar a sus clientes un sitio de comidas que les garantice aspectos concernientes a un mejor higiene y comodidad, es por ello que está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para adquirir mesas, sillas y pintura,  e insumos y materias primas para sus comidas. Esta inversión permitirá que se motive a la captación de nuevos clientes en conjunto  de incremento en las ventas. Su meta a futuro es ahorrar para el estudio profesional de sus hijos.
texts.en:
35-year old Amelsy is a small businesswoman who started her fast food business in premises located in the capital of the department of Bolívar, Cartagena de Indias. She was welcomed by local residents and passersby who can go every day of the week to her restaurant to enjoy delicious hamburgers, hot dogs, corn on the cob, grilled meat or chicken, kebabs etc. from the menu.

Amelsy lives with the husband and children in a residential area of the municipality. She splits her time between her family and her work. As she can work flexible hours, she can stay at home in the mornings and afternoons, and the evenings at work from 7pm to 10pm.

She wishes to improve the image of her premises by providing her customers with a more hygienic and comfortable place to eat their food. For this reason she is applying for a loan, her first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy tables, chairs, and paint, as well as ingredients for her dishes. This investment will allow her to gain new customers and increase sales. Amelsy's future goal is to save so her children can take professional courses.

loans.use: buy tables, chairs, and paint, as well as ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Ntidusigarinyuma Group

texts.fr:
Anicet ta  fait partie du groupe Ntidusigarinyuma et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 43 ans et est mariée à J. Claude, un planton. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 3 à 8 ans, dont  2 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge une fille qui étudie. 

Elle fait le commerce des habits  depuis  7 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits mais, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une une moto et une parcelle ; et voir ses enfants étudient.
texts.en:
Anicet is a member of the Ntidusigarinyuma group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 43 and married to an orderly named J. Claude. 

They have three children aged between three and eight years old, of whom two go to school. She is also responsible for a girl who is studying.

She has been selling clothing for seven years.

This is her third loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that she requests, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of clothing for resale to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a motorbike and a plot of land; and see her children through their studies.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of clothing for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Marfita

texts.en: Marfita wants to buy some items for her embroidery activity and use the rest of the loan to continue to invest in her home.

loans.use: to buy items for her embroidery activity (85% of the loan), and to invest the rest in her family house.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a 60-year-old married man with five children aged 30, 20, 18, 5 and 3, and only three are attending school. He is a salary earner and a farmer who also teaches in a private school located in the busy town of Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been doing this work since 1981 and also runs a retail shop selling agricultural inputs.

Hardships such as competition and insufficient capital are a major hindrance to his vision of having a self-sustaining business and family. He aspires to expand and diversify his business to include mobile money transfer and having an outstanding infant school because of the passion he has for educating the young ones.

Johnson has asked for a loan to buy land where he can expand his farming activities.

loans.use: to buy land where he can expand his farming activities.

loans.name: Vathana

texts.en:
Vathana is a 22-year-old single student who is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Civil Engineering in his second year at a university in the city. He is from the Tbong Khmum Province in Cambodia. His father is a taxi driver and his mother is a rice farmer.

Now, Vathana is lacking the money to cover his university fees from the second to his fifth years, so he has decided to take out a loan. With this loan, he will have enough money for earning a bachelor’s degree and graduate successfully. After graduation, he is going to find a good job with a decent salary, so he will be able to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from the second to fifth year for a BSc. in Civil Engineering. His father is a taxi driver and his mother a farmer.

loans.name: Yana

texts.en:
Yana sells clothes at the market. She and her family live in an old house. Due to the previous loan Yana did renovations at the kitchen and bathroom. In spring she gave birth to a child.

This time Yana is asking for a loan of 30 000 UAH to install a new entrance door and do renovation in the hall way. She wants to improve the floor and put new tiles on it. The loan will help to improve her family living conditions and take better care of her newly born child.

loans.use: to install a new entrance door and do renovation in the hall way

loans.name: Guerreras De Fe Group

texts.es:
Patricia es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 18 años, y su negocio es la venta de detergentes.
Ella es buena madre, constante y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ que es una ciudadela alejada del centro, donde se juntan manufactureros de todas las áreas para generar el comercio.
Patricia es morena de baja estatura y físico robusto (la primera de la izquierda, viste blusa roja), su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como electricista y con su hijo que estudia y trabaja, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Las ganas de mejorar su negocio la llevaron a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, cerrajería, venta de productos naturales para la salud, venta de artesanía en cuero, venta de refrescos y tienda de barrio. Su negocio es la venta de detergentes como; Detergentes en polvo, detergentes líquidos, detergentes en pastillas y otros, “Los detergentes en polvo, son los más comerciales…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la mercadería rota constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para reabastecer su mercadería. Su sueño es tener un puesto en el mercado para dejar de ambular, ella desea comprar detergentes por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Patricia solicita un préstamo para comprar detergentes por mayor para vender ambulantemente.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 35-year-old woman who lives with her partner, has 1 child who is 18 years old, and her business is the sale of detergents.  She is a good mother, dependable and hardworking. 

Her business is done in the neighborhood 'Plan 3000' , which is a small neighbourhood far from downtown and where manufacturers gather from all areas to generate trade.
 
Patricia has a brown, short and sturdy physique (the first on the left, wears a red blouse).  Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she also speaks Spanish.  She shares her life with her partner who works as an electrician, and her son who studies and works.  They live in a home built of brick that has all the basic services. 

The desire to improve her business led her to join this banking institution.  The businesses of the members include:  selling food, selling second-hand clothes, locksmithing, sale of natural health products, selling leather crafts, selling soft drinks and neighborhood store.

Her business is selling detergents such as:  Powder detergents, liquid detergents, tablet detergents, and others, "powder detergents are the best for business ..." she says. The pros of her business is that the merchandise rotates constantly.  The cons is the lack of money to restock her merchandise.
