Her dream is to have a stall in the market so as to stop selling door to door.  She would like to purchase detergents wholesale. 

This is the 1st sequence loan with the institution, and she has been doing this activity for three years.

These are the reasons for which Patricia is requesting a loan:  to purchase detergents wholesale to sell door to door.

loans.use: to purchase detergents wholesale to sell door to door.

loans.name: Tunaweza Group

texts.en:
Geroda, who is in her early 30s is married with two children who are still at school. For five years now, she has supported her family with a mamalishe business (food vending). She works from 6a.m. to 10p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Geroda's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase her mamalishe stock to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of being a big business woman.

Geroda will share this loan with her loan group "Tunaweza" which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her mamalishe stock to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 36 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. His business is running a retail shop. He has been in the business for three years and earns a monthly income of 24,000 Kenya shillings.

This is Lawrence's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase sugar, milk, rice, cooking oil, wheat and maize flour, cereals, etc. to sell in the shop. He will use the profits from expanded business to increase his savings account and add more merchandise to his stock.

His hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable business and to open other shops in different areas.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, rice, cooking oil, wheat and maize flour, cereals, etc. to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a resident of San Dionesio, Iloilo. She is a 50-year-old woman, married, with six children; three adult and three school aged children. 

Jessie and her husband raise their family for 30 years through fishing. They work hard doing this livelihood so they could give their family a better life. Because of this, Jessie wants to uplift their livelihood. Thus, aside from fishing she also sells dried fish to the community.

We can help her by lending the amount she requested to buy a new machine and plywood to repair their boat.

Jessie’s only wish is to have enough food and good health to sustain.

loans.use: to buy a new machine and plywood to repair their boat

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en:
Calixta is a 63-year-old married woman who lives in the rural town of Sagbayan, Bohol. She raises hogs to earn a living. She has been raising hogs for a long period of time, catering to locals in her place. She has two grown children.

Calixta needs the loan to purchase additional piglets and pig feed to make some profits. She faces one major challenge in her business--the liquidity of capital to expand her business for a particular period of time until the livestock is ready to be sold.

In that way, her income will augment and she could set aside half of the profit for expansion while the other is to be kept for emergency use.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan, and now Calixta continues to build her business to become more sustainable in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Pelucy

texts.en:
Pelucy deals in clothing wrappers (bitenge). Being a single mother of two children, she realized the need of having an income-generating activity to enable her take good care of her children, since she is their only breadwinner.

She is faced with challenges of competition and the fact that her business is seasonal. However, Pelucy has thought of a way to deal with these challenges by adding another type of traditional women's bridal clothes (sukas) so as to have a variety of tastes available for her customers.

The challenge is that the money she has on hand is not enough to purchase the stock she wants. She is thus requesting a loan to to buy traditional women's bridal clothes (sukas) to sell.

loans.use: to buy traditional women's bridal clothes (sukas) to sell.

loans.name: Kamara Group

texts.fr:
J. Bosco fait partie du groupe  Kamara et  habite à  Bubanza.Il a 29 ans et est marié à Belyse ,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 2 à 5 ans. 

Il fait le commerce de l'huile de palme   depuis  10 ans. 

IL est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient,il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de palmiers pour la fabrication de l'huile de palme  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait faire de l'agriculture comme deuxième activité  ,et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
J. Bosco is a member of the Kamara group and lives in Bubanza. He is 29 and married to a farmer named Belys. They have three children aged between two and five years old.  

 He has been selling palm oil for 10 years.

This is his third loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that he requests, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of palm fruits to make palm oil for resale to  earn more.

 In the coming years, he would like to take up farming as a secondary activity, and see his children through their studies.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of palm fruits to make palm oil for resale to  earn more.

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es:
María considera que los créditos le están ayudando a mejorar su negocio y estilo de vida, con el capital anterior pudo comprar materiales para preparar el menú que ofrece a sus clientes, asimismo mejoro el equipo de trabajo, en buena hora ha tenido más ingresos, ya que en su hogar surgieron costos médicos y así los pudo cubrir.
Ella está entusiasmada por continuar trabajando y atendiendo mejor a sus clientes, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar verduras, carnes, condimentos, aceite, entre otros ingredientes básicos para preparar la comida que vende, otra parte le servirá para adquirir una cocina industrial para agilizar sus actividades y una televisión para que sus clientes puedan sentirse más cómodos mientras visitan su negocio.
texts.en:
María believes that her loans are helping improve her business and standard of living. With the money from past loans she was able to buy ingredients for the food she sells to her customers, as well as improve equipment. She soon earned a greater income and was able to cover the costs of medical treatment of a family member.

María is enthusiastic about her work and improving customer service. She needs a new loan to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, oil and other ingredients for the dishes she makes. Part of the loan will also be used to obtain an industrial stove to speed up cooking, and a television so that her customers will feel more comfortable when they visit her restaurant.

loans.use: buy vegetables, meat, condiments, oil and other ingredients for the dishes she makes

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is maize farmer from Bono village. As a member of Babban Gona, Sani is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Sani would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sani can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Sani is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is an artisan from Peru who specializes in wood mirrors, jewelry boxes and home decor. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood.

Antonio has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

"I'd describe my work as life itself, and my existence together with it. When I was 17, I created my first piece and felt immense satisfaction. Art guides my hands in that moment of pleasure as I begin a design. My pieces are inspired by the olden times and reflect the style of vintage pieces. They transmit my love for life and for nature — its flowers, birds and all the rich flora and fauna of our country."

"I craft all of my pieces with total dedication, using the same techniques passed on to me by my parents. Thank you for this wonderful opportunity."

Use the link below to view Antonio's wood mirrors, jewelry boxes and home decor on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/5387

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is married, with two adult sons. He and his wife live in a house. Vasil works as a machinist. Also he does freight transportation with his small tractor.

Vasil is asking for a loan of 40 000 UAH to install a new heating system and do kitchen renovations. He plans to install a gas boiler to help save money during the winter heating season. At the kitchen Vasil plans to put tiles on the walls and floor to improve not only appearance but sanitation as well.

loans.use: to install anew heating system and renovate the kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more trash for recycling and also used household appliances.

loans.name: Joemar

texts.en:
Joemar is an 18-year-old young man who lives a simple life with his family in Concepcion, Iloilo.

He helps his family by fishing. Joemar has been in this business for two years. He has requested a loan because his fishing boat needs repairs, and he needs to buy some fishing net.

Joemar is working toward his goal of giving his family a better life in the future.

loans.use: to repair his fishing boat, and to buy fish net.

loans.name: Darwin Alexis

texts.es:
El Sr. Darwin Alexis  Benites: 
tiene 39 años de edad, convive con compañera de hogar tiene  hijos y tiene 
casa Propia habita en la Comunidad de Trojes,  al oriente de Honduras, su actividad principal es la agricultura, el se dedica a la siembra de maiz y frijoles desde hace muchos años, de la cual cuenta con muy buena experiencia por su excelente desempeño, actualmente cuenta con unas tierras para trabajar.

El señor Darwin espera  con el credito que nos ha solicitado  la  comprar  de
los fertilizantes necesarios para la siembra de una manzana de frijoles que tiene como un proyecto. Una persona muy trabajadora y lucha dia con dia para mejorar su calidad de vida.   Esta muy contento de trabajar con Prisma.


Sue sueño es pode mejoras las condiciones de vida de el y su familia.

Trojes  Honduras, Septiembre 2015.
texts.en:
Darwin Alexis is 39 years old and lives with his partner and their children. He owns a home in Trojes, in western Honduras. His main business is farming. He has been working growing corn and beans for many years, so he has lots of experience. He is a very hard worker and currently farms some land of his own.

Darwin wants to use this loan to buy the fertilizer he needs to start another plot of beans, which is his new project. He is a very driven person who is fighting for a better life by working hard every day. He is very happy to be working with Prisma.

His goal is to improve his and his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow beans.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda resides in the rural town of Carmen, Bohol. She is married woman and has four children. Her oldest child is 20 and the youngest is 10. 
She owns a vehicle locally known  as "habal-habal" (motorcycle with extended seat) transportation services. It transport passengers from one place to remote areas.
She also raises hogs to cater the needs of her family.

 Erlinda joined CEVI to avail the loan to finance her sources of livelihood.
She wants to buy motor accessories and pig feed.  In that way, it enhance safety to its respective passengers, as she continue its operation. It also enables her to  raise quality pigs as these could be sold in a short period of time. Thus, her income will improve and she could  continue provide her family with proper nutrition and better living condition.

She has successfully paid her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan to further rebuild her business.

loans.use: to buy motor accessories and pig feed

loans.name: Sreyreab

texts.en: Sreyreab is a 26-year-old young woman living in a straw house located in Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district. She is the mother of a small child. She has struggled to make a living via growing rice for three years and working at a garment factory to support her family’s living. Her businesses earn her about 10 USD per day and she can save around 6 USD each day after expenses for emergency needs. Unfortunately, her hard work in the farming business has been ruined by insect pests. She is now applying for a loan with VisionFund which is the first time for her. She is willing to use her loan to buy a motorcycle to drive her to work on time and reduce the cost of transportation. She hopes to save more income for future needs and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to drive her to work on time and reduce the cost of transportation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
Maximo is a 58 year old, married and he lives at Lower Usogan, Bonifacio,Misamis Occidental. He is engaged in a rice production business in supporting family needs and it was their business for 45 years that helps them a lot in their everyday living.

Maximo need additional funds for his business so he borrowed a loan amounting of P 30,0000.00 at GDMPC to purchase fertilizer of their rice field in order to have more harvest.

Maximo plan to have more savings for housing repair.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer of his farm

loans.name: Ersi

texts.en:
Ersi is in the photograph with his wife, Elsida, and their daughter who requires medical treatment at a hospital in the capital city, far from their home.

Ersi's main activity to earn a living for the family is transporting people, and his elderly parents own a small amount of land in a village, far from their town of residence, where they have planted mostly orchards. Thus, they sell fruits as well to earn a little bit of cash.

loans.use: to take his daughter to a hospital.

loans.name: Usaini

texts.en:
Usaini is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Usaini has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Usaini would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Usaini can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Usaini will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Usaini is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university  education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Victoriya

texts.en:
Victoriya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Victoriya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Victoriya would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Victoriya can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Victoriya will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Victoriya is thankful that she now has the opportunity to to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hang, born in 1988, is the Thai ethnic woman, living with her husband and her two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. Her eldest daughter is at the sixth year at school and the younger daughter is at the second year at school. She wants to borrow a loan to pay for her children’s education fees.
She hopes that the loan amount will help her children have good condition for learning, and for herself she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education fees

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is married and lives in Rafah in the Gaza Strip. He operates a sheep farm, which he has been doing for two years. His farm is next to his parents' house. He works alone in the farm. He sells all sheep products and also sells the sheep themselves.

Mohammad started his business with only four sheep and now has 12. The farm is the only source of income for Mohammad and his family. The challenges for his business arethe political situation, as there are no certainties in Gaza, and the competition in the market.

Mohammad requested a loan, which he will use to buy new sheep for his farm. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his family's standard of living. In the future, Mohammad would like to expand his business and sell additional livestock in his farm.

loans.use: to purchase new sheep for his farm.

loans.name: Dúo La Castellana De San Juan Group

texts.es: Dúo la Castellana de San Juan Se conforma por las señora Ilci es originario del municipio de San Juan Sacatepéquez, ella se dedica desde ya varios años a la venta de ropa y peluches zapatos americano, Ilci líder de este dúo cuenta con un local en su domicilio teniendo así  mucha ventaja por la afluencia de personas diariamente,  aprovechando esta oportunidad doña Ilci a agregado a su negocio la venta de granizadas, productos como perfumería, cosméticos entre otros y los fines de semana la venta  de tamales y  paches.se aproxima los meses  en que las personas buscan ropa para su familia motivo por el cual solicita ser apoyada  a través de capital que piensan invertir en la compra de mas mercadería, como ropa y calzado y estar preparadas para estas fechas.
texts.en:
Ilci is one of the two members of Dúo la Castellana de San Juan. She is from the town of San Juan Sacatepéquez, and has been working for several years now selling clothing, shoes, and stuffed animals.

Ilci is the group leader and has a retail space set up at home, which is a great advantage because she receives many customers every day. Ilci decided to make the most of this by selling iced drinks and incorporating more products for sale, such as fragrances and cosmetics, among other items. She also sells tamales on the weekends.

In the coming months, people will start looking for clothing items to buy for their relatives, which is why she is requesting this loan. She will use it to invest in more merchandise, such as clothing and shoes, in order to prepare for the season.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jose Misael

texts.es:
José, comparte su vivienda con su familia, la cual está integrada por su esposa y un hijo, cuenta que tiene 50 años de residir en dicho lugar, su negocio consiste en cultivar maíz y maicillo, además posee ganado que comercializa en el tiangue de la ciudad, el oficio lo aprendió con ayuda de sus padres, otros ingresos que tiene son ayudas económicas de sus parientes.
Está necesitando de un crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas y herbicidas, para cuidar sus cultivos y tener una cosecha más abundante, también invertirá en la reparación del cercado de los terrenos en los que siembra, su objetivo es realizar de inmediato dichos trabajos para mejorar su negocio.
José sueña con seguir trabajando, cancelar sus deudas y sostener su familia.
texts.en:
Jose shares his home with his family, which consists of his wife and a son.  He has been living in this area for 50 years.

His business is to grow maize and sorghum.  He also has cattle which he sells in the city market.  He learned this trade with the help of his parents.   Other income that he receives comes from financial assistance from relatives.

He is in need of a loan to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides to tend his crops and have a more abundant harvest.  He will also invest in repairing the fences around the land in which his planting is located.  

His goal is to immediately begin such work to improve his business.

Jose dreams are to continue working, to pay off debts and to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides, to tend his crops and have a more abundant harvest

loans.name: Jeraldin

texts.en:
Jeraldin is  a 33-year old married woman, whose main source of living is raising and selling of hogs.  She lives in the rural area of Getafe, Bohol with his husband and a nine-year old son.  She  has been raising and selling of hogs  for than 5 years and helps her husband in shouldering family expenses.
Aside from hog raising, Jeraldin also engages in buying and selling of copra( the dried meat of the coconut), and by product of coconut extraction to produce oil.

She has requested a loan to boost its hog raising activity. She wants to buy pig feed and food including water. These are vital not only for their livelihood but for her family also. It seems that Jeraldin's family would buy purified drinking water for daily consumption. Thus, these will enables her to work hard and and to earn well.

In the future Jeraldin is hoping that she will be handling her both livelihood to become sustainable and to continue send her child to school for brighter future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and food including water

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 41-year-old woman and the mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a canteen in a school. He sells different types of food items such as samosas, vegetable rolls, pakoras, tea, etc. Her husband is only responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Azra's husband needs to purchase different types of food and other items for his business purpose so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore Azra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose. She is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to purchase different types of food and other items for his canteen business.

loans.name: Yulys Greys

texts.es:
Ella es Yulys es una de las jóvenes llamadas a continuar la hermosa profesión agrícola, ella nació y se crío en el campo, desde joven optó por seguir su propio camino, se fue a vivir con su conyugue y ahora juntos están emprendiendo un proyecto de comprar un terreno y construir un hogar para formar una familia.

Ella no quiere quedarse atrás en este proyecto, no quiere ser una carga para su pareja, por ello se encuentra solicitando un apoyo económico para iniciar un negocio de cría de aves, el dinero será destinado en la compra de pollos de engorde, alimento y materiales para la construcción de un galpón.

Un aporte ayudara  a una empresaria joven del campo a iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
This is Yulys, one of the young people called to continue in the beautiful profession of agriculture. She was born and raised in the countryside. From an early age, Yulys opted to continue on her own path, and she left home to live with her husband. Now, they are undertaking the project of buying a piece of land and constructing a home in order to form a family.

Yulys doesn't wish to fall behind in this project, nor does she wish to be a burden for her parents. For that reason, she is requesting your economic help in order to initiate a business raising farm fowl. The loan funds will be used to purchase chickens to fatten, the feed they will need, and construction materials to build a chicken coop.

Your contribution will help a young female entrepreneur in the countryside to initiate her business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to fatten and the feed they will need, plus materials for constructing a chicken coop.

loans.name: Eram

texts.en: Eram recognized a need for a school to educate the children of the local middle class families. Therefore, 2 years ago she opened her school which now has 112 pupils. In order to provide furniture for her student population, Eram has borrowed PKR 80,000 to furnish her school. Eram hopes to keep slowly but steadily building her school facilities in the future.

loans.use: to provide furniture for her student population

loans.name: Arnold  Fabricio

texts.es:
El Señor Arnold Tiene 23 años de edad, convive con sus padres,  vive en la Comunidad  Trojes  al Oriente de Honduras, es un Joven emprendedor, su actividad es el comercio de cerdos, el se dedica a engordar y vender cerdos, actividad con la que cuenta  muy buena  experiencia es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha día con día para una mejor vida.
 
Arnold esta muy contento de la actividad que realiza y de la cual obtiene sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares y compromisos financieros, esta solicitado un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y engorde y así obtener mas ingresos  y mejorar su calidad de vida, esta muy contento de poder  trabajar con Prisma 

su sueño es poder mejorar su condición de vida y de su familia. 

Trojes,Honduras-Septembre 2015
texts.en:
Arnold Fabricio Suarez Mejia is 23 years old and lives with his parents. He resides in the Trojes community in East Honduras. Arnold is a young entrepreneur who works in the pig business. He makes  a living fattening and selling pigs and has a good experience with this work. He is a very hard worker who fights day after day for a better life.  

Arnold is very happily with his work, from which he earns money to cover his household expenses and financial obligations. He is requesting a loan to purchase of more live pigs to fatten and in this way obtain more income and increase his quality of life. He is very happy to be able to work with Prisma. 

Arnold's dream is to be able to improve his and his family's living conditions.

Trojes,Honduras-Septembre 2015

loans.use: to purchase more pigs.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil married man lives with his family. He runs a sheep farm in Khan younis in the Gaza Strip, the farm is next to his parents' house. He works alone in the farm. Kamil has been in this business for two years He sells all sheep products and also sells the sheep themselves.

Kamil started the business with only 4 sheep and now he has 12 sheep. The farm is the only source of income for Kamil and his family.

Kamil says that the challenges for his business is the political situation as there are no certainties in Gaza. The other challenge is the competition in the market.
He requested the murabaha loan to buy new sheep for the farm. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his family's standard of living. In the future, Kamil would like to expand his business and sell additional livestock in his farm.

loans.use: to buy new sheep for the farm.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula desea desarrollar su proyecto de realizar mejoras en las paredes y techo de su vivienda. Para esto solicita un préstamo de setecientos cincuenta mil colones (₡750 000), dinero con el cual comprará materiales de construcción, entre estos, pintura, madera y láminas para construcción. Esto con el fin de brindarle a su familia un lugar más seguro y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Paula wants to make improvements in the walls and roof of her house. To do this, she is requesting a loan of fifty thousand colones (₡750 000), money with which she will use to buy construction materials, including paint, wood, and sheets. Afterwards she will be able to offer her family a safer place to live and improve the quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her house.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking woman, toiling the land and growing rice. She owns a rice paddy, which serves as the family's main source of income. She is married and has seven children. Her oldest is 17 while the youngest is 4. Her husband's occupation was carpentry.

Susana is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner CEVI because she has to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers, and items for family consumption like food and water. In this way, she would be able to gain a higher yield from her farm, enabling her to augment her income and start rolling out her capital. In that way, she could invest in other sources of income to become progressive. She is always seeking ways to improve the quality life for the welfare of her family.

In the future, Susana is hopeful that she could continue sending all of her children to school for their respective studies.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers, and items for family consumption like food and water.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 30 year old salon proprietor at Voi Kenya. She is a mother of one whose spouse provides with additional income and has been in this business for the last seven years doing well.

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business after repaying the previous ones successfully.
She will use the loan to purchase shampoo, hair treatments and hair additions and the anticipated profit to open a second salon. she hopes to be financially stable in future.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, hair treatments and hair additions

loans.name: Anunciacion

texts.en: Anunciacion, a 65 years old, widow, and has four children and  lives in Sebasi Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. She owns farm and is doing well that makes her earn good income for the family. she had repaid successfully her previous loan used for fertilization of her farm. With her new investment, she took a new loan to purchase kitchen utensils and house decorations to sell in the village while she was waiting for the next cropping. She wants to improve her farm as well her new investment in selling kitchen utensils and house decoration and her future plan is to renovate their home for a safe living for the family.

loans.use: to sell kitchen utensils and home decorations

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 42 years old married with four children, To make a living, Judith operates a fish vending business in their village. While her husband engage to fishing, she sells fish and earns well from this. She had joined GDMPC recently and had borrowed a loan to buy an additional fish bucket and buy variety of fish to sell. For ten years in the business, she has dreamed of owning a fishing boat which she has rented for many years. In the future, she plans to use her profit in making her dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy an additional fish bucket and more fish for selling

loans.name: Dukizanye Group

texts.fr:
Estella fait partie du groupe  Dukizanye et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 42 ans et est mariée à leonce ,un enseignant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 6 à 16 ans,dont  4 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de bois  depuis  2 ans. 

Elle est à son vingt-quatrième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  bois  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrai acheter une moto de transport  ,et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Estella is a member of the Dukizanye group and lives in Gitega. She is 42 and married to a teacher named Leonce. They have five children aged between six and 16 years old.  Four of them go to school.

She has been selling wood for two years.

This is her 24th loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that she requests, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of wood for resale to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a motorbike for transportation, and see her children go to school to study.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of wood for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Yakubu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Yakubu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Yakubu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university  education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Yeremiah

texts.en:
Yeremiah is single. He operates a baby care shop and owns rentals as an added source of income. He is a very strategic and hard working man who plans to marry in the near future. However, he is faced with a challenge of competition.

Yeremiah has thought of a way to manage competition which is forcing him to request for a loan facility to buy supplies for newborn babies, like baby blankets, sacks, diapers, and wipes, among others which are demanded all the time. This will help him attract more customers and also improve his income levels.

loans.use: to buy supplies for newborn babies, like baby blankets, sacks, diapers, and wipes, among others to sell.

loans.name: Umoja Ni Neema Group

texts.fr: Joséphine a commencé ses activités de petit commerce depuis son jeune âge grâce à un petit capital lui donné par ses parents. Une fois mariée, son époux l'a relancé dans la vente de souliers, puis dans les ustensiles de cuisine et aujourd'hui dans la vente de divers alimentaires. Cette activité lui a ouvert plusieurs horizons: élever ses enfants et les scolariser, acheter une maison ... Elle préfère cette activité car les divers alimentaires ne laissent pas de déchets que l'on ne peut pas utiliser; elle a par contre pour obstacle majeur la vente à crédit et quelquefois de courtes périodes de mévente. Ce crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en stock considérable et à moindre coût. Joséphine préside le groupe UMOJA NI NEEMA et porte une blouse blanche sur photo.
texts.en: Josephine started her activity as a small storekeeper when she was young, thanks to a small sum of money that her parents gave to her. When she married, her husband set her up selling shoes, then selling kitchen utensils, and now she sells various food products. This business has broadened horizons for her: to bring up her children, to send them to school, to buy a house… She prefers this activity, for food products do not leave waste that cannot be used; she has one major problem however, which is the sale for credit, and sometimes short periods of a slump in the sales. This loan will enable her to acquire a considerable amount of reserve stock for a lower price. Josephine is the president of the Umoja Ni Neema group and is wearing a white blouse in the photo.

loans.use: to reinforce her stock of semolina, rice, and vegetable oil for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, están además haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir, en una pobreza extrema, pero están luchando para poder mejorarla y superarla.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ladislaa, quien pide este préstamo para la compra de remedios naturales variados, para poder venderlos y de esa forma tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Comenta que se dedica a este trabajo hace ya un buen tiempo, que siempre tiene muy buena clientela que compra de ella sus remedios.
Ladislaa agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder capacitarse para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y poder ayudar a su familia de esa manera.
texts.en:
The name of this group is Mujeres Emprendedoras. They are on their seventh cycle with the women's committee program. They all work and help each other get ahead. They are also completing the poverty elimination survey: four of the members fall below the poverty line, which means they are living in extreme poverty, but they are working hard in order to improve their score and move up.

Ladislaa is one of the members of this group, and she is requesting this loan to buy a variety of natural remedies, which she will then sell in order to have a means to be able to help her family. She says she has been doing this for quite some time, and that she has very good customers who come to her for these remedies.

Ladislaa appreciates this opportunity to learn how to improve her living standards and to help her family.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Mariposas De Magdalena Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mariposas de Magdalena
Este dúo está formado por doña María Antonia, ella tiene 38 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de flores de diferentes variedades en su vivero ubicado en  Magdalena Milpas Altas desde ya hace unos años,  y así como a la agricultura de arveja china y suchini, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de madera y nylon , para construcción de tres galeras para cultivar sus flores, su mayor deseo es seguir creciendo y ser uno de los viveros más reconocidos, de su municipio, y espera que Fape la siga apoyando.
texts.en:
Dúo Mariposas de Magdalena: One member of this duo is María Antonia. She is 38 years old. She has worked selling different types of flowers from her greenhouse located in Magdalena Milpas Altas for a number of years. As well she grows green peas and zucchini.

She is requesting the loan to buy wood and nylon to construct three sheds to cultivate her flowers. Her greatest desire is to continue to grow and be one of the best known greenhouse grower in her municipality. She hopes that Fape continues to support her.

loans.use: to buy wood and nylon to make a greenhouse to grow flowers for sale.

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en: Khoder is a 22 year old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one sibling. Her father is the main income source in the family in order to fulfil the family needs. Khoder in parallel with his study, he works as a painter for extra money. Today, he is applying for a loan from kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay his Technical educational fees. He states that this loan will help him to pursue a good educational level.

loans.use: to pay his educational fees.

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda is a married woman lives with her family. She runs a sheep farm in Khan younis in the Gaza Strip, the farm is next to his parents' house. She works alone in the farm. Raghda has been in this business for two years. She sells all sheep products and also sells the sheep themselves.

Raghda started the business with only 2 sheep and now she has 5 sheep. The farm is the only source of income for Raghda and her family.

Raghda says that the challenges for her business is the political situation as there are no certainties in Gaza. The other challenge is the competition in the market.
She requested the loan to buy new sheep for the farm. She says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve her family's standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business and sell additional livestock in her farm.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for the farm.

loans.name: Jumanne

texts.en:
Jumanne is in his late 20s and is married with two children. One is at school and one is still small. He has been running several projects, selling electronic money transfers, selling telephone and a barber shop for four years now. He works from 8am to 10pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase on his business stock and has managed to pay back his loan successfully. He is happy with the loan. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, bought a plot of land started building his own house and covered household expenses.

He will use this loan to increase on the electronic money transfers, m-pesa, tigo pesa, airtel money, to increase on the best selling telephone stock and to buy salon products. He dreams of finishing building his house.

Jumanne will be accountable for paying back his loan.

loans.use: to increase on the electronic money transfers, m-pesa, tigo pesa, airtel money, to increase on the best selling  telephone stock and to buy salon products.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El Socio José pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
El socio continua dedicándose a trabajar como  técnico dental, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio José solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales como sondas, pinzas entre otros.
texts.en:
José belongs to the communal bank “El Templo del Inca” (The Incan Temple) in the city of Cuzco, Peru.

He works as a dental hygienist. He is a responsible and hard working individual. He has worked in his profession for some time now and things are going well thanks to the work he puts into it every day. His work is how he takes care of his family.

He is thankful for the loan he is asking for and promises to pay back on time.

He will use the loan to purchase surgical probes and tweezers, among other materials.

loans.use: to buy materials like surgical probes and tweezers

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Aileen works hard to support her family.

She has a butcher shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods and fish vending.

Aileen is borrowing PHP 3,000 through NWTF to buy more meat, pork and chicken meat to sell in her food stall.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more meat, pork and chicken meat to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 57 years old and has seven children. Lolita is married and has three children who are still in school.

Lolita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lolita has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Tugumane Group

texts.fr:
Frediane  fait partie du groupe  Tugumane et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 28 ans et est mariée à Joseph ,un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 1.5 à 7 ans. 

Elle fait le commerce de  riz et de haricot  depuis  3 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième    crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz,et de haricot à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter un terrain cultivable,une  vaches et une chèvres.
texts.en:
Frediane is a member of the Tugumane group and lives in Gitega. She is 28 and married to a shopkeeper named Joseph. They have three children aged one, five, and seven years old. 

She has been selling rice and beans for three years.

This is her fifth loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that she requests, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans for resale to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land for farming, a cow and some goats.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en:
Mimoza and her husband had to do some repairs and other things to their family home and they had no money at that moment.

"The repairs and installations were a must, yet we had zero money to pursue with them. Hence, we had relatives and some acquaintances that we borrowed the money from with the promise to pay them back as quick as we could. On that note, we did not manage to save all the moneys and this is why we request this loan," said Mimoza.

While Mimoza is a stay-at-home mom who plants veggies in the yard and has two goats, her husband Ylli runs his own auto service.

loans.use: to pay off some debts; they made some repairs/installations to their home with money they borrowed from relatives

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 45 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 4 children. Her husband has been running a general store for past five years.

Naseem's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in suitable position to buy all above these products. Therefore Naseem has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business.
Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more commodities for her husband's for general store.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en: Mrs. Diep is 38 years old, married, and has two children.  She is a hardworking woman that works hard to support her family.  For 5 years now she has operated a shrimp vending business in the market.  She earns additional income from her general store. Diep requested a loan through QBWDF to buy more shrimp to sell to her customers.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shrimp to sell to her customers

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is a young and hardworking woman. She is not married, and she lives with her parents and sister.

Firuza always wanted to start own business deal to get ahead and to be a successful lady. Two years ago, Firuza started her own business of buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She sells fruits and vegetables in a store, which is located in a local market.

Her working day usually begins early because she goes in the early morning and buys fruits and vegetables in bulk from farmers, and during the day she retails them. Now, she plans to increase her working capital, and in this way attract more customers.

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP-UMKM’s clients, Aminah, who is a 51-year-old married woman with two sons. Aminah and her husband have been selling snacks for four years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family's income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Aminah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Zo Finaritra Rijasoa Jonathan

texts.fr: 22 ans, Jonathan est père célibataire, son enfant est avec la mère. Il tient un magasin général pour gagner sa vie il y a maintenant environ 2 ans. Sa mère l'appui dans la gestion du magasin pour le moment. Son désire est de développer et améliorer l'activité: renforcer le fonds de roulement, augmenter les quantités des marchandises et les diversifier. Il voudrait ainsi devenir indépendant et autonome .
texts.en: Jonathan is 22. He is a single father, his child is with his mother. He has been running a grocery store to earn a living for about two years now. His mother helps him manage the store at present. He would like to develop and improve the business: reinforce the working capital, increase the quantity of merchandise, and diversify it. In this way, he would like to become independent and autonomous.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise: pasta, soap, candles, sugar etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 57 years old and lives a simple life with her family in Carles, Iloilo. She is married with four children who are already grown up; some raised their own families.

To earn a living, Teresita runs her own business. She has been running her sari-sari store for five years. With this, she is asking for a larger amount of loan to buy grocery items such as coffee, powdered milk, chocolate drink, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, chips, candies, biscuits, toiletries, and laundry soap. She also will buy a sack of rice for retail.

In the future, she wants to improve her business and make it profitable.

loans.use: to buy coffee, powdered milk, chocolate drink, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, chips, candies, biscuits, toiletries, laundry soap, and rice.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 52-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three sons and husband.

Her husband has been running his own garments and clothes selling business for three years. He is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of uniforms and clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these garments and clothes.

Therefore, Razia is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these garments and clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's garment business.

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa, 23 years old, living with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family. Her eldest son is at the first year at primary school and the younger son is at kindergarten. She wants to borrow a loan to buy learning tools and school fees for her children but she does not have enough money.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her children have good condition for learning, and for herself she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy learning tools and school fees for her children

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Aline is a 23-year-old married mother of one child. Five years ago, she opened an entertainment shop (billiard, fresco, juices, etc..). She is trying to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Aline is an ambitious lady who is working hard to develop her business, thus today, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy an espresso machine to satisfy her customers' needs.
Aline hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy espresso machine to satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime owns a motorcycle shop. He sold motor cycle accessories and parts ranging from  brakes, filters, spark plugs, mirror, lamp, motorcycle cover and brake fluid.  
He is 34-year-old married man with no dependent. He has been engaged in selling motorcycle accessories for a quite period of time.
Together with his wife , he lives in the town of Bilar, Bohol.

He has requested a loan to boost his business. Jaime joined CEVI  to purchase motor accessories like motorcycle lamp, aluminum sprocket, mirror, battery and charger. These will cope with  demands.  Slowly, his income will augment and Jaime could start paying his obligation. He is aiming to set aside some of the profit for future use.

Jaime is hopeful that he will become successful in his project as these could help improve the family's living condition.

He is grateful to KIVA and CEVI.

loans.use: to purchase motor accessories like lamp,aluminum sprocket, mirror, battery and charger

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Johanna, convive con su grupo familiar formado por su compañero de vida y dos hijos de 3 y 6 años de edad, no cuenta con ayuda de remesas familiares, ella se dedica a vender verduras para tener ingresos con los que disminuye las necesidades que existen en su hogar, trabaja de dos a nueve de la mañana, ya tiene experiencia de más de 10 años en el negocio por lo que puede continuar trabajando sin dificultades.
Comprará tomates, jilotes, chiles, repollos, güisquiles, plátanos, etc., pretende tener mayor variedad de verduras para abastecer a sus clientes, tiene mucha fe en que el resultado de la inversión será mayores ventas y ganancias.
Los sueños e ilusiones de Johanna son mejorar su vivienda y darles a su hijos mejores circunstancias de vida.
texts.en:
Johanna lives with her family, which consists of her companion and their two children of three and six years of age. She doesn't receive any financial help from family members outside the country. 

Johanna earns a living selling vegetables in order to have income to pay for necessities in her household.  She works from two to nine am and has more than ten years experience in her business, so she will be able to continue working without difficulties. 

[With the loan] she will buy tomatoes, young corn, chiles, cabbage, chayotes, plantains, and so on. She wants to have a greater variety of produce to meet the needs of her clients. Johanna has faith that the result of her investment will be greater sales and profits. Her dreams and hopes are to improve her house and to provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, young corn, chiles, cabbages, chayote, plantains, and so on, in order to have a greater variety of produce to supply to her clients,

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: In 2013 Sajida started a school to spread education in her local community. With a loan of PKR 100,000 Sajida will be buying some computers for the students to use and construct new rooms to meet the demands of the students hoping to work online, and to meet the spatial needs of the students. Currently there are 71 students in the school with a large proportion being female and in the future Sajida hopes to increase her enrolment and have her students be good, productive citizens.

loans.use: to buy computers for the students to use and construct new rooms to meet the demands of the students hoping to work online, and to meet the spatial needs of the students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise: soap, candles, matches and food.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 38 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a barber shop for past 15 years.

Naseem's husband needs to buy chairs, creams, front mirror and other accessories for his barber shop, but due to financial constraints her husband is not capable to buy these items. Therefore Naseem has applied for Kiva loan. This loan will help her husband to buy the relevant items for his business purpose so that her husband can provide better services to his customers. It will also helpful for her husband to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of his business and family.

For this financial assistance Naseem is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy chairs for her husband's barber business.

loans.name: Aleyda Leonor

texts.es: Aleyda es una comerciante residenciada en la ciudad de Cartagena, en donde vive en compañía de su familia; su cónyuge e hijos. Ella decidió continuar con el negocio de comidas y bebidas de sus padres, quienes se lo cedieron en el año 2000, en el ofrece comida típica y comercializa bebidas y refrescos desde su vivienda, sin embargo, no limita su oferta exclusivamente para sus vecinos y transeúntes, también distribuye a tiendas de barrio y sus ventas se realizan de contado.  Ella desea incrementar sus inventarios para promover mayores ventas, puesto que en ocasiones queda sin productos disponibles, es por ello que para mitigar la situación, está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con los que comprará canastas de cervezas y gaseosas, las cuales son muy consumidas en el último trimestre del año. El sueño de prosperidad de Aleyda es organizar una microempresa de fritos y poder ampliar su cobertura  para atender a muchos más clientes.
texts.en:
Aleyda is a businessperson living in Cartagena with her family: her partner and children. She decided to carry on her parents' food and beverage business, which they gave to her in 2000. 

She sells typical foods, and she also sells alcoholic beverages and soft drinks from her home. She not only sells to neighbors and passers-by, but also to neighborhood stores, on credit.
 
She would like to increase her stock in order to encourage greater sales, but sometimes she doesn't have enough inventory. To address this situation she is applying for a loan. It is her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

She will buy cases of beer and soft drinks, which are very popular the last third of the year. Aleyda's dream of prosperity is to start a small business of fried goods and be able to expand to serve many more customers.

loans.use: to buy baskets of beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, es una persona con espíritu de superación, sola sostiene su hogar, vive con sus tres hijos de 17, 10 y  6 años de edad, su fuente de ingresos es la venta de elotes, tamales y pupusas, todos los días elabora la venta de elotes y tamales, mientras que los días lunes y miércoles también prepara la venta de pupusas en su casa.
Está buscando ayuda con la solicitud de un crédito en Padecomsm para poder comprar específicamente elotes, aceite, quesillo, maíz y leña, contara con materia prima para continuar vendiendo elotes, tamales y pupusas, la finalidad de la inversión es que su negocio siga con vida y sea más rentable.
Los objetivos que desea alcanzar son tener una mejor situación financiera y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
María is someone with the spirit to overcome. She supports her home single-handedly; she lives with her three children ages 17, 10 and 6. Her source of income is the sale of corn, tamales and pupusas (stuffed tortillas). She sells corn and tamales every day, while she also prepares pupusas in her home to sell on Mondays and Wednesdays.

She is seeking help with the request of a loan from Padecomsm to be able to buy corn, oil, cheese and firewood specifically in order to have the raw material to continue selling corn, tamales and pupusas. The purpose of this investment is to make her business more profitable and to ensure that it can continue. The goals she wants to achieve are to have a better financial situation and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, cheese and firewood specifically to continue selling corn, tamales and pupusas

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
ISABEL DIANA, tiene 52 años de edad, ella forma parte del grupo Maria Auxiliadora, que está formado por cinco socios quienes tienen sus pequeños negocios y comparten la meta de lograr la independencia económica haciendo crecer sus negocios.
Isabel Diana se dedica desde hace 8 años aproximadamente a la preparación y venta de chocolates en sus diversas variedades, productos que ofrece a sus amigos y familiares. Paralelamente a ésta actividad vende esporádicamente carne y queso de su lugar de origen Arequipa, cuando tiene oportunidad de traer a Lima para ofrecerlo a sus conocidos.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en una producción mayor de chocolates para lo cual deberá comprar los insumos en mayor cantidad para obtener un precio por mayor y tener un mayor margen de ganancia así como también podrá invertir en las cajitas de presentación de sus chocolates.
En la foto la ubicamos con polo blanco al lado derecho de la fotografía.
texts.en: Isabel Diana is 52 years of age and belongs to the María Auxiliadora group, formed of five members who have small businesses and who share the goal of economic independence by growing their businesses. Isabel Diana has been working for approximately eight years in the preparation and sale of chocolates in their many varieties. These are products she offers to her friends and family. Along with this business, from time to time she sells meat and local cheese from Arequipa when she has the chance to take it to Lima to offer it to people she knows. She will invest the loan in increased production of chocolates, for which she will need to buy a greater quantity of ingredients in order to get a wholesale price and obtain a greater profit margin. She will also be able to invest in presentation boxes for her chocolates. She is the person in the white tee shirt on the right side of the photo.

loans.use: buy ingredients for chocolate making

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.pt:
O Sr Fortunato tem 23 anos de idade, vive em casa dos seus pais. Tem 12a classe, não pode continuar com os estudos porque não tem condições de pagar a faculdade. O seu pai trabalha na desminagem e a sua mãe vende roupa usada.
Como empréstimo vai comprar o equipamento informático para reforçar o equipamento na sua reprografia. Sonha em abrir uma empresa de fornecimento de equipamento informático e, as dificuldades que enfrenta são as financeiras, porém, o desafio é trabalhar mais para pagar o crédito.
texts.en:
Fortunato is 23 years old and lives with his parents. He finished secondary school but was unable to continue his studies because he doesn't have the money to pay for university. anos de idade, vive em casa dos seus pais. His father works cleaning up landmines and his mother sells used clothing.

Fortunato plans to use this loan to buy computer equipment to use improve the equipment in his copy shop. His dream is to open a computer supply store. His biggest hurdles are financial ones, so his goal is to work more to pay off his loan.

loans.use: buy computer equipment to improve the equipment at his copy shop.

loans.name: Nyankwanzi Tweimukye Klezia Group

texts.en: Topista is a committed member of Nyankwanzi Tweimukye Klezia Group.  She is a married woman with 6 children and lives in Kyenjojo Uganda. She has a produce business where she buys and sells a variety of products like maize, beans,  rice and others. To supplement her income, she also farms to sustain her family. She is challenged by seasonality changes and the price fluctuations of produce. Topista’s dream is to become a leading produce dealer in her area with a fully stocked produce store. Therefore Topista, who is guaranteed by members in her group who are working hard towards a common goal of increasing household income, is requesting this loan to buy more produce like maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce like maize to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is a 58-year-old widow, working on her own farm to make a living. She has been doing this since her husband passed away. Banana farming is their main source of income. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farmland nutrients.

loans.name: Felismina

texts.pt:
A senhora Felizmina tem 54 anos de idade, solteira, Vive na casa própria. Sustenta um filho do qual vive com ele.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar produtos da 1a necessidade para revender na sua mercearia, tais como: arroz, peixe, feijão, óleo da cozinha, bolachas, refrigerantes e outros produtos básicos.
A cliente tem como sonho, ter uma loja com todos produtos básicos para satisfazer aos seus clientes
Enfrenta dificuldades financeiras, e a falta de produtos para sua actividade e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar seus objetivos.
texts.en:
Felismina is 54 years old and unmarried. She lives in her own home. She supports one son who lives with her.

She plans to use this loan to purchase staple goods to resell in her shop, such as rice, fish, beans, cooking oil, cookies, perishables, and other basic products.

Her dream is to have a store with a wide variety of products to satisfy her customers' needs.

She has some financial difficulties and struggles with a lack of products for her business. She plans to take out more loans to overcome these challenges and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy rice, fish, beans, cooking oil, cookies, perishables, and other stable goods.

loans.name: Mangoguy Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formó en la ciudad de Curuguaty, una ciudad alejada de la capital del país, eminentemente rural, donde los pobladores tienen poco acceso a ciertos servicios, las integrantes de este grupo se unieron para poder mejorar y crecer por medio del trabajo unido de todas.
La Sra. Melania es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su pequeño trabajo como Modista, quiere capacitarse para poder implementar todo lo que aprenda a su humilde emprendimiento. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se sacrifica para poder mejorar y crecer y por medio de su trabajo poder seguir dando a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros productos en cantidad, para poder seguir con sus confecciones, y de esa forma poder brindar a sus clientes un buen servicio. Agradece por esta oportunidad que todas están recibiendo de poder mejorar.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of Curuguaty, a city that is far from the country's capital and eminently rural, where residents have little access to certain services. The members of this group joined together to be able to be able to improve and grow by means of their joint work.

Melania is one of the members. She has her small business as a fashion designer; she want to have the capacity to be able to implement everything she has learned in her humble work. She is a very hardworking person who strives and sacrifices herself to be able to improve and grow and to be able to keep giving her family a dignified life with no hardships through her work.

She is asking for this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other products wholesale in order to continue with her creations. In this way she will be able to provide her customers with a good service. She is thankful for this opportunity that they are receiving to improve.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other products wholesale

loans.name: Hukumatoy

texts.en: Hukumatoy is a responsible mother of 3 children. She has a higher education and works as a family doctor in a local ambulatory.  She has worked in this field  for more than 12 years. Hukumatoy likes her job and does it with pleasure but her salary is small and so she requires additional income from animal husbandry. She works hard but still her income is not enough. She is ill now and she must reestablish her health. Hukumatoy is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy medicine for her treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her treatment.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a hardworking, married and committed father of five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Alongside his five children, he also takes care of one more child living in his home. He used his previous loan to buy more cows for his farm and still deals in cattle fattening alongside farming to earn extra income. His animals look good and healthy, and the whole farm is promising.  Jackson intends to develop and expand it to a modern animal farm.  He also has the responsibility of looking after his children and paying their school fees. He faces the challenge of inadequate capital on top of the prolonged dry spell to fulfill all of his dreams.  He needs this loan to buy more cows for fattening at his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening at his farm.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 30-year-old married man with 2 children living in Kyenjojo Uganda. He operates a retail shop where he buys and sells a variety of commodities like beer, soda, sugar, soap and salt among others. To supplement his income and sustain his family, he also does farming. He is challenged by inadequate capital to meet his customer demand. Robert’s dream is to become an authorized dealer of beer and soda in his area and to educate his children. He will use the loan to buy more beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Flor Lorena

texts.es:
Flor, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada y su esposo es motorista en una granja, trabaja como transportista de cerdos, junto a su esposo tiene 2 hijos que estudian 7° y 4° grado.

Flor, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, pero aparte de eso también se dedica a vender ropa en un pequeño local, ella decidio trabajar para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.
 
Flor, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para surtir el negocio y obtener buenas ganancias.
 
Los sueños de Flor, son poder hacer que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria y sean profesionales.
texts.en: Flor is 37 years old, completed 9th grade, is married, and her husband is a driver on a farm transporting pigs. She and her husband have 2 children, in 7th and 4th grades. Flor is a housewife, but also sells clothing in a small locale. She decided to work in order to help her husband with the household expenses. Flor needs a loan to buy clothing to stock her business and obtain good profits. Flor dreams of being able to grow her business, and of her children studying at the university and having professional careers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to stock her business and obtain good profits.

loans.name: Eliane Mariano

texts.fr:
39 ans,divorcée, il y a maintenant 8 ans, Éliane est mère de deux enfants de 15 et 18 ans. C'était elle qui demandait la séparation car son ex-mari est très violent, un ivrogne et a des enfants avec d'autres femmes. De ce fait, depuis la séparation, elle avait à élever seule ses deux enfants et devait exploiter une activité source de revenu car auparavant elle était femme au foyer ou ménagère. 
En 2008, elle démarrait une petite gargote avec ses petites économies, et un prêt auprès de CEFOR. Ensuite, elle essayait de développer et étendre petit à petit cette activité au fil du temps. Et maintenant, le magasin est devenu comme ce sur sa photo. C'est une femme très courageuse, travailleuse, débrouillarde ayant de la persévérance. Elle projette ainsi de vendre des friperies devant le magasin, et elle va  en démarrer avec le prêt.
texts.en:
At the age of 39 and divorced for eight years now, Éliane is the mother of two children aged 15 and 18. She is the one who asked for the separation, since her ex-husband is very violent, an alcoholic, and has children with other women. For that reason, since the separation she has had to raise her two children alone and had to find a money-earning business whereas before she stayed at home and kept house.

In 2008 she started a little snack bar with her meager savings and a loan from CEFOR. Then she tried to develop and expand this business little by little, day after day. And now her shop has developed into what you see in the photo.

Éliane is a courageous, hard-working and resourceful woman with perseverance. She plans to sell used clothing as well, in front of the shop and she will start that with the loan.

loans.use: to buy some sacks of rice, refills, soft drinks, and used clothing

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Emprendedoras 2 está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, se formaron en la ciudad de Itá, ellas están poniendo su mayor entusiasmo para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirta quien se dedica a una cantina cerca de su casa, ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación económica.
La Sra. Mirta solicita de este préstamo para la compra de los ingredientes para la elaboración de empanadas, sándwich, compra de jugos entre otros, para poder surtir con su cantina, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Las Emprendedoras 2" group is in its sixth cycle of the women's committee program. It was formed in the city of Itá. The members are offering their best enthusiasm to grow and improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

One of the members is Mirta, who makes a living with a cantina business near her home. By means of continuous effort and work, and applying vital advice from a successful woman, she is improving her financial situation.

Mirta is asking for this loan to buy the ingredients to make empanadas and sandwiches and to buy juices, among other items, to be able to continue with her cantina. In this way she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been. She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make empanadas and sandwiches and to buy juices, among other items, to be able to stock her cantina

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric to use in clothes making.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra formado en la ciudad de Asunción, están en el ciclo 24 del programa de comité de mujeres, cada una está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
La señora Basilia es una de ellas, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas, comenta que por medio de su trabajo se gana la vida y tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Ella comenta que sus ventas han mejorado mucho ya que las prendas usadas son más solicitadas y tiene cada vez más pedidos y le ha permitido mejorar mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas usadas para la venta, para que de esa forma pueda seguir dando a sus clientes la buena variedad a la que están acostumbrados. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
This committee formed in the city of Asunción. They are in the 24th cycle of the women's program and each one of them is putting in her greatest effort to be able to improve her living standards and those of her loved ones.

Señora Basila is one member of this group. She works in the sale of used clothing and says that by virtue of her work, she earns a living and has the means to be able to help her loved ones. She says that her sales have improved a lot since used items of clothing are requested more often these days. She has more and more orders and this has allowed her to improve a lot. She is asking for this loan to be able to purchase used items of clothing for sale so that she can continue giving her clients the good variety to which they are accustomed. The members of the group are grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, pero debido a la guerra no pudo continuar, pues era una zona bastante azotada por el conflicto.- Cuando cumplió 20 años de edad se acompaño y ahora es padre de seis hijos, tres varones y tres niñas, de los cuales los tres menores estudian el nivel básico en la comunidad, mientras su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar cerdos y aves de corral.

Francisco, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol y maicillo, además trabaja en la siembra de hortalizas en la comunidad, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió gracias a las capacitación técnica a las cuales asistió en la ciudad.- Actualmente tiene 3,500 metros cuadrados de cultivo de frijol y maíz y sus hijos le ayudan en los trabajos agrícolas.

Francisco, necesita el crédito para comprar dos quintales de abono y otros productos para el mantenimiento del cultivo de maíz y frijol; de esa manera pretende obtener mejores cosechas.

Francisco, sueña con construir su casa de adobe, para vivir en mejores condiciones.- Además espera seguir sembrando hortalizas porque es bastante rentable y sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales y que puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is 54 years old, completed 4th grade, but due to the war he couldn't continue in school as it was an area greatly affected by the conflict. When he turned 20 years old he got married and now is the father of 6 children: 3 boys and 3 girls, of which the 3 youngest are in a school in the community. His spouse is a housewife and takes care of the pigs and barnyard fowl.
