Francisco works growing corn and beans. In addition he works planting crops in his community. He learned everything he knows thanks to technical training he attended in his city. Today he has 3500 square meters of beans and corn and his sons help him with the farming chores.

Francisco needs a loan to buy 2 quintales of manure and other products to support the growing of corn and beans. In this way he will be able to obtain better harvests.

Francisco dreams of building an adobe house in order to have better living conditions. In addition he hopes to continue planting crops because it is rather profitable and he dreams of seeing his children become professionals so that they can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 2 quintales of manure and other products to support the growing of corn and beans.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres De San Bartolo Group

texts.es: Dúo Mujeres de San Bartolo Este dúo está formado por doña María Llanuaria, ella tiene 64 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de orquídeas, flores, venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado la terminal de Guatemala y los fines de semana en el mercado la cuchilla de San Bartolomé Milpas Altas, desde ya hace varios años, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de frutas así como orquídeas para surtir su negocio, su mayor deseo es seguir adelante con sus negocios porque es de ahí donde ella ha logrado que sus hijos estén estudiando y ella desea lo mejor para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The group, Women's Duo of Eastern San Bartolo, was organized by Mrs. Maria Llanuaria, who is 64 years old and dedicated to selling orchids, flowers, fruit, and vegetables in "The Terminal of Guatemala" market, and on weekends, in "The Kitchen Knife" market in San Bartolome Milpas Altas.

For various years, she has been requesting loans to invest in the purchase of fruits and orchids to resupply her business.

Maria Llanuaria's greatest desire is to continue ahead with her businesses, since this is the means whereby she has provided for her children to pursue their studies, and she wishes the best for her children.

loans.use: purchase fruit and orchids to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.fr: Agée de 36 ans, Gladys est une femme divorcée qui vit à Tokoin. Ayant un enfant à charge, Gladys est une revendeuse des serviettes de friperies qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Gladys désire ce crédit pour commander des unités de serviettes et de draps en vue de bien vendre puis d’avoir des gains et pouvoir prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et de payer les frais scolaire de son enfant dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en: Gladys is 36 years old, divorced, and she lives in Tokoin.  She has one child under her care.  She makes a living by buying and selling used towels.  She buys her merchandise three times per month at the market and she resells as an itinerant seller, in the surrounding neighborhoods.  Gladys is taking this loan to buy some towels and sheets.  Her goal is to increase her sales and her income, so that she can cover her family's daily expenses as well as her child's school fees starting next school year.

loans.use: to buy 10 towels and 12 sets of sheets.

loans.name: Chapa Kazi Mwanangu Group

texts.fr: Dans le but d'entretenir convenablement son champ de café et d'accroitre sa production, Japhet sollicite un deuxième crédit. Il reconnaît les bienfaits du précédent car il a lui permis d'agrandir son étendue culturale et de résoudre tant soit peu ses problèmes quoique les oiseaux ravageurs et l'insuffisance des eaux dans le canal d'irrigation ont été ses obstacles majeurs.
texts.en: In order to properly maintain his coffee field and increase its production, Japhet is requesting a second loan. He recognizes the benefits of the previous loan because it allowed him to expand his coffee field and solve some of his problems, even though bird pests and water shortage in the irrigation canal were major obstacles for him.

loans.use: Sarclage, achat produits phytosanitaires et engrais.

loans.name: Raharison

texts.fr: 39 ans, marié, Raharison est un père de famille débrouillard. Sa femme travaille dans une entreprise de zone franche. Le couple a deux enfants de 4 et 10 ans dont tous scolarisés. Il a plusieurs spécialités, il est à la fois dépanneur en électronique et électricien. L'activité, objet de sa demande de crédit est la production des briques. Cela fait deux ans qu'il exploite cette activité. Il est déjà très connu dans ce domaine car il a déjà beaucoup de commande en ce moment, son problème est l'insuffisance de fonds à utiliser pour pouvoir augmenter les quantités des briques à produire.
texts.en:
39 years old, married, Raharison is a resourceful family man. His wife works in a free zone company. The couple has two children, 4 and 10 years old, who both attend school.

Raharison has many specialties, he is both an electronics repairman and an electrician. The activity which is the purpose of his loan request is the production of bricks. He has been exploiting this activity for two years now. He is already well-known in this area as he already has many orders at the moment, his problem is the insufficiency of funds to use to be able to increase the quantities of bricks to produce.

loans.use: to buy two carts of bales and to pay the rice field rents in order to increase the production of his brick making business

loans.name: Ida. S

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP-UMKM’s clients, Ida, who is a 43-year-old married woman with two sons and one daughter. Ida is a merchant and her husband has been an employee for five years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Ida will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Farruh

texts.en:
Farruh is a kind and hardworking man. He is married and has a child.

He has been a welder for more than five years. He does his job well and has regular customers. He is the only feeder and keeper of his family, as his wife is a housewife.

Farruh now needs financial support because his little son is ill and he must treat him, but Farruh has no money. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy medicines for treatment of his lovely son.

Farruh and his son await your generosity.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment of his son

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es:
Brenda es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 2 años, y su negocio es la panadería. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, área caracterizada por acoger a la mayor parte de la población.
Brenda es morena de cabello negro y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer y con su hijo que ya sabe caminar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la panadería tradicional y hornea panes como; el Cuñapé (Pequeño bollo hecho de harina de yuca con queso), Empanada de arroz (Horneado de arroz y queso), Bizcochos de trigo (Bollitos duros de harina de trigo), Arepas (Panqueques de harina de maíz mezclados con queso y fritos) y otros, “Lo que cocinamos y comemos, identifica dónde nacimos y es muy especial para mí…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que la panadería tradicional es muy popular, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar insumos de panadería. Su sueño es tener una panadería grande en su misma casa, ella desea comprar harina de yuca, maíz, aceite y otros insumos para su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Brenda solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de panadería para hornear pan tradicional.
texts.en:
Brenda is a 19 year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has a 2 year-old son. She is a baker. She is a good mother, enterprising and reliable. Her business is in the southern part of the city, an area that has the greatest concentration of the city's population. 

Brenda is dark skinned, with black hair and a robust physique. Her native tongue is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner, who works as a driver, and her son, who already knows how to walk. They live in a rented brick room with all of the basic services. 

Her business is traditional baking and she bakes breads such as Cuñapé (little rolls made with yuca flour and cheese), Empanada de arroz (a baked good with rice and cheese), Bizcochos de trigo (little hard rolls made with wheat flour), Arepas (flour and corn cakes mixed with cheese and then fried) and others. "What we cook and eat shows where we're from, and that is very special to me...", she says. An advantage for her business is that traditional baked goods are very popular, but her disadvantage is that she does not have enough money to buy baking supplies. 

Her dream is to have a large bakery in her own home. She would like to buy yuca flour, corn, oil and other supplies for her business. 

This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the year that she has been doing this. This is why Brenda is seeking a loan to buy supplies for her traditional baked goods.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies to bake traditional breads.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is a 37-year-old farmer. She owns rice paddies and grows rice. She resides in Carmen, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 4, 5 and 6 years old respectively.
Aside from farming, she raises and sells hogs. Her husband has also an income to help defray the family's daily expenses.

For quite a period of time she has been catering mostly to neighbors and local settlers in her neighborhood. She faces challenges in her livelihood, such as the lack of capital and the high cost of farm maintenance. Virgilia has decided to avail the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer and pig feed. 

This way, it could help her boost and improve the yield of her farm. It will enable her to provide for her family needs and continue to expand her farm to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.name: Mujeres Campesinas Group

texts.es:
El Estado de México se caracteriza por tener comunidades muy tranquilas, llenas de vegetación y habitadas por personas amables y trabajadoras. La mayoría  de la población se dedica a al cultivo de maíz y la cría de animales como ovejas, becerros, gallinas, pavos, etc. Mujeres Campesinas es un grupo formado dentro de la región que cuenta con raíces en la cultura mazahua sus integrantes conservan la lengua materna, las tradiciones y las fiestas populares. De igual modo, han generado un lazo de amistad que las une desde que eran muy pequeñas. 
   Doña Gregoria es una mujer orgullosa de sus raíces, es amable ya que nunca deja de sonreír además de ser muy trabajadora. Ha vivido a lado de su esposo Don Gerardo por más de 44 años y juntos formaron una familia con 12 hijos de los cuales cuatro aun dependen de la pareja y uno estudia artes actualmente. Se dedica a criar ovejas, pollos y pavos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar. Todos los días, cuida de todos los animales para que alcancen su desarrollo mientras que su esposo se gana el sustento trabajando como chofer de maquinaria pesada. “Crecí en el campo, desde pequeña aprendí a cuidar de los animales pues mis padres así me lo inculcaron. Ahora tengo una familia y esta es una manera de apoyar económicamente a mi esposo” comenta con entusiasmo Gregoria quien cuenta con 43 años de experiencia en su labor. 
   Cabe mencionar que está muy agradecida con  VFMéxico porque con su apoyo pudo construir 40 corrales, y agrega “mis hijos eran muy pequeños, todos estudiaban y los gastos eran demasiado, pero con el préstamo podíamos generar más ingresos". Con esta nueva oportunidad podrá comprar más borregos y pollos. Su más grande sueño es que su hija cumpla su meta de ser bailarina profesional para lo cual se prepara en una escuela de Bellas Artes.
Las integrantes del grupo son Ma Francisca, Maria, Ma Asuncion invertirán en pollos y borregos, Epifania en pavos, Ma Guadalupe y Guadalupe solo en pollos.
 *La fotografía fue tomada cerca del quiosco en el centro del municipio de los clientes, Doña Gregoria es quien tiene el suéter rojo*
texts.en:
The State of Mexico is characterised by its leafy, peaceful communities inhabited by very friendly, hard-working people. The majority of the population makes a living growing corn and raising animals such as sheep, calves, hens, turkeys, etc. Mujeres Campesinas is a group from the region with its roots in the Mazahua culture. Its members continue to use their native language, traditions and festivals. The members have known each other since childhood and are united by a strong friendship.

Gregoria is proud of her roots. She is kind, with a smile never leaving her face, and she is very hardworking. She has lived alongside her husband, Don Gerardo, for over 44 years and together, they have 12 children, four of whom still depend on them and one of whom is currently studying art. Gregoria makes a living raising sheep, chickens and turkeys to pay for her household expenses. Everyday, she looks after all the animals so that they grow, while her husband earns a living as a heavy machinery driver.

“I grew up in the countryside, from a young age I learned to look after animals as my parents instilled this knowledge in me. Now, I have a family and this is a way to support my husband financially” Gregoria says enthusiastically. She has 43 years' experience in her work.

It should be noted that she is very grateful to VF México because with its support, she was able to build 40 pens. She adds, “my children were very young, they were all studying and we had toom any outgoings. But the loan allowed us to increase our earnings.” With this new opportunity, she will be able to buy more sheep and chickens. Her biggest dream is for her daughter to achieve her goal of becoming a professional dancer. She is currently training in a school of fine arts.

The other group members are Maríá Francisca, Maria, and Ma Asuncion, who will invest in chickens and sheep, Epifania who will buy turkeys, and María Guadalupe and Guadalupe, who will buy chickens.

The above photo was taken near the pavilion in the centre of the clients' town. Gregoria is wearing the red sweater.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and chicken.

location.town: Dios Padre, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a 27 year old retail shop proprietor at Voi Kenya. She is a mother of three whose spouse provides with additional income and has been in this business for the last three years with a good income.

This is her second loan from VisionFund to finance her business after paying the previous one successfully, she will use the loan to purchase cooking fat, tea leaves, sugar, wheat and maize flour, loaves of bread and milk and the anticipated profit to repay her loan. she hopes to purchase a piece of land in future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, tea leaves, sugar, wheat and maize flour, loaves of bread and milk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30 year old charcoal dealer at Voi Kenya. She is a mother of three children and has been in this business for the last five years doing well with the husbands support.

This is her third loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business after paying the previous loans successfully, she will use the loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She hopes to open a grocery in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, de 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a la guerra que sufrió el país, creció con sus padres trabajando en la agricultura, se casó cuando tenía 20 años de edad y ahora es padre de tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad y tienen sus propias familias y de él solo depende un nieto.

Francisco, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol y maicillo, pero también se dedica a la crianza de especies menores como cerdos y aves de corral; todo lo relacionado a los trabajos agrícolas lo aprendió desde joven, porque tenía que ayudar a sus padres a la siembra de granos básicos.- Ahora, tiene 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol, las cuales trabaja en las faldas de la montaña, en donde camina aproximadamente 45 minutos hasta llegar a sus cultivos para cuidarlos y darles mantenimiento.

Francisco, necesita el préstamo para comprar 6 quintales de abono, para pagar mano de obra, comprar productos foliares y pagar el alquiler de la tierra, para que tengan un buen desarrollo y por ende obtener buenas cosechas.  

Francisco, sueña con seguir trabajando la tierra para obtener el alimento para su familia, y también sueña mejorar poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en:
Francisco is 54 years old and didn't have the opportunity to go to school because of the war in his country. He grew up farming with his parents. He married at 20 years of age and now is the father of 3 grown children who have their own families. Only one grandson is dependent upon him.

Francisco grows corn and beans, but also raises small animals such as pigs and farmyard fowl. All his related agricultural practices he learned by helping his parents with the farm. Now he has 3500 square meters of corn and beans at the edges of the mountain. He walks about 45 minutes to arrive to his fields in order to take care of them and give them maintenance.

Francisco needs a loan to buy 6 quintales of manure, pay for labor, buy herbicide, and pay land rental fees. This will results in good development and subsequently good harvests.

Francisco dreams of continuing farming in order to provide his family food, and also dreams of improving his home little by little.

loans.use: to buy 6 quintales of manure, pay for labor, buy herbicide, and pay land rental fees.

loans.name: Mujeres Valerosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Valerosas; ya que ellas tuvieron el valor de juntarse y por medio del trabajo en conjunto poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Están en su cuarto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, esforzándose por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 
Todas las integrantes de este grupo ponen su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante, pero una de las que se destaca es la Sra. Irma, quien hace ella misma comidas todos los días desde muy temprano en la mañana, y después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Comenta que por medio de su trabajo da a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser: verduras, carnes, hortalizas, pollo y otros, y de esa manera poder seguir deleitando  a sus clientes con las delicias que hace.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Valerosas (Brave Women), as they all had the courage to get together, get ahead and help their families by means of their joint work. They are in their fourth cycle of the women's committee program, striving to be able to improve their living conditions. 

All of the members of this group make their best effort to be able to grow and get ahead, but one member who stands out is Irma, who makes food by herself every day of the week, very early in the morning, and then goes out to sell it in itinerant fashion. She says that by means of her work, she is able to give her loved ones what she couldn't have herself.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in buying supplies to make her foods, such as vegetables, beef, chicken, and other items. In this way she will be able to keep delighting her customers with the delicious food she makes.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food such as vegetables, beef, chicken, and other items

loans.name: Clarice's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 16 Juillet 2012 à l’occasion de son inauguration, il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Madame Clarice, âgée de 36 ans (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est marié et mère  de 02 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de patte d’arachide de poulets de chaussures et accessoires pour femmes. Elle s’approvisionne à Dakar et dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 05 seaux de patte d’arachide de 25 kg à 15000f et les 125000f restant elle va acheter des chaussures des accessoires pour femme pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et payer la scolarité, et soins médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Since the 16th of July, 2012 on the date of inception, there has been a good connection between the group members. Small business is their main activity. 

Madame Clarice, 36 years old (sitting on the far right with a hand raised), is the star borrower of the group. She is married and mother of 2 children. She is involved in the selling of peanut paste, chickens, shoes and women's accessories. She gets her supplies from Dakar and at the weekly markets. With her new loan, she hopes to purchase 5 buckets of peanut paste at 15000 francs for 25 kg and with the 125000 francs remaining she is going to buy shoes and accessories for women to re-sell for retail in her neighborhood. The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions and pay for her children's schooling and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy five 25kg buckets of peanut paste, as well as shoes and accessories with the remainder of the loan

loans.name: Benadeta

texts.en:
Benadeta, who is in her early 30's, is single with two kids who are still at school. She has been running two projects, a genge (general store) and chip-selling, for four years now. She works from 8 AM to 12 PM daily and is able to earn a good profit each month.

This will be Benadeta's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal for cooking. She dreams of being a big business woman.

Benadeta will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Transito

texts.es: Transito de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y su madre, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre busca la manera de poder salir adelante con su familia, desde hace 20 años tomo la decision de poner un negocio de venta de ropa el cual ubico en su lugar de residencia y es asi como ha podido solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella quiere aumentar su mercaderia pero con sus ganancias no le alcanza para surtir su negocio por esa razon esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Transito is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter and her mother. She is a very hardworking woman who always finds a way to move forward with her family. 20 years ago, she made the decision to set up a business selling clothing in her home. This is how she pays her household expenses.

Transito wants to increase her inventory. However, her earnings are not high enough to allow her to restock her business, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale clothing and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Ñanduti Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras, están en su ciclo número 11 del programa de comités, a la vez están trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza que les permitirá poder conocer su situación de vida, y conforme a ello poder esforzarse por crecer y mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Eloisa, una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas variadas, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Comenta que le va cada vez mejor ya que se ha hecho ya de muy buena clientela que le es de mucha ayuda para poder mejorar su negocio. Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su vida, y a través de su trabajo darles lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser jeans, camisas, remeras, pantalones, polleras y otros, y así tener una mejor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Seventeen women comprise this group, they united to help each other out. This is their eleventh loan cycle. They are also working within a program to eradicate poverty, which will let them understand their situation, and make appropriate efforts to develop and improve their circumstances.

One of the members is Eloisa. She is a very hardworking person, and sells clothing for ladies, men and children. She says her business is going better and better, since she has an established customer base which is very helpful as she tries to grow the business. She is grateful for this opportunity to improve her life, and through her work give them what she was unable to have.

She is asking for this loan to buy articles of clothing to sell, such as jeans, shirts, T-shirts, pants, skirts and more, and have a wider selection to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale, such as jeans, shirts, T-shirts, pants, skirts and more.

loans.name: Raktaaj

texts.en:
Raktaaj is an active borrower from BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 60 years old and a mother of six children. Her husband has been working as a wood carpenter for 12 years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Raktaaj's husband wants to buy pieces of wood and other tools for his furniture business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, he cannot afford to buy these supplies.

Therefore Raktaaj has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband can purchase the relevant items for his business purpose and earn a profitable income to meet the daily needs of the family and business.

Raktaaj is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy wood for  her husband's furniture making business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace 3 años y es asi como ha podido salir adelante con sus gastos y los de su hogar, su esposo tambien le ayuda con los gastos, la joven vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de maiz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejor ingresos economicos.
texts.en: The young woman whose face is pixelated in the photo is 29 years old.  She lives in a high risk area.  She has worked making and selling tortillas for 3 years, and this is how she has been able to move forward with her expenses and those of the household.  Her husband also helps with the expenses.  She lives in her own home with her two children and her husband.  She is requesting a loan to buy "quintales" of corn [a quintal is a regional measurement of approximately 100 pounds] and lime powder in order to be able to continue with her sales and thus improve her economic income.

loans.use: to buy "quintales" of corn [a quintal is a regional measurement of approximately 100 pounds] and lime powder

loans.name: Sale

texts.en:
Sale is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Sale would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sale will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare, Sale now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Maria de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, desde hace 2 años posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia y es gracias a ese trabajo como ha podido salir adelante, anteriormente solicito un credito para mejorar su vivienda, hoy esta solicitando nuevamente un credito pero en esta ocasion es para la compra de mercaderia como sopas, huevos, granos basicos, refrescos entre otras cosas todo por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is sixty-five, she lives in her own house with her husband. For two years she has owned a small store run out of her home, and thanks to this work she has been able to get ahead. Previously she requested a loan for home improvements. Now she is requesting a new loan, but now it is to purchase merchandise such as soups, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, and other items, all at wholesale, so she can increase her profits and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as soups, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks and other items, all at wholesale.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a Babban Gona farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan, Haruna can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Haruna has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare.

Haruna is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to provide healthcare for his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Glenda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Glenda, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, se casó cuando tenía 18 años de edad, su esposo se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura y juntos tienen dos hijos que estudian nivel básico en la comunidad.

Glenda, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace aproximadamente ocho años, inicio este pequeño negocio porque no habían tiendas de productos de primera necesidad cerca de la comunidad y las personas tenían que caminar una larga distancia; pero a parte de eso también tiene un pequeño molino de nixtamal, con el cual brinda servicio a la comunidad y también se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol.

Glenda, necesita el préstamo para comprar cuatro quintales de abono, pagar mano de obra e invertir en la tienda para aumentar su inventario y así poder tener más ofertas a sus clientes y el resto del dinero lo necesita para arreglar el molino y poder garantizar un mejor servicio de calidad. 

Glenda, sueña con mejorar su vivienda porque es de adobe y no es muy segura debido a las lluvias las cuales van lavando las paredes de la casa, y seguir siempre apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios para que se superen y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Glenda is 33 years old and left school after getting her high school diploma. She married at the age of 18. Her husband works in agriculture and they have two children who attend the local primary school.

Glenda has had a small store for around eight years. She set up this small business because there were no nearby grocery stores in the community and people had to walk a long way to reach one. She also has a small tortilla corn mill which she rents out to the community and grows basic grains such as corn and beans.

Glenda needs the loan to buy four quintales of compost, pay for labour and invest in her store to increase her stock, so that she can offer a wider range of products to her customers. She needs the remainder of the money to fix her mill and ensure a higher quality service.

Glenda dreams of making improvements to her home, because it is made of abode and isn't very secure as a result of the rains, which wash away the walls. She also wants to continue to always support her children in their studies so that they succeed and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy four quintales of compost, pay for labour and invest in her store to increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 2 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman whose face is pixilated in the photo is twenty-seven, she lives in a high-risk area. For two years she has been selling personal care products. It is a home-based business, and she goes out to sell in surrounding neighborhoods. With her earnings she is able to pay some of the household expenses. She lives in her own home with her husband. She is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorant etc. all at wholesale, so she can continue with her work and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorant etc. all at wholesale.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La Sra Maribel : Tiene 49 años de edad, , vive en Trojes,  el paraíso, al oriente de Honduras, actualmente convive con la hermana de su esposo, es una mujer emprendedora, su actividad principal es el comercio, cuenta con una pequeña pulperia en donde desde tempranas horas del dia brinda los productos de la canasta basica a las personas de dicha comunidad.
  La Sra Maribel cuenta con varios productos dentro de su negocio como ser: Azucar, arros, manteca, maseca, harina,jabon, avena, papel higienico, sardinas, machetes, focos de manos entre otros productos; con el credito que nos ha solicitado podra surtir mas su negocio y asi cumplir con la demanda de productos de sus clientes.
Su sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia.

Trojes, Honduras- Septiembre 2015.
texts.en:
Maribel is 49 years old and lives in Trojes, the paradise in eastern Honduras. She is currently living with her husband's sister. She is an enterprising woman; her primary business is retail. She has a small grocery store where she provides staple products to the people in her community from early in the day.

Maribel has various products in her business, like sugar, rice, butter, corn flour, wheat flour, soap, oatmeal, toilet paper, sardines, machetes, and handheld flashlights, among other products. With the loan she has asked us for, she will be able to stock her business more and thus meet her customers' demands for products.

Her dream is to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Trojes, Honduras- September 2015.

loans.use: to stock her business more and thus meet her customers' demands for products.

loans.name: Mrike

texts.en:
Mrike, who is in the photograph with her 20-year-old daughter, Elda, is a married mother of four children, with the youngest one being 9.

The oldest, 24, finished a nursing degree and is waiting to be appointed in her field. Elda is going to take professional schooling in hair/aesthetics and she is supposed to stay in the capital city while she is studying. This is what the money will be used for.

Their family lives in a little town, where Mrike has been working as a janitor for a minimum pay of $175/month and her husband working as a prison guard for a monthly pay of $374.

"The money we've been making from our jobs, is merely enough because we have to feed four children. And living in a town, where you can't practice agriculture at all, it is more difficult because you've got to buy everything you need to eat."

loans.use: to pay the tuition and dormitory fees of her daughter.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 45 años de edad, está casada, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos trabajan y su hija le ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar, mientras su esposo se dedica a trabajar en una finca.

Rosa, se dedica a atender los clientes que le visitan en su tienda, desde hace 29 años coloco su tienda y de esa manera genera los ingresos suficientes para cubrir algunas necesidades de su hogar, también con las ganancias que obtiene ha construido un poco más grande su casa, aunque es de adobe pero es para lo único que ha alcanzado.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más productos a su tienda como jabón, pan, café, arroz, azúcar, entre otros, pues considera que entre más surtida este más vende y las ganancias serán mejores.

Rosa, sueña con hacer su casa de bloque y hacer un cafetín a la orilla de la calle principal en el lugar más adecuado para que su negocio mejore, también tiene planeado comprar fincas para que su esposo trabaje propio y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old, married, has 3 children, two of whom work and her daughter helps her with the chores around the home. Her husband works on a ranch. Rosa attends to the customers who come to her store. She has had a store for 29 years and in this way generates enough income to cover some basic household necessities. Also with the profits she has made her home bigger, even though it is made of adobe she has been able to do it.

The loan she needs will be used to buy products for her store such as soap, bread, coffee, rice, sugar, and other items. She believes that the better stocked her store is, the more she sells and the profits greater.

Rosa dreams of having a cement block home and a snack bar on a main street in a larger space so that her business improves. She has has planned to buy farms so that her husband has his own lands and thus improve the living conditions of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy products for her store such as soap, bread, coffee, rice, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Yau

texts.en:
Yau is a Babban Gona farmer. Yau is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Yau would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan Yau can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Yau has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Yau is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to provide healthcare for his family and children, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a maize farmer from Pampaida Dutse village. As a Babban Gona member, Lawal is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Lawal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Lawal will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Lawal no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Lawal hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bala

With the help of this loan, Bala can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Bala will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Bala is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

Abdulrahaman is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Yahuza now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members, and would like to use this additional income to build a house for his family.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Sani has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Sani is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to improve his farming skills and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike and put into his business.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Los Emprendedores De Juan Pablo Group

texts.es:
ANGELICA JULIA tiene 40 años de edad, tiene cinco hijos de los cuales tres son mayores de edad e independientes, ahora su motor y motivo son sus dos pequeños hijos de 10 y 6 años quienes son estudiantes y es por ellos que ella se esfuerza y trabaja mucho para poder brindarles lo necesario.
Aproximadamente desde hace seis años se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, gracias a su sazón ella ha logrado desarrollarse en ésta actividad y le permite tener muchos clientes que se van recomendando entre si. Esta actividad la realiza en su propio domicilio y así no descuida a sus pequeños hijos. Manifiesta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado ya que se empieza desde muy temprano pero que a la vez vale la pena porque gracias a ello puede mantener a sus hijos.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes para la preparación de sus platos de comida.
texts.en:
Angelica Julia is 40 years old. She has five children, of whom three are independent adults. Now, her driving force and motivation are the two younger children who are 10 and 6 years old. They are in school and it is for them that she puts in so much effort and works so hard to be able to provide them with what they need.

For approximately six years she has worked preparing and selling meals. Thanks to the flavor of the meals, she has succeeded in developing this occupation and it has allowed her to have many customers who recommend her. She does this work in her own home and thus can care for her young children at the same time. She expresses that it is demanding work since she begins very early, but at the same time it is worth it since it is thanks to this work that she can support her children.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients for the preparation of her meals.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of supplies and ingredients for making meals

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 39-year-old single lady. Twenty-three years ago, she got employed in a company with a limited salary to cover her needs and expenses. She is an ambitious and independent lady who is well-known among her colleagues for her hardworking and good performance.

Although Lina is trying desperately to develop her career skills, her salary is still not enough to cover any additional expenses. Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to legally register her car, which will facilitate her life and allow her to reach work easily.

loans.use: to legally register her car, which will facilitate her life.

loans.name: Antonia María

texts.es: Antonia de 42 años es habitante de Arjona y en este municipio del departamento de Bolívar se consolida su clientela, conformada principalmente por sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, quienes siempre la han apoyado en su actividad comercial de venta de mercancías por intermedio catálogos especializados. Esta emprendedora mujer juega varios roles en su vida: esposa, madre y empresaria, y ha logrado mantener un equilibrio entre ellos, diariamente realiza sus labores en el hogar y vela por la crianza de su único hijo un adolecente de 14 años de edad, así mismo aprovecha sus espacios de tiempo libre para llegar a cada una de las residencias de sus clientes y promocionarles por intermedio de la oferta del catálogo: cremas corporales, colonias, desodorantes, cosméticos y toda una amplia línea de productos de aseo personal. Ella desea incrementar el stock de estos productos y para ello está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para llevar a cabo esta inversión. Antonia tiene metas claras para su vida, ella desea tener un almacén en un local y adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Antonia, 42 years old, is an inhabitant of Arjona and in this municipality of Bolivar department, her clientele is consolidated, mainly made up of her neighbors, friends and family, who have always supported her in her business activity of selling merchandise through specialized catalogs. This female entrepreneur plays various roles in her life: wife, mother and business owner, and she's achieved maintaining an equilibrium among them. Daily, she does her work in the home and looks after the raising of her only son, a 14 year old adolescent.

At the same time, she takes advantage of her spaces of free time to arrive at each one of the residences of her clients and promote offers to them through the catalog : body creams, colognes, deodorants, cosmetics and an ample line of personal toiletry products. She wishes to increase the stock of these products and for that, she is applying for a loan request, her first Kiva loan that she does from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to carry out this investment. Antonia has clear goals for her life, she wishes to have a shop in a storefront and acquire her own house.

loans.use: to increase the stock of these products: body creams, colognes, deodorants, cosmetics and an ample line of personal toiletry products.

loans.name: Novy Carla

texts.en:
Novy Carla is a resident of Estancia, Iloilo. She is a 38-year-old woman, married and blessed with two daughters. The oldest child is nine years old and the youngest child is two years old.

Her husband works hard to provide for their needs, and she helps her husband by selling snacks to the community. For this, she is requesting a loan to buy food ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, and sugar. She will also buy drinks, chips and biscuits.

In the future, she wishes to increase her livelihood by doing other business to add her earnings so she could have enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, and sugar, and other food such as drinks, chips and biscuits.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, de 44 años de edad, es un agricultor que se dedica a las practicas agropecuaria y por motivos de tiempo no pudo asistir a la escuela; actualmente está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a la elaboración de petates, actividad que le genera ingresos para los gastos de su hogar, con su pareja tiene solo un hijo, pero junto a ellos viven 2 hijatros que ayudan a trabajar  porque ya son mayores de edad.

Pedro, se dedica a trabajar la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, esta labor es su fuente principal de ingresos para su hogar y así sobreviven.

Pedro, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar maíz y para pagar mano de obra para el mantenimiento del cultivo.

El sueño de Pedro, es comercializar los granos básicos en grandes cantidades, para mejorar su calidad de vida y así poder brindarles más apoyo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pedro, forty-four, is a farmer who raises crops and tends livestock. He did not have time to go to school; he has a partner, she makes handwoven mats, which generates some income to cover some household expenses. They have one child together, but two step-children live with them and help out working since they are adults. Pedro has been working in agriculture for quite some time, that is his principal source of income for his household and that is how they earn their living. Pedro needs the loan to buy supplies for planting corn and to pay the cost of labor to tend to his crop. Pedro's dream is to sell basic grains on a large scale, to improve his quality of life and to better provide for his children.

Pedro, se dedica a trabajar la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, esta labor es su fuente principal de ingresos para su hogar y así sobreviven.



Pedro, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar maíz y para pagar mano de obra para el mantenimiento del cultivo.



El sueño de Pedro, es comercializar los granos básicos en grandes cantidades, para mejorar su calidad de vida y así poder brindarles más apoyo a sus hijos.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for planting corn and to pay for labor costs for tending his crop.

loans.name: Edgar Leonel

texts.es:
Edgar Leonel está casado con Rosario Nairy con quien tiene una bebe de 3 meses de edad, Edgar Leonel se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la producción de café y productos de hortaliza dejar tiene como objetivo a corto plazo hacer que sus fuentes de ingreso sean diversas y no depender solamente de las ventas de café como es actualmente. 
Edgar quiere iniciar un proyecto para la producción de tomates orgánicos bajo invernadero el producto cosechado lo comercializara por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, este proyecto es muy novedoso ya que el cultivo de tomate deja muy buenas ganancias además de ayudar a las personas a cultivar parte de sus alimentos.
Actualmente Edgar solicita un crédito para iniciar los trabajos en su invernadero y así iniciar la producción lo más pronto que sea posible, con las ganancias obtenidas por el producto vendido Edgar espera tener ingresos para formar un ahorro para la educación de su hija y también invertir para formar un patrimonio para su familia. 
Un crédito ayudara a Edgar para diversificar sus ingresos y no depender totalmente de sus ingresos por café de esta manera asegura que su familia siempre tendrá lo necesario.
texts.en:
Edgar Leonel is married to Rosario Nairy, with whom he has a 3 month old baby. Edgar Leonel makes a living in agriculture, particularly in coffee and vegetable production. He short term goal is to diversify his income streams, and not rely solely on coffee sales, as he currently does.

Edgar wants to start a business producing organic tomatoes in greenhouses, which he will market through COCAFCAL of which he is a partner. This project is very innovative as the tomato crop makes very good profits in addition to helping people grow part of their food.

Currently Edgar is apply for a loan to begin work in his greenhouse and thus start production as soon as possible. With the proceeds from his harvest Edgar expects to have revenues to start saving for his daughter's education, and also to start a savings account for his family.

A loan would help Edgar diversify his income and not depend entirely on his coffee business, thus ensuring that his family will always be provided for.

loans.use: to buy tomato plants, an antivirus muslin, organic fertilizers, and other materials needed for the construction of a greenhouse.

loans.name: Hussaini

texts.en:
Hussaini is maize farmer from Kurungofi village. As a member of Babban Gona, he is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hussaini would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hussaini can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Hussaini is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 31-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and three children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for three years. He is the only one responsible for meeting the needs of entire family.

Nazia's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories (e.g., pieces of cloth, lace, needles, a sewing machine, and other accessories), but due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for his business.

Therefore Nazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband to buy above these tailoring accessories to meet his business needs, so that her husband can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Nazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a 32-year-old single lady who studied as a beauty specialist in a specialized beauty center, and started in 2011 providing beauty services from her parent's house to make a living and improve her social and financial situation.

Ola is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy the necessary furniture to keep her house attractive and to meet customers' comfort needs. She hopes to continue developing her business so that she can open a separate beauty salon in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary furniture keep her house attractive and meet customers' comfort needs

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 35-year-old married father of one child. He is a Palestinian refugee. He is putting so much effort into improving his business production to improve his family's living standards.

Ahmad opened a shampoo and cleaning detergents factory five years ago, and is working hard to expand his production. Ahmad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a specialized blender necessary for increasing his business production and improving his living standards. He hopes to expand his products' distribution region in a well-managed way and achieve higher standards.

loans.use: to buy a specialized blender necessary for increasing his business production
